		<div class="wp-block-whitehouse-topper__content">
			
							<div class="wp-block-whitehouse-topper__eyebrow">
					<a href="https://www.whitehouse.gov/remarks/">Remarks<svg class="wp-block-whitehouse-topper__eyebrow--icon" width="11" height="11" viewBox="0 0 11 11" fill="none" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">
<path d="M0.724808 1.45055C0.732563 0.940756 1.15149 0.539597 1.66097 0.554084L8.18243 0.73743C8.43709 0.74459 8.66622 0.854307 8.83047 1.02583C8.99471 1.19735 9.09441 1.43101 9.09053 1.68575C9.08278 2.19554 8.66385 2.5967 8.15436 2.58221L3.85933 2.46146L10.0157 8.89043C10.3703 9.2608 10.3618 9.84465 9.99583 10.1951C9.62987 10.5455 9.04621 10.5288 8.69154 10.1584L2.5352 3.72945L2.46984 8.02568C2.46209 8.53547 2.04316 8.93663 1.53368 8.92214C1.02419 8.90766 0.617659 8.48345 0.625575 7.97383L0.724808 1.45055Z" fill="currentColor" />

</a>				</div>
			
							<h1 class="wp-block-whitehouse-topper__headline">
					REMARKS BY PRESIDENT TRUMP IN JOINT ADDRESS TO CONGRESS				</h1>
			
			
				<div class="wp-block-whitehouse-topper__meta">
					<div class="wp-block-whitehouse-topper__meta--byline-subcategory">
						
<div class="wp-block-whitehouse-byline-subcategory">
	The White House</div>
					</div>
					
					<div class="wp-block-whitehouse-topper__meta--date">
						<div class="wp-block-post-date"><time datetime="2025-03-06T18:04:25-05:00">March 6, 2025</time></div>					</div>
				</div>

			
					</div>
	</div>
</div>






<p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Thank you.&nbsp; (Applause.)&nbsp; Thank you very much.&nbsp; Thank you very much.&nbsp; Its a great honor.&nbsp; Thank you very much.&nbsp;</p>



<p>Speaker Johnson, Vice President Vance, the first lady of the United States &#8212; (applause) &#8212; members of the United States Congress, thank you very much.&nbsp;&nbsp;</p>



<p>And to my fellow citizens, America is back.&nbsp; (Applause.)</p>



<p>AUDIENCE:&nbsp; USA!&nbsp; USA!&nbsp; USA!&nbsp;</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Six weeks ago, I stood beneath the dome of this Capitol and proclaimed the dawn of the golden age of America.&nbsp; From that moment on, it has been nothing but swift and unrelenting action to usher in the greatest and most successful era in the history of our country.&nbsp;</p>



<p>We have accomplished more in 43 days than most administrations accomplished in four years or eight years, and we are just getting started.&nbsp; (Applause.)&nbsp; Thank you.&nbsp;</p>



<p>I return to this chamber tonight to report that America&#8217;s momentum is back, our spirit is back, our pride is back, our confidence is back, and the American dream is surging bigger and better than ever before.&nbsp; (Applause.)&nbsp; The American dream is unstoppable, and our country is on the verge of a comeback, the likes of which the world has never witnessed and perhaps will never witness again.&nbsp; Theres never been anything like it.&nbsp; (Applause.)</p>



<p>The presidential election of November 5th was a mandate like has not been seen in many decades.&nbsp; We won all seven swing states, giving us an electoral college victory of 312 votes.&nbsp; (Applause.)&nbsp; We won the popular vote &#8212;</p>



<p>REPRESENTATIVE GREEN:&nbsp; (Inaudible.)</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; &#8212; by big numbers and won counties in our country &#8212;</p>



<p>AUDIENCE:&nbsp; Booo &#8212;</p>



<p>AUDIENCE:&nbsp; USA!&nbsp; USA!&nbsp; USA!</p>



<p>REPRESENTATIVE GREEN:&nbsp; You are &#8212; you have no right to cut Medicaid.</p>



<p>AUDIENCE:&nbsp; USA!&nbsp; USA!&nbsp; USA!&nbsp;</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; &#8212; and won counties in our country 2,700 to 525 on a map that reads almost completely red for Republican.&nbsp; (Applause.)&nbsp;</p>



<p>Now, for the first time in modern history, more Americans believe that our country is headed in the right direction than the wrong direction.&nbsp; In fact, it&#8217;s an astonishing record: 27-point swing, the most ever.&nbsp; (Applause.)</p>



<p>Likewise, small-business optimism saw its single largest one-month gain ever recorded.&nbsp;</p>



<p>SPEAKER JOHNSON:&nbsp; Mr. President &#8212;</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; A 41-point jump.</p>

<p>Mr. President, you can continue.</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Thank you.</p>



<p>Over the past six weeks, I have signed nearly 100 executive orders and taken more than 400 executive actions &#8212; a record &#8212; to restore common sense, safety, optimism, and wealth all across our wonderful land.&nbsp; The people elected me to do the job, and I&#8217;m doing it.&nbsp; (Applause.)</p>



<p>In fact, it has been stated by many that the first month of our presidency &#8212; it&#8217;s our presidency &#8212; (applause) &#8212; is the most successful in the history of our nation by many.&nbsp; (Applause.)&nbsp; And what makes it even more impressive is that &#8212; do you know who number two is?&nbsp; George Washington.&nbsp; How about that?&nbsp; (Laughter and applause.)&nbsp; How about that?&nbsp; I don&#8217;t know about that list, but we&#8217;ll take it.&nbsp;</p>



<p>Within hours of taking the oath of office, I declared a national emergency on our southern border &#8212; (applause) &#8212; and I deployed the U.S. military and Border Patrol to repel the invasion of our country.&nbsp; And what a job they&#8217;ve done.&nbsp;</p>



<p>As a result, illegal border crossings last month were, by far, the lowest ever recorded. Ever.&nbsp; (Applause.)&nbsp; They heard my words, and they chose not to come.&nbsp; Much easier that way.&nbsp;</p>



<p>In comparison, under Joe Biden, the worst president in American history &#8212; (applause) &#8212; there were hundreds of thousands of illegal crossings a month, and virtually all of them, including murderers, drug dealers, gang members, and people from mental institutions and insane asylums, were released into our country.&nbsp; Who would want to do that?</p>



<p>This is my fifth such speech to Congress, and, once again, I look at the Democrats in front of me, and I realize there is absolutely nothing I can say to make them happy or to make them stand or smile or applaud.&nbsp; Nothing I can do.&nbsp; I could find a cure to the most devastating disease &#8212; a disease that would wipe out entire nations, or announce the answers to the greatest economy in history or the stoppage of crime to the lowest levels ever recorded, and these people sitting right here will not clap, will not stand, and certainly will not cheer for these astronomical achievements.&nbsp; They won&#8217;t do it no matter what.</p>



<p>Five times I&#8217;ve been up here.&nbsp; It&#8217;s very sad, and it just shouldn&#8217;t be this way.&nbsp; (Applause.)</p>



<p>So, Democrats sitting before me, for just this one night, why not join us in celebrating so many incredible wins for America?&nbsp; For the good of our nation, let&#8217;s work together and let&#8217;s truly make America great again.&nbsp; (Applause.)</p>



<p>Every day, my administration is fighting to deliver the change America needs, to bring a future that America deserves, and we&#8217;re doing it.&nbsp; This is a time for big dreams and bold action.&nbsp;</p>



<p>Upon taking office, I imposed an immediate freeze on all federal hiring, a freeze on all new federal regulations, and a freeze on all foreign aid.&nbsp; (Applause.)&nbsp; I terminated the ridiculous Green New Scam.&nbsp; I withdrew from the unfair Paris Climate Accord, which was costing us trillions of dollars that other countries were not paying.&nbsp; (Applause.)&nbsp; I withdrew from the corrupt World Health Organization.&nbsp; (Applause.)&nbsp; And I also withdrew from the anti-American U.N. Human Rights Council.&nbsp; (Applause.)</p>



<p>We ended all of Biden&#8217;s environmental restrictions that were making our country far less safe and totally unaffordable.&nbsp; And importantly, we ended the last administrations insane electric vehicle mandate, saving our autoworkers and companies from economic destruction.&nbsp; (Applause.)</p>



<p>To unshackle our economy, I have directed that for every 1 new regulation, 10 old regulations must be eliminated, just like I did in my very successful first term.&nbsp; (Applause.)&nbsp; And in that first term, we set records on ending unnecessary rules and regulations like no other president had done before.&nbsp;</p>



<p>We ordered all federal workers to return to the office.&nbsp; They will either show up for work in person or be removed from their job.&nbsp; (Applause.)&nbsp;&nbsp;</p>



<p>And we have ended weaponized government, where, as an example, a sitting president is allowed to viciously prosecute his political opponent, like me.&nbsp; How did that work out? (Laughter.)&nbsp; Not too good.&nbsp; (Applause.)&nbsp; Not too good.&nbsp;</p>



<p>And I have stopped all government censorship and brought back free speech in America.&nbsp; It&#8217;s back.&nbsp; (Applause.)&nbsp;</p>



<p>And two days ago, I signed an order making English the official language of the United States of America.&nbsp; (Applause.)&nbsp;&nbsp;</p>



<p>I renamed the Gulf of Mexico the Gulf of America.&nbsp; (Applause.)&nbsp;</p>



<p>And, likewise, I renamed &#8212; for a great president, William McKinley &#8212; Mount McKinley again.&nbsp; (Applause.)&nbsp; Beautiful Alaska.&nbsp; We love Alaska.</p>



<p>We&#8217;ve ended the tyranny of so-called diversity, equity, and inclusion policies all across the entire federal government and, indeed, the private sector and our military.&nbsp; (Applause.)&nbsp; And our country will be woke no longer.&nbsp; (Applause.)</p>



<p>We believe that whether you are a doctor, an accountant, a lawyer, or an air traffic controller, you should be hired and promoted based on skill and competence, not race or gender.&nbsp; Very important.&nbsp; (Applause.)&nbsp; You should be hired based on merit.&nbsp; And the Supreme Court, in a brave and very powerful decision, has allowed us to do so.</p>



<p>Thank you.&nbsp; Thank you very much.&nbsp; Thank you.&nbsp; (Applause.)</p>



<p>We have removed the poison of critical race theory from our public schools.&nbsp; And I signed an order making it the official policy of the United States government that there are only two genders: male and female.&nbsp; (Applause.)&nbsp;</p>



<p>I also signed an executive order to ban men from playing in women&#8217;s sports.&nbsp; (Applause.)&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Three years ago, Payton McNabb was an all-star high school athlete &#8212; one of the best &#8212; preparing for a future in college sports.&nbsp; But when her girls volleyball match was invaded by a male, he smashed the ball so hard in Payton&#8217;s face, causing traumatic brain injury, partially paralyzing her right side, and ending her athletic career.&nbsp; It was a shot like she&#8217;s never seen before.&nbsp; She&#8217;s never seen anything like it.</p>



<p>Payton is here tonight in the gallery.&nbsp; And, Payton, from now on, schools will kick the men off the girls team or they will lose all federal funding.&nbsp; (Applause.)&nbsp;</p>



<p>And if you really want to see numbers, just take a look at what happened in the woman&#8217;s boxing, weightlifting, track and field, swimming, or cycling, where a male recently finished a long-distance race five hours and 14 minutes ahead of a woman for a new record by five hours.&nbsp; Broke the record by five hours.&nbsp;</p>



<p>It&#8217;s demeaning for women, and it&#8217;s very bad for our country.&nbsp; We&#8217;re not going to put up with it any longer.&nbsp; (Applause.)&nbsp;</p>



<p>What I have just described is only a small fraction of the commonsense revolution that is now, because of us, sweeping the entire world.&nbsp; Common sense has become a common theme, and we will never go back.&nbsp; Never.&nbsp; Never going to let that happen.&nbsp; (Applause.)</p>



<p>Among my very highest priorities is to rescue our economy and get dramatic and immediate relief to working families.&nbsp; As you know, we inherited from the last administration an economic catastrophe and an inflation nightmare.&nbsp; Their policies drove up energy prices, pushed up grocery costs, and drove the necessities of life out of reach for millions and millions of Americans.&nbsp; Theyve never had anything like it.&nbsp;</p>



<p>We suffered the worst inflation in 48 years but perhaps even in the history of our country. They&#8217;re not sure.&nbsp; As president, I&#8217;m fighting every day to reverse this damage and make America affordable again.&nbsp; (Applause.)</p>



<p>Joe Biden especially let the price of eggs get out of control.</p>



<p>AUDIENCE:&nbsp; Booo &#8212;</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; The egg price is out of control, and we&#8217;re working hard to get it back down.&nbsp;</p>



<p>Secretary, do a good job on that.&nbsp; You inherited a total mess from the previous administration.&nbsp; Do a good job.&nbsp; (Applause.)&nbsp;</p>



<p>A major focus of our fight to defeat inflation is rapidly reducing the cost of energy.&nbsp; The previous administration cut the number of new oil and gas leases by 95 percent, slowed pipeline construction to a halt, and closed more than 100 power plants.&nbsp; We are opening up many of those power plants right now.&nbsp; (Applause.)&nbsp;</p>



<p>And, frankly, we have never seen anything like it.&nbsp; That&#8217;s why, on my first day in office, I declared a national energy emergency.&nbsp; (Applause.)&nbsp; As you&#8217;ve heard me say many times, we have more liquid gold under our feet than any nation on Earth and by far.&nbsp; And now Ive fully authorized the most talented team ever assembled to go and get it.&nbsp; It&#8217;s called drill, baby, drill.&nbsp; (Applause.)&nbsp;</p>



<p>My administration is also working on a gigantic natural gas pipeline in Alaska &#8212; among the largest in the world &#8212; where Japan, South Korea, and other nations want to be our partner with investments of trillions of dollars each.&nbsp; Theres never been anything like that one.&nbsp; It will be truly spectacular.&nbsp; It&#8217;s all set to go.&nbsp; The permitting is gotten.</p>



<p>And later this week, I will also take historic action to dramatically expand production of critical minerals and rare earths here in the USA.&nbsp; (Applause.)&nbsp;&nbsp;</p>



<p>To further combat inflation, we will not only be reducing the cost of energy, but well be ending the flagrant waste of taxpayer dollars.&nbsp; (Applause.)&nbsp; And to that end, I have created the brand-new Department of Government Efficiency  DOGE. (Applause.) Perhaps you&#8217;ve heard of it &#8212; perhaps &#8212; which is headed by Elon Musk, who is in the gallery tonight.&nbsp; (Applause.)</p>



<p>Thank you, Elon.&nbsp; He&#8217;s working very hard.&nbsp; He didn&#8217;t need this.&nbsp; (Laughs.)&nbsp; He didn&#8217;t need this.&nbsp; Thank you very much.&nbsp; We appreciate it.&nbsp; Everybody here, even this side, appreciates it, I believe.&nbsp; (Applause.)&nbsp; They just don&#8217;t want to admit that.</p>



<p>Just listen to some of the appalling waste we have already identified.</p>



<p>$22 billion from HHS to provide free housing and cars for illegal aliens.</p>



<p>$45 million for diversity, equity, and inclusion scholarships in Burma.</p>



<p>$40 million to improve the social and economic inclusion of sedentary migrants.&nbsp; Nobody knows what that is.&nbsp; (Laughter.)&nbsp;</p>



<p>$8 million to promote LGBTQI+ in the African nation of Lesotho, which nobody has ever heard of.&nbsp; (Laughter.)</p>



<p>$60 million for Indigenous peoples and Afro-Colombian empowerment in Central America.&nbsp; $60 million.</p>



<p>$8 million for making mice transgender.&nbsp; (Laughter.)&nbsp; This is real.</p>



<p>$32 million for a left-wing propaganda operation in Moldova.</p>



<p>$10 million for male circumcision in Mozambique.</p>



<p>$20 million for the Arab Sesame Street in the Middle East.&nbsp; Its a program.&nbsp; $20 million for a program.</p>



<p>$1.9 billion to recently created decarbonization of homes committee, headed up &#8212; and we know she&#8217;s involved &#8212; just at the last moment, the money was passed over &#8212; by a woman named Stacey Abrams.&nbsp; Have you ever heard of her?</p>

<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; He&#8217;s a real estate developer.&nbsp; He&#8217;s done very well.</p>

<p>And $101 million for DEI contracts at the Department of Education, the most ever paid.&nbsp; Nothing even like it.</p>



<p>Under the Trump administration, all of these scams &#8212; and there are far worse, but I didn&#8217;t think it was appropriate to talk about them.&nbsp; They&#8217;re so bad.&nbsp; Many more have been found out and exposed and swiftly terminated by a group of very intelligent, mostly young people, headed up by Elon.&nbsp; And we appreciate it.&nbsp; Weve found hundreds of billions of dollars of fraud.&nbsp; (Applause.)</p>



<p>And we&#8217;ve taken back the money and reduced our debt to fight inflation and other things.&nbsp; Taken back a lot of that money.&nbsp; We got it just in time.&nbsp;</p>



<p>AUDIENCE MEMBERS:&nbsp; (Inaudible.)</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; This is just the beginning.&nbsp; The Government Accountability Office, a federal government office, has estimated annual fraud of over $500 billion in our nation, and we are working very hard to stop it.&nbsp; We&#8217;re going to.</p>



<p>We&#8217;re also identifying shocking levels of incompetence and probable fraud in the Social Security program for our seniors and that our seniors and people that we love rely on.&nbsp; Believe it or not, government databases list 4.7 million Social Security members from people aged 100 to 109 years old.</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; It lists 3.6 million people from ages 110 to 119.&nbsp; I don&#8217;t know any of them.&nbsp; I know some people that are rather elderly, but not quite that elderly.&nbsp; (Laughter.)&nbsp;</p>



<p>3.47 million people from ages 120 to 129.&nbsp;</p>



<p>3.9 million people from ages 130 to 139.</p>



<p>3.5 million people from ages 140 to 149.</p>



<p>And money is being paid to many of them, and we&#8217;re searching right now.&nbsp;</p>



<p>In fact, Pam, good luck.&nbsp; Good luck.&nbsp; You&#8217;re going to find it.</p>



<p>But a lot of money is paid out to people because it just keeps getting paid and paid, and nobody does &#8212; and it really hurts Social Security and hurts our country.</p>



<p>1.3 million people from ages 150 to 159.&nbsp; And over 130,000 people, according to the Social Security databases, are age over 160 years old.&nbsp;&nbsp;</p>



<p>We have a healthier country than I thought, Bobby.&nbsp; (Laughter and applause.)</p>



<p>Including, to finish, 1,039 people between the ages of 220 and 229; one person between the age of 240 and 249; and one person is listed at 360 years of age.</p>



<p>AUDIENCE MEMBER:&nbsp; Joe Biden!&nbsp; (Laughter.)</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT: More than 100 years older than our country.&nbsp;</p>



<p>But we&#8217;re going to find out where that money is going, and it&#8217;s not going to be pretty.&nbsp;</p>



<p>By slashing all of the fraud, waste, and theft we can find, we will defeat inflation, bring down mortgage rates, lower car payments and grocery prices, protect our seniors, and put more money in the pockets of American families.&nbsp; (Applause.)&nbsp;</p>



<p>And today, interest rates took a beautiful drop &#8212; big, beautiful drop.&nbsp; It&#8217;s about time.</p>



<p>And in the near future, I want to do what has not been done in 24 years: balance the federal budget.&nbsp; We&#8217;re going to balance it.&nbsp; (Applause.)&nbsp;</p>



<p>With that goal in mind, we have developed in great detail what we are calling the gold card, which goes on sale very, very soon.&nbsp;&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; For $5 million, we will allow the most successful, job-creating people from all over the world to buy a path to U.S. citizenship.&nbsp; It&#8217;s like the green card but better and more sophisticated.&nbsp; (Laughter.)&nbsp; And these people will have to pay tax in our country.&nbsp; They won&#8217;t have to pay tax from where they came.&nbsp; The money that they&#8217;ve made, you wouldn&#8217;t want to do that, but they have to pay tax, create jobs.</p>



<p>They&#8217;ll also be taking people out of colleges and paying for them so that we can keep them in our country, instead of having them being forced out.&nbsp; Number one at the top school, as an example, being forced out and not being allowed to stay and create tremendous numbers of jobs and great success for a company out there.</p>



<p>So, while we take out the criminals, killers, traffickers, and child predators who were allowed to enter our country under the open border policy of these people &#8212; the Democrats, the Biden administration &#8212; the open border, insane policies that you&#8217;ve allowed to destroy our country &#8212; we will now bring in brilliant, hardworking, job-creating people.&nbsp; They&#8217;re going to pay a lot of money, and we&#8217;re going to reduce our debt with that money.&nbsp; (Applause.)</p>



<p>Americans have given us a mandate for bold and profound change.&nbsp; For nearly 100 years, the federal bureaucracy has grown until it has crushed our freedoms, ballooned our deficits, and held back America&#8217;s potential in every possible way.&nbsp; The nation founded by pioneers and risk-takers now drowns under millions and millions of pages of regulations and debt.&nbsp;</p>



<p>Approvals that should take 10 days to get instead take 10 years, 15 years, and even 20 years before youre rejected.&nbsp; Meanwhile, we have hundreds of thousands of federal workers who have not been showing up to work.&nbsp;</p>



<p>My administration will reclaim power from this unaccountable bureaucracy, and we will restore true democracy to America again.&nbsp;(Applause.)&nbsp; Any federal bureaucrat who resists this change will be removed from office immediately &#8212; (applause) &#8212; because we are draining the swamp.&nbsp; It&#8217;s very simple.&nbsp; And the days of rule by unelected bureaucrats are over.&nbsp; (Applause.)</p>



<p>And the next phase of our plan to deliver the greatest economy in history is for this Congress to pass tax cuts for everybody.&nbsp; Theyre in there.&nbsp; Theyre waiting for you to vote.&nbsp; (Applause.)&nbsp;</p>



<p>And Im sure that the people on my right &#8212; I dont mean the Republican right, but my right right here &#8212; Im sure youre going to vote for those tax cuts, because, otherwise, I dont believe the people will ever vote you into office.&nbsp; So, Im doing you a big favor by telling you that.&nbsp; (Applause.)</p>



<p>But I know this group is going to be voting for the taxes.&nbsp; (Applause.)</p>



<p>Thank you.&nbsp; It&#8217;s a very, very big part of our plan.&nbsp; We had tremendous success in our first term with it.&nbsp; A very big part of our plan.&nbsp; We&#8217;re seeking permanent income tax cuts all across the board.</p>



<p>And to get urgently needed relief to Americans hit especially hard by inflation, I&#8217;m calling for no tax on tips, no tax on overtime, and no tax on Social Security benefits for our great seniors. &nbsp;(Applause.)&nbsp;</p>



<p>(Addressing Speaker Johnson.)&nbsp; Good luck.</p>



<p>And I also want to make interest payments on car loans tax deductible but only if the car is made in America.&nbsp; (Applause.)&nbsp;&nbsp;</p>



<p>And, by the way, we&#8217;re going to have growth in the auto industry like nobody has ever seen.&nbsp; Plants are opening up all over the place.&nbsp; Deals are being made.&nbsp; Never seen. That&#8217;s a combination of the election win and tariffs.&nbsp;</p>



<p>It&#8217;s a beautiful word, isn&#8217;t it?&nbsp;</p>



<p>That, along with our other policies, will allow our auto industry to absolutely boom.&nbsp; It&#8217;s going to boom.&nbsp; Spoke to the majors today &#8212; all three &#8212; the top people, and they&#8217;re so excited.&nbsp; In fact, already, numerous car companies have announced that they will be building massive automobile plants in America, with Honda just announcing a new plant in Indiana, one of the largest anywhere in the world.&nbsp; (Applause.)&nbsp;</p>



<p>And this has taken place since our great victory on November 5th, a date which will hopefully go down as one of the most important in the history of our country.&nbsp; (Applause.)&nbsp;&nbsp;</p>



<p>In addition, as part of our tax cuts, we want to cut taxes on domestic production and all manufacturing.&nbsp; And just as we did before, we will provide 100 percent expensing.&nbsp; It will be retroactive to January 20th, 2025, and it was one of the main reasons why our tax cuts were so successful in our first term, giving us the most successful economy in the history of our country.&nbsp; First term &#8212; we had a great first term.&nbsp; (Applause.)&nbsp;</p>



<p>If you don&#8217;t make your product in America, however, under the Trump administration, you will pay a tariff and, in some cases, a rather large one.&nbsp; Other countries have used tariffs against us for decades, and now it&#8217;s our turn to start using them against those other countries.</p>



<p>On average, the European Union, China, Brazil, India, Mexico, and Canada &#8212; have you heard of them? &#8212; and countless other nations charge us tremendously higher tariffs than we charge them.&nbsp; It&#8217;s very unfair.&nbsp; India charges us auto tariffs higher than 100 percent.&nbsp; China&#8217;s average tariff on our products is twice what we charge them.&nbsp; And South Korea&#8217;s average tariff is four times higher.&nbsp; Think of that: four times higher.&nbsp; And we give so much help militarily and in so many other ways to South Korea, but that&#8217;s what happens.</p>



<p>This is happening by friend and foe.&nbsp; This system is not fair to the United States and never was.&nbsp; And so, on April 2nd &#8212; I wanted to make it April 1st, but I didn&#8217;t want to be accused of April Fool&#8217;s Day.&nbsp; (Laughter.)&nbsp; Just one day, which cost us a lot of money.&nbsp; (Laughter.)&nbsp; But we&#8217;re going to do it in April. I&#8217;m a very superstitious person. April 2nd, reciprocal tariffs kick in.&nbsp; And whatever they tariff us &#8212; other countries &#8212; we will tariff them.&nbsp; That&#8217;s reciprocal, back and forth.&nbsp; (Applause.)&nbsp; Whatever they tax us, we will tax them.</p>



<p>If they do non-monetary tariffs to keep us out of their market, then we will do non-monetary barriers to keep them out of our market.&nbsp; There&#8217;s a lot of that too.&nbsp; They don&#8217;t even allow us in their market.</p>



<p>We will take in trillions and trillions of dollars and create jobs like we have never seen before.&nbsp; I did it with China, and I did it with others.&nbsp; And the Biden administration couldn&#8217;t do anything about it because it was so much money.&nbsp; They couldn&#8217;t do anything about it.</p>



<p>We have been ripped off for decades by nearly every country on Earth, and we will not let that happen any longer.&nbsp; (Applause.)&nbsp;</p>



<p>Much has been said over the last three months about Mexico and Canada, but we have very large deficits with both of them.&nbsp; But even more importantly, they have allowed fentanyl to come into our country at levels never seen before, killing hundreds of thousands of our citizens and many very young, beautiful people &#8212; destroying families.&nbsp; Nobody has ever seen anything like it.&nbsp;</p>



<p>They are, in effect, receiving subsidies of hundreds of billions of dollars.&nbsp; We pay subsidies to Canada and to Mexico of hundreds of billions of dollars.&nbsp; And the United States will not be doing that any longer.&nbsp; We&#8217;re not going to do it any longer.&nbsp; (Applause.)</p>



<p>Thanks to our America First policies we&#8217;re putting into place, we have had $1.7 trillion of new investment in America in just the past few weeks.&nbsp; (Applause.)&nbsp; The combination of the election and our economic policies &#8212; the people of SoftBank, one of the most brilliant anywhere in the world, announced a $200 billion investment.&nbsp; OpenAI and Oracle &#8212; Larry Ellison &#8212; announced $500 billion investment, which they wouldn&#8217;t have done if Kamala had won.&nbsp; (Applause.)</p>



<p>Apple announced $500 billion investment.&nbsp; Tim Cook called me.&nbsp; He said, I cannot spend it fast enough.&nbsp; It&#8217;s going to be much higher than that, I believe.&nbsp; They&#8217;ll be building their plants here, instead of in China.&nbsp;</p>



<p>And just yesterday, Taiwan Semiconductor &#8212; the biggest in the world, most powerful in the world, has a tremendous amount &#8212; 97 percent of the market, announced a $165 billion investment to build the most powerful chips on Earth right here in the USA.&nbsp; (Applause.)&nbsp;</p>



<p>And we&#8217;re not giving them any money.&nbsp; Your CHIPS Act is a horrible, horrible thing.&nbsp; We give hundreds of billions of dollars, and it doesn&#8217;t mean a thing.&nbsp; They take our money, and they don&#8217;t spend it.&nbsp; All that meant to them &#8212; we&#8217;re giving them no money.&nbsp; All that was important to them was they didn&#8217;t want to pay the tariffs, so they came and they&#8217;re building.&nbsp; And many other companies are coming.&nbsp;&nbsp;</p>



<p>We don&#8217;t have to give them money.&nbsp; We just want to protect our businesses and our people.&nbsp; And they will come because they won&#8217;t have to pay tariffs if they build in America.&nbsp; And so, it&#8217;s very amazing.</p>



<p>You should get rid of the CHIP Act.&nbsp; And whatever is left over, Mr. Speaker, you should use it to reduce debt or any other reason you want to.&nbsp; (Applause.)&nbsp;</p>



<p>Our new trade policy will also be great for the American farmer &#8212; I love the farmer &#8212; (applause) &#8212; who will now be selling into our home market, the USA, because nobody is going to be able to compete with you.&nbsp; Because those goods that come in from other countries and companies, they&#8217;re really, really in a bad position in so many different ways.&nbsp; They&#8217;re uninspected.&nbsp; They may be very dirty and disgusting, and they come in and they pour in, and they hurt our American farmers.</p>



<p>The tariffs will go on agricultural product coming into America.&nbsp; And our farmers, starting on April 2nd &#8212; it may be a little bit of an adjustment period.&nbsp; We had that before, when I made the deal with China.&nbsp; Fifty billion dollars of purchases, and I said, Just bear with me, and they did.&nbsp; They did.&nbsp; Probably have to bear with me again, and this will be even better.&nbsp;&nbsp;</p>



<p>That was great.&nbsp; The problem with it was that Biden didn&#8217;t enforce it.&nbsp; He didn&#8217;t enforce it.&nbsp; Fifty billion dollars of purchases, and we were doing great, but Biden did not enforce it.&nbsp; And it hurt our farmers, but our farmers are going to have a field day right now.</p>



<p>So, to our farmers, have a lot of fun.&nbsp; I love you too.&nbsp; I love you too.&nbsp; (Applause.)&nbsp; Its all going to happen.</p>



<p>And I have also imposed a 25 percent tariff on foreign aluminum, copper, lumber, and steel, because if we don&#8217;t have, as an example, steel and lots of other things, we don&#8217;t have a military and, frankly, we just won&#8217;t have a country very long.</p>



<p>Here today is a proud American steelworker, fantastic person from Decatur, Alabama.&nbsp; Jeff Denard has been working at the same steel plant for 27 years in a job that has allowed him to serve as the captain of his local volunteer fire department; raise seven children with his beautiful wife, Nicole; and over the years, provide a loving home for more than 40 foster children.&nbsp; So great, Jeff.&nbsp; (Applause.)&nbsp;</p>



<p>Thank you, Jeff.&nbsp; Thank you, Jeff.&nbsp; (Applause.)</p>



<p>Stories like Jeff&#8217;s remind us that tariffs are not just about protecting American jobs.&nbsp; They&#8217;re about protecting the soul of our country.&nbsp; Tariffs are about making America rich again and making America great again.&nbsp; And it&#8217;s happening, and it will happen rather quickly.</p>



<p>There will be a little disturbance, but we&#8217;re okay with that.&nbsp; It won&#8217;t be much.&nbsp;</p>

<p>But if we truly care about protecting Americas children, no step is more crucial than securing America&#8217;s borders.&nbsp; Over the past four years, 21 million people poured into the United States.&nbsp; Many of them were murderers, human traffickers, gang members, and other criminals from the streets of dangerous cities all throughout the world.&nbsp; Because of Joe Biden&#8217;s insane and very dangerous open border policies, they are now strongly embedded in our country, but we are getting them out and getting them out fast.&nbsp; (Applause.)</p>

<p>Last year, a brilliant 22-year-old nursing student named Laken Riley &#8212; the best in her class, admired by everybody &#8212; went out for a jog on the campus of the University of Georgia.&nbsp; That morning, Laken was viciously attacked, assaulted, beaten, brutalized, and horrifically murdered.&nbsp; Laken was stolen from us by a savage illegal alien gang member who was arrested while trespassing across Biden&#8217;s open southern border and then set loose into the United States under the heartless policies of that failed administration.&nbsp; It was indeed a failed administration.</p>

I know him well.&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; I am pleased to report that, in January, the U.S. Army had its single best recruiting month in 15 years and that all armed services are having among the best recruiting results ever in the history of our services.&nbsp; Great job.&nbsp; Thank you.&nbsp; (Applause.)<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; We&#8217;re joined tonight by a young man, Jason Hartley, who knows the weight of that call of duty.&nbsp; Jason&#8217;s father, grandfather, and great-grandfather all wore the uniform.&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Jason tragically lost his dad, who was also a Los Angeles County sheriff&#8217;s deputy, when he was just a boy, and now he wants to carry on the family legacy of service.&nbsp; Jason is a senior in high school, a six-letter varsity athlete &#8212; a really good athlete, they say &#8212; a brilliant student, with a 4.46 &#8212; that&#8217;s good &#8212; GPA.&nbsp; (Laughter.)&nbsp; And his greatest dream is to attend the U.S. Military Academy at West Point.&nbsp; (Applause.)&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; And, Jason, that&#8217;s a very big deal getting in.&nbsp; That&#8217;s a hard one to get into.&nbsp; But I&#8217;m pleased to inform you that your application has been accepted.&nbsp; You will soon be joining the Corps of Cadets.&nbsp; (Applause.)&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Thank you.&nbsp; Jason, you&#8217;re going to be on the Long Gray Line, Jason.&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; As commander in chief, my focus is on building the most powerful military of the future.&nbsp; As a first step, I&#8217;m asking Congress to fund a state-of-the-art Golden Dome missile defense shield to protect our homeland, all made in the USA.&nbsp; (Applause.)&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; And Ronald Reagan wanted to do it long ago, but the technology just wasn&#8217;t there, not even close.&nbsp; But now we have the technology.&nbsp; It&#8217;s incredible, actually.&nbsp; And other places, they have it: Israel has it.&nbsp; Other places have it.&nbsp; And the United States should have it too.&nbsp; Right, Tim?&nbsp; Right?&nbsp; (Applause.)&nbsp; They should have it too.&nbsp; So, I want to thank you.&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; But it&#8217;s a very important.&nbsp; This is a very dangerous world.&nbsp; We should have it.&nbsp; We want to be protected.&nbsp; And we&#8217;re going to protect our citizens like never before.<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; To boost our defense industrial base, we are also going to resurrect the American shipbuilding industry, including commercial shipbuilding and military shipbuilding.&nbsp; (Applause.)</p>



<p><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; And for that purpose, I am announcing tonight that we will create a new Office of Shipbuilding in the White House and offer special tax incentives to bring this industry home to America, where it belongs.&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; We used to make so many ships.&nbsp; We don&#8217;t make them anymore very much, but we&#8217;re going to make them very fast, very soon.&nbsp; It will have a huge impact.<br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; To further enhance our national security, my administration will be reclaiming the Panama Canal, and we&#8217;ve already started doing it.&nbsp; (Applause.)<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Just today, a large American company announced they are buying both ports around the Panama Canal and lots of other things having to do with the Panama Canal and a couple of other canals.&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; The Panama Canal was built by Americans for Americans, not for others, but others could use it.&nbsp; But it was built at tremendous cost of American blood and treasure.&nbsp; Thirty-eight thousand workers died building the Panama Canal.&nbsp; They died of malaria.&nbsp; They died of snake bites and mosquitoes.&nbsp; Not a nice place to work.&nbsp; They paid them very highly to go there, knowing there was a 25 percent chance that they would die.&nbsp; The most expensive project, also, that was ever built in our country&#8217;s history, if you bring it up to modern-day costs.<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; It was given away by the Carter administration for $1, but that agreement has been violated very severely.&nbsp; We didn&#8217;t give it to China.&nbsp; We gave it to Panama, and we&#8217;re taking it back.&nbsp; (Applause.)<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; And we have Marco Rubio in charge.&nbsp; Good luck, Marco.&nbsp; (Laughter and applause.)&nbsp; Now we know who to blame if anything goes wrong.&nbsp; (Laughter.)&nbsp;</p>



<p>No, Marco has been amazing, and he&#8217;s going to do a great job.&nbsp; Think of it.&nbsp; He got a hundred votes.&nbsp; (Applause.)&nbsp; You know, he was approved with, actually, 99, but the 100th was this gentleman, and I feel very certain &#8212; so, let&#8217;s assume he got 100 votes.&nbsp; And I&#8217;m either very, very happy about that or Im very concerned about it.&nbsp; (Laughter.)&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; But he&#8217;s already proven &#8212; I mean, he&#8217;s a great gentleman.&nbsp; Hes respected by everybody.&nbsp; And we appreciate you voting for Marco.&nbsp; Hes going to do a fantastic job.&nbsp; Thank you.&nbsp; (Applause.)&nbsp; Thank you.&nbsp; Hes doing a great job.&nbsp; Great job.&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; And I also have a message tonight for the incredible people of Greenland.&nbsp; (Laughter.)&nbsp; We strongly support your right to determine your own future, and, if you choose, we welcome you into the United States of America.&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; We need Greenland for national security and even international security, and we&#8217;re working with everybody involved to try and get it.&nbsp; But we need it, really, for international world security.&nbsp; And I think we&#8217;re going to get it.&nbsp; One way or the other, we&#8217;re going to get it.&nbsp;&nbsp;</p>



<p>We will keep you safe.&nbsp; We will make you rich.&nbsp; And together, we will take Greenland to heights like you have never thought possible before.&nbsp;&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; It&#8217;s a very small population but very, very large piece of land and very, very important for military security.<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; America is once again standing strong against the forces of radical Islamic terrorism.&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Three and a half years ago, ISIS terrorists killed 13 American service members and countless others in the Abbey Gate bombing during the disastrous and incompetent withdrawal from Afghanistan &#8212; not that they were withdrawing; it was the way they withdrew.&nbsp; Perhaps the most embarrassing moment in the history of our country.&nbsp;&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Tonight, I am pleased to announce that we have just apprehended the top terrorist responsible for that atrocity, and he is right now on his way here to face the swift sword of American justice.&nbsp; (Applause.)<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; And I want to thank, especially, the government of Pakistan for helping arrest this monster.&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; This was a very momentous day for those 13 families, who I actually got to know very well, most of them, whose children were murdered, and the many people that were so badly &#8212; over 42 people &#8212; so badly injured on that fateful day in Afghanistan.&nbsp; What a horrible day.&nbsp; Such incompetence was shown that when Putin saw what happened, I guess he said, Wow, maybe this is my chance.&nbsp; That&#8217;s how bad it was.&nbsp; Should have never happened.&nbsp; Grossly incompetent people.&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; I spoke to many of the parents and loved ones, and they&#8217;re all in our hearts tonight.&nbsp; Just spoke to them on the phone.&nbsp; We had a big call.&nbsp; Every one of them called, and everybody was on the line, and they did nothing but cry with happiness.&nbsp; They were very happy &#8212; as happy as you can be under those circumstances.&nbsp; Their child, brother, sister, son, daughter was killed for no reason whatsoever.&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; In the Middle East, we&#8217;re bringing back our hostages from Gaza.&nbsp; In my first term, we achieved one of the most groundbreaking peace agreements in generations: the Abraham Accords.&nbsp; (Applause.)&nbsp;</p>



<p>And now we&#8217;re going to build on that foundation to create a more peaceful and prosperous future for the entire region.&nbsp; A lot of things are happening in the Middle East.&nbsp; People havent been talking about that so much lately with everything going on with Ukraine and Russia, but a lot of things are happening in the Middle East.&nbsp; Its a rough neighborhood, actually.<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; I&#8217;m also working tirelessly to end the savage conflict in Ukraine.&nbsp; Millions of Ukrainians and Russians have been needlessly killed or wounded in this horrific and brutal conflict with no end in sight.&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; The United States has sent hundreds of billions of dollars to support Ukraine&#8217;s defense with no security, with no anything.&nbsp; (Applause.)<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Do you want to keep it going for another five years?&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; SENATOR WARREN:&nbsp; Yes!<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Yeah.&nbsp; Yeah, you would say &#8212; Pocahontas says, Yes.&nbsp; (Laughter.)<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; AUDIENCE MEMBERS:&nbsp; Booo &#8212;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Two thousand people are being killed every single week &#8212; more than that.&nbsp; They&#8217;re Russian young people.&nbsp; They&#8217;re Ukrainian young people.&nbsp; They&#8217;re not Americans.&nbsp; But I want it to stop.<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Meanwhile, Europe has sadly spent more money buying Russian oil and gas than they have spent on defending Ukraine, by far.&nbsp; Think of that.&nbsp; They&#8217;ve spent more buying Russian oil and gas than they have defending.&nbsp; And we&#8217;ve spent, perhaps, $350 billion.&nbsp; Like taking candy from a baby, that&#8217;s what happened.&nbsp; And they&#8217;ve spent $100 billion.&nbsp; What a difference that is.&nbsp; And we have an ocean separating us, and they don&#8217;t.&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; But we&#8217;re getting along very well with them, and lots of good things are happening.&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Biden has authorized more money in this fight than Europe has spent by billions and billions of dollars.&nbsp; It&#8217;s hard to believe that they wouldn&#8217;t have stopped it and said, at some point, Come on.&nbsp; Let&#8217;s equalize.&nbsp; You got to be equal to us.&nbsp; But that didn&#8217;t happen.<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Earlier today, I received an important letter from President Zelenskyy of Ukraine.&nbsp; The letter reads, Ukraine is ready to come to the negotiating table as soon as possible to bring lasting peace closer.&nbsp; Nobody wants peace more than the Ukrainians, he said.&nbsp; (Applause.)&nbsp; My team and I stand ready to work under President Trump&#8217;s strong leadership to get a peace that lasts.&nbsp; We do really value how much America has done to help Ukraine maintain its sovereignty and independence.&nbsp; Regarding the agreement on minerals and security, Ukraine is ready to sign it at any time that is convenient for you.&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; I appreciate that he sent this letter.&nbsp; Just got it a little while ago.&nbsp;&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Simultaneously, we&#8217;ve had serious discussions with Russia and have received strong signals that they are ready for peace.&nbsp; Wouldn&#8217;t that be beautiful?&nbsp; Wouldn&#8217;t that be beautiful?&nbsp; (Applause.)&nbsp; Wouldn&#8217;t that be beautiful?<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; It&#8217;s time to stop this madness.&nbsp; It&#8217;s time to halt the killing.&nbsp; It&#8217;s time to end this senseless war.&nbsp; If you want to end wars, you have to talk to both sides.&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Nearly four years ago, amid rising tensions, a history teacher named Marc Fogel was detained in Russia and sentenced to 14 years in a penal colony.&nbsp; Rough stuff.&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; The previous administration barely lifted a finger to help him.&nbsp; They knew he was innocent, but they had no idea where to begin.&nbsp; But last summer, I promised his 95-year-old mother, Malphine, that we would bring her boy safely back home.<br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; After 22 days in office, I did just that, and they are here tonight.&nbsp; (Applause.)&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; To Marc and his great mom, we are delighted to have you safe and sound and with us.&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; As fate would have it, Marc Fogel was born in a small, rural town &#8212; in Butler, Pennsylvania &#8212; have you heard of it? &#8212; where his mother has lived for the past 78 years.<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; I just happened to go there last July 13th for a rally.&nbsp;That was not pleasant.&nbsp; (Laughter.)&nbsp; And that is where I met his beautiful mom, right before I walked onto that stage.&nbsp; And I told her I would not forget what she said about her son. &nbsp;And I never did, did I?&nbsp; Never forgot.&nbsp;&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Less than 10 minutes later, at that same rally, gunfire rang out, and a sick and deranged assassin unloaded eight bullets from his sniper&#8217;s perch into a crowd of many thousands of people.&nbsp;<br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; My life was saved by a fraction of an inch, but some were not so lucky.&nbsp; Corey Comperatore was a firefighter, a veteran, a Christian, a husband, a devoted father, and, above all, a protector.&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; When the sound of gunshots pierced the air &#8212; it was a horrible sound &#8212; Corey knew instantly what it was and what to do.&nbsp; He threw himself on top of his wife and daughters and shielded them from the bullets with his own body.<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Corey was hit really hard.&nbsp; You know the story from there.&nbsp; He sacrificed his life to save theirs.&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Two others &#8212; very fine people &#8212; were also seriously hit.&nbsp; But thankfully, with the help of two great country doctors, we thought they were gone, and they were saved.&nbsp; So, those doctors had great talent.&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; We&#8217;re joined by Corey&#8217;s wife, Helen, who was his high school sweetheart, and their two beloved daughters, Allyson and Kaylee.&nbsp; Thank you.&nbsp; (Applause.)<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; To Helen, Allyson, and Kaylee, Corey is looking down on his three beautiful ladies right now, and he is cheering you on.&nbsp; He loves you.&nbsp; He is cheering you on.&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Corey was taken from us much too soon, but his destiny was to leave us all with a shining example of the selfless devotion of a true American patriot.&nbsp; It was love like Coreys that built our country, and it&#8217;s love like Coreys that is going to make our country more majestic than ever before.&nbsp;&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; I believe that my life was saved that day in Butler for a very good reason.&nbsp; I was saved by God to make America great again.&nbsp; I believe that.&nbsp; (Applause.)&nbsp; Thank you.&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Thank you.&nbsp; Thank you very much.&nbsp;&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; From the patriots of Lexington and Concord to the heroes of Gettysburg and Normandy, from the warriors who crossed the Delaware to the trailblazers who climbed the Rockies, and from the legends who soared at Kitty Hawk to the astronauts who touched the Moon, Americans have always been the people who defied all odds, transcended all dangers, made the most extraordinary sacrifices, and did whatever it took to defend our children, our country, and our freedom.<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; And as we have seen in this chamber tonight, that same strength, faith, love, and spirit is still alive and thriving in the hearts of the American people.&nbsp; Despite the best efforts of those who would try to censor us, silence us, break us, destroy us, Americans are today a proud, free, sovereign, and independent nation that will always be free, and we will fight for it till death.&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; We will never let anything happen to our beloved country, because we are a country of doers, dreamers, fighters, and survivors.&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Our ancestors crossed a vast ocean, strode into the unknown wilderness, and carved their fortunes from the rock and soil of a perilous and very dangerous frontier.&nbsp; They chased our destiny across a boundless continent.&nbsp; They built the railroads, laid the highways, and graced the world with American marvels, like the Empire State Building, the mighty Hoover Dam, and the towering Golden Gate Bridge.&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; They lit the world with electricity, broke free of the force of gravity, fired up the engines of American industry, vanquished the communists, fascists, and Marxists all over the world, and gave us countless modern wonders sculpted out of iron, glass, and steel.&nbsp;&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; We stand on the shoulders of these pioneers who won and built the modern age, these workers who poured their sweat into the skylines of our cities, these warriors who shed their blood on fields of battle and gave everything they had for our rights and for our freedom.&nbsp;&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Now it is our time to take up the righteous cause of American liberty, and it is our turn to take America&#8217;s destiny into our own hands and begin the most thrilling days in the history of our country.&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; This will be our greatest era.&nbsp;&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; With God&#8217;s help, over the next four years, we are going to lead this nation even higher, and we are going to forge the freest, most advanced, most dynamic, and most dominant civilization ever to exist on the face of this Earth.&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; We are going to create the highest quality of life, build the safest and wealthiest and healthiest and most vital communities anywhere in the world.&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; We are going to conquer the vast frontiers of science, and we are going to lead humanity into space and plant the American flag on the planet Mars and even far beyond.&nbsp; (Applause.)<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; And, through it all, we are going to rediscover the unstoppable power of the American spirit, and we are going to renew unlimited promise of the American dream.&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Every single day, we will stand up and we will fight, fight, fight for the country our citizens believe in and for the country our people deserve.&nbsp; (Applause.)&nbsp; Thank you.&nbsp; Thank you.<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; AUDIENCE MEMBERS:&nbsp; Fight!&nbsp; Fight!&nbsp; Fight!<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; My fellow Americans, get ready for an incredible future, because the golden age of America has only just begun.&nbsp; It will be like nothing that has ever been seen before.&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Thank you.&nbsp; God bless you.&nbsp; And God bless America.&nbsp; (Applause.)<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Thank you.&nbsp; Thank you, everybody.&nbsp; Thank you.&nbsp; Thank you very much.&nbsp; Thank you very much.&nbsp; Thank you.&nbsp;</p>



<p>Thank you very much.&nbsp; Appreciate it.</p>



<p class="has-text-align-left">Thank you very much.<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; END&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 11:00 P.M. EST</p>
</div>
</main>

<script id="wp-block-template-skip-link-js-after">
	( function() {
		var skipLinkTarget = document.querySelector( 'main' ),
			sibling,
			skipLinkTargetID,
			skipLink;

		// Early exit if a skip-link target can't be located.
		if ( ! skipLinkTarget ) {
			return;
		}

		/*
		 * Get the site wrapper.
		 * The skip-link will be injected in the beginning of it.
		 */
		sibling = document.querySelector( '.wp-site-blocks' );

		// Early exit if the root element was not found.
		if ( ! sibling ) {
			return;
		}

		// Get the skip-link target's ID, and generate one if it doesn't exist.
		skipLinkTargetID = skipLinkTarget.id;
		if ( ! skipLinkTargetID ) {
			skipLinkTargetID = 'wp--skip-link--target';
			skipLinkTarget.id = skipLinkTargetID;
		}

		// Create the skip link.
		skipLink = document.createElement( 'a' );
		skipLink.classList.add( 'skip-link', 'screen-reader-text' );
		skipLink.href = '#' + skipLinkTargetID;
		skipLink.innerHTML = 'Skip to content';

		// Inject the skip link.
		sibling.parentElement.insertBefore( skipLink, sibling );
	}() );
	
</script>

280.603ZM375.967 256.943L373.951 258.078L388.768 240.966L389.995 242.974L375.967 256.943Z" fill="white" />
<path d="M220.348 428.216C216.351 428.216 213.088 427.171 210.558 425.081C208.028 422.991 206.469 420.113 205.883 416.446H213.143C213.473 418.39 214.279 419.893 215.563 420.956C216.883 422.02 218.423 422.551 220.183 422.551C222.126 422.551 223.703 421.91 224.913 420.626C226.159 419.343 226.783 417.363 226.783 414.686C226.783 412.083 226.178 410.121 224.968 408.801C223.794 407.445 222.218 406.766 220.238 406.766C218.954 406.766 217.799 407.041 216.773 407.591C215.746 408.141 214.976 408.911 214.463 409.901H207.973L209.898 388.066H232.063V393.731H212.813L216.333 392.741L215.233 406.326L213.033 405.941C213.913 404.585 215.049 403.503 216.443 402.696C217.836 401.89 219.596 401.486 221.723 401.486C224.253 401.486 226.453 402.036 228.323 403.136C230.229 404.236 231.714 405.776 232.778 407.756C233.878 409.7 234.428 412.046 234.428 414.796C234.428 417.62 233.841 420.04 232.668 422.056C231.494 424.036 229.863 425.558 227.773 426.621C225.683 427.685 223.208 428.216 220.348 428.216Z" fill="white" />
