	<div class="entry-content wp-block-post-content has-global-padding is-layout-constrained wp-block-post-content-is-layout-constrained">
<div class="alignfull has-wide-width wp-block-whitehouse-topper">
	<div class="wp-block-whitehouse-topper__inner-container">
		<div class="wp-block-whitehouse-topper__content">
			
							<div class="wp-block-whitehouse-topper__eyebrow">
					<a href="https://www.whitehouse.gov/remarks/">Remarks<svg class="wp-block-whitehouse-topper__eyebrow--icon" width="11" height="11" viewBox="0 0 11 11" fill="none" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">
<path d="M0.724808 1.45055C0.732563 0.940756 1.15149 0.539597 1.66097 0.554084L8.18243 0.73743C8.43709 0.74459 8.66622 0.854307 8.83047 1.02583C8.99471 1.19735 9.09441 1.43101 9.09053 1.68575C9.08278 2.19554 8.66385 2.5967 8.15436 2.58221L3.85933 2.46146L10.0157 8.89043C10.3703 9.2608 10.3618 9.84465 9.99583 10.1951C9.62987 10.5455 9.04621 10.5288 8.69154 10.1584L2.5352 3.72945L2.46984 8.02568C2.46209 8.53547 2.04316 8.93663 1.53368 8.92214C1.02419 8.90766 0.617659 8.48345 0.625575 7.97383L0.724808 1.45055Z" fill="currentColor" />
</svg>
</a>				</div>
			
							<h1 class="wp-block-whitehouse-topper__headline">
					REMARKS BY PRESIDENT TRUMP<br>ON INVESTMENT ANNOUNCEMENT				</h1>
			
			
				<div class="wp-block-whitehouse-topper__meta">
					<div class="wp-block-whitehouse-topper__meta--byline-subcategory">
						
<div class="wp-block-whitehouse-byline-subcategory">
	The White House</div>
					</div>
					
					<div class="wp-block-whitehouse-topper__meta--date">
						<div class="wp-block-post-date"><time datetime="2025-03-03T20:25:32-05:00">March 3, 2025</time></div>					</div>
				</div>

			
					</div>
	</div>
</div>



<p class="has-text-align-center">Roosevelt Room</p>



<p>2:38 P.M. EST<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Hello, everybody.&nbsp; Thank you very much.</p>



<p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Thank you very much.&nbsp; This is a very big day for a lot of reasons, but this gentleman is a very unique man.&nbsp; I think I can say, in the world of chips, certainly, but in the world pretty much of business, nobody has done what hes done.&nbsp; For those of you that are into that world, you would say, Wow, hes a legend.&nbsp; But he is a legend.&nbsp; And its an honor to be with you.&nbsp; Very great honor.&nbsp; Thank you very much.</p>



<p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; MR. WEI:&nbsp; Thank you, Mr. President.</p>



<p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Thank you very much.</p>



<p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Welcoming, from TSMC &#8212; which is the biggest there is, at a level that you cant even calculate, frankly &#8212; C.C. Wei, to the White House for a very historic announcement.&nbsp; This is a tremendous thing for our country and, hopefully, for his company.&nbsp;</p>



<p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Were also pleased to be joined by Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick and White House AI and crypto czar, David Sacks, another two very highly respected people.&nbsp; Its great to have you guys involved.&nbsp; And, David, thank you very much for coming on.</p>



<p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; David is sort of the king of intellect in that world.&nbsp; We have some good people.<br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Today, Taiwan Semiconductor is announcing that they will be investing at least $100 billion dollars in new capital in the United States over the next short period of time to build state-of-the-art semiconductor manufacturing facilities.&nbsp; I think, mostly, its going to be in Arizona, which is what I understand, which is a great state.&nbsp; I like it because I won it.&nbsp; But I won most of them &#8212; (laughs) &#8212; actually.&nbsp; So &#8212; but I did.&nbsp; We won it, and we won it big.</p>



<p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; The most powerful AI chips in the world will be made right here in America, and itll be a big percentage of the chips made by his company.&nbsp; But, as you know, theyre based mostly in Taiwan.&nbsp; And theyre far and away the biggest.&nbsp; Theres nobody even close.&nbsp;</p>



<p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; This $100 billion in new investment will go into building five cutting-edge fabrication facilities in the great state that we just discussed, Arizona, and will create thousands of jobs &#8212; many thousands of jobs, and theyre high-paying jobs.<br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; In total, todays announcement brings Taiwan Semiconductor investments to about $165 billion &#8212; theyve started already &#8212; among the largest new foreign direct investments in United States.</p>



<p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Apple, as you know, made a big announcement last week of $500 billion, and we have some others that have announced.&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; We have many that want to announce.&nbsp; But I dont have time to do all of these announcements, I tell you.&nbsp; But, for you, Im doing the announcement.</p>



<p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; MR. WEI:&nbsp; Thank you.</p>



<p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; This will create hundreds of billions of dollars in economic activity and boost Americas dominance in artificial intelligence and beyond.&nbsp;</p>



<p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Semiconductors are the backbone of the 21st century economy &#8212; and, really, without the semiconductors, there is no economy &#8212; powering everything from AI to automobiles to advanced manufacturing.&nbsp; And we must be able to build the chips and semiconductors that we need right here, in American factories, with American skill and American labor.&nbsp; And thats exactly what were doing.</p>



<p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; As you know, Taiwan pretty much has a monopoly on that market.&nbsp; And I think pretty much is not a term thats even appropriate.&nbsp; They do have a monopoly.&nbsp; And this is a tremendous move by the most powerful company in the world.&nbsp;</p>



<p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Its a matter of economic security.&nbsp; Its also a matter of national security for us.&nbsp; And, at the same time, Mr. Wei will be able to diversify and have his tremendous presence in another place and a very safe place.&nbsp; And I want to thank Taiwan Semiconductor for doing the announcement.&nbsp;&nbsp;</p>



<p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; And Id like to ask Mr. Wei to say a few words, if you might.</p>



<p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; And Id also like to ask Howard and David &#8212; you can say a couple of words.&nbsp; But maybe you should go first because, right now, hes the most important man in the room.&nbsp; Im sorry, fellas.</p>



<p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Please.</p>



<p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Thank you very much.&nbsp; Thank you.&nbsp; Great honor.&nbsp;&nbsp;</p>



<p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; MR. WEI:&nbsp; Thank you, Mr. President.</p>



<p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Thank you.</p>



<p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; MR. WEI:&nbsp; I&#8217;m a &#8212; Im a little bit nervous, so I have to pull out my piece of paper.</p>



<p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Mr. President, Secretary Lutnick &#8212; and, David, I didn&#8217;t know that &#8212; your title, but &#8212; okay.</p>



<p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; First, I want to thank &#8212; say thank you to Mr. President to give me this opportunity to announce our big project in the U.S.&nbsp;<br><br>TSMC is the world&#8217;s largest chip manufacturing, founded by Dr. Morris Chang in 1987.&nbsp; Its now at the forefront of semiconductor technology, supporting AI advancement and industry growth.&nbsp;</p>



<p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; In fact, I would like to wind back the time that in 2020 we have to thank President Trump&#8217;s vision and his support.&nbsp; So, TSMC start the journey of establishing the advanced chip manufacturing in Arizona.&nbsp; And now, let me proudly say, now the vision become reality.&nbsp;&nbsp;</p>



<p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; In Phoenix, Arizona, with 3,000 employees, we are producing the most advanced chip made on U.S. soil with the success of our first fab.&nbsp;</p>



<p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; So, we are now very happy to announce we are going to invest additional 100 billion U.S. dollar in addition to our current 65-billion-U.S.-dollars investment in Arizona.&nbsp; We are going to build three more new fab &#8212; be- &#8212; after we promised the three fabs already, and another two very advanced packaging fab, and, most important, an R&amp;D center, also in Arizona.&nbsp;</p>



<p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; For this, all the investment &#8212; $165 billion &#8212; is going to create thousand of the high-paid job, as the president just announced.&nbsp; And we are, most important &#8212; actually, we are going to produce many AI chips.&nbsp; We are going to produce many chips to support AIs progress and to support the smartphones progress.&nbsp;<br>And, again, with that, I want to thank President Trump again for his support.&nbsp; In addition, I also want to thank my customers in the U.S., such as Apple, Nvidia, AMD, Qualcomm, Broadcom.&nbsp; They all support TSMCs manufacturing in the U.S.&nbsp; Without their support, we probably cannot make it true.&nbsp;<br><br>So, again, I want to thank them.&nbsp; Also, I&#8217;d like to thank the TSMCs employee.&nbsp; Without their effort, we just cannot make it today.&nbsp;<br><br>That&#8217;s all I want to say.&nbsp; And thank you.&nbsp;<br><br>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Thank you.&nbsp; Thats great.&nbsp; (Applause.)&nbsp; Thank you very much.&nbsp;<br><br>Howard, please.&nbsp; David.<br><br>SECRETARY LUTNICK:&nbsp; Sure.<br><br>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Thank you.&nbsp;<br><br>SECRETARY LUTNICK:&nbsp; So, I&#8217;m thrilled to be here today, because President Trump has made it a fundamental objective to bring semiconductor chip manufacturing home to America.&nbsp;<br><br>Under the Biden administration, TSMC received a $6 billion grant, and that encouraged them to build $65 billion.&nbsp; So, America gave TSMC 10 percent of the money to build here.&nbsp; And now you&#8217;re seeing the power of Donald Trump&#8217;s presidency, because TSMC, the greatest manufacturer of chips in the world, is coming to America with $100 billion investment.&nbsp; And, of course, that is backed by the fact that they can come here because they can avoid paying tariffs.&nbsp;<br><br>So, the idea is: Come to America.&nbsp; Build greatness in America.&nbsp; Build for the American customers &#8212; the Apple, Nvidia, that whole list that Chairman Wei gave &#8212; in order to bring production to America.&nbsp;<br>So, we&#8217;re really, really excited.&nbsp; This continues the most incredible path you&#8217;ve ever seen, in these first weeks and months of the Trump administration, of incredible manufacturing coming to America.&nbsp; The keys that the president has called out are coming here.&nbsp; They&#8217;re coming here in huge size because they want to be in the greatest market in the world, and they want to avoid the tariffs that, if they&#8217;re not here, they&#8217;d have to suffer.&nbsp;<br><br>So, I want to congratulate C.C. Wei for bringing in this incredible $100 billion investment, but it&#8217;s on the shoulders of our president, Donald Trump, which is why he&#8217;s coming.&nbsp;<br><br>So, thank you.&nbsp;&nbsp;<br><br>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Thank you.<br><br>David. &nbsp;<br><br>MR. SACKS:&nbsp; Thank you, sir.&nbsp; Well, the products that TSMC makes are literally the most important products in the world.&nbsp; I mean, these advanced chips power everything.&nbsp; They power AI.&nbsp; They power your phone.&nbsp; They power your cars.&nbsp; And without them, the whole modern economy would stop, but they&#8217;re not made in the United States.&nbsp;<br><br>So, for TSMC to move here is a huge, huge development, and we owe that to President Trump&#8217;s leadership on the economy and Secretary Lutnick as well.&nbsp; And, C.C., thank you for &#8212; for coming here.&nbsp;<br><br>Thank you.&nbsp; Yeah.<br><br>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Thank you, David.&nbsp;<br><br>So, thank you very much.&nbsp; A big percentage of chips with this investment will be made now &#8212; a big percentage.&nbsp; Worldwide, we had very little.&nbsp; Almost none.&nbsp; We used to have a lot with Intel.&nbsp; But we had very little.&nbsp; And we&#8217;ll be at close to 40 percent of the market with this transaction and a couple of others that we&#8217;re doing.&nbsp; That&#8217;s a tremendous leap &#8212; like, a leap that nobody would have really said was possible.&nbsp;<br><br>So, I just want to thank you all for being here.&nbsp; If you want a couple of questions.<br><br>(Cross-talk.)<br><br>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; On the &#8212;&nbsp;<br><br>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Ideally on this subject.&nbsp;<br><br>Yes, please.&nbsp;<br><br>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &#8212; specific number of jobs it will create.&nbsp;&nbsp; He said thousands &#8212;<br><br>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; They &#8212; yeah.<br><br>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &#8212; but do you have a better &#8212;<br><br>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; They &#8212; you&#8217;re probably talking about 25,000 jobs.&nbsp; But it&#8217;ll get bigger and bigger with time.&nbsp; Knowing this gentleman, it&#8217;ll get bigger and bigger.&nbsp; There&#8217;ll be no stopping him.&nbsp; (Laughs.)<br><br>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Mr. President, what more &#8212;<br><br>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Yeah.&nbsp; Brian, go ahead.<br><br>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Right.&nbsp; In addition to the jobs, you talked about national security, and that&#8217;s one thing I think a lot of Americans &#8212;<br><br>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Yeah.&nbsp;<br><br>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &#8212; at home don&#8217;t understand.&nbsp; Explain the national security aspect of this.&nbsp;<br><br>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Well, without the chips and semiconductors, nothing runs today.&nbsp; You can&#8217;t buy a car without them.&nbsp; You can&#8217;t get a radio, a television, nothing &#8212; you can&#8217;t get anything.&nbsp; And we thought it was very important &#8212; obviously, business was, but we thought even to terms of national security, to have this large percentage of the chips, semiconductors, and other things that they make &#8212; the most important product, and not a product that you can really copy.&nbsp; It takes years and years.&nbsp;&nbsp;<br><br>Youre on the needle of a pin is total genius.&nbsp; I mean, they can put things &#8212; I mean, something the size of the needle, the point of a pin, they put information that is just not even believable.&nbsp;<br><br>So, if you would &#8212;&nbsp;<br><br>(Cross-talk.)&nbsp;<br><br>If you would see this, it&#8217;s just really something.&nbsp;<br><br>Yes, Brian.&nbsp;<br><br>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Can I &#8212; one &#8212; one more aspect to that.&nbsp; Honda &#8212;<br><br>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Yeah.&nbsp;<br><br>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &#8212; announced theyre coming to Indiana because of the tariffs.&nbsp; Once again &#8212;<br><br>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Thats right.<br><br>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &#8212; youre bringing additional jobs in manufacturing.&nbsp; Do you want to comment on that as well?<br><br>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Well, Honda is coming, and I told you about Apple, that they&#8217;re going to be starting to build massively here &#8212; $500 billion.&nbsp; And we have many other companies.&nbsp; Its going to be announced, but we had many that have already announced.&nbsp; And no, it&#8217;s going to be great.&nbsp; It&#8217;s looking &#8212; it&#8217;s looking really strong.&nbsp; I don&#8217;t think this country has ever seen anything like we&#8217;re seeing right now.&nbsp;<br><br>Now, the tariffs, as you know, it will start a week earlier than the reciprocal, which is going to be on &#8212; a couple of weeks earlier.&nbsp; Reciprocal tariffs start on April 2nd.&nbsp; And I wanted to make it April 1st, but I didn&#8217;t want to do &#8212; I didn&#8217;t want to go April Fool&#8217;s Day &#8212; (laughter) &#8212; because that cost me &#8212; that costs a lot of money, but &#8212; that one day.&nbsp; So, we&#8217;re going April 2nd.<br><br>But very importantly, tomorrow, tariffs &#8212; 25 percent on Canada and 25 percent on Mexico, and that&#8217;ll start.&nbsp; So, they&#8217;re going to have to have a tariff.&nbsp; So, what theyll have to do is build their car plants, frankly, and other things in the United States &#8212; in which case, they have no tariffs.&nbsp; In other words, you build &#8212; and this is exactly what Mr. Wei is doing by building here.&nbsp; Otherwise, they&#8217;ll build &#8212; if they did them in Taiwan to send them here, they&#8217;ll have 25 percent or 30 percent or 50 percent or whatever the number may be someday.&nbsp; Itll go only up.&nbsp; But by doing it here, he has no tariffs, so he&#8217;s way ahead of the game.&nbsp;<br><br>And I would just say this to people in Canada or Mexico, if they&#8217;re going to build car plants, the people that are doing them are much better off building here, because we have the market.&nbsp; We&#8217;re the market where they sell the most.&nbsp;&nbsp;<br><br>And so, I think it&#8217;s going to be very exciting.&nbsp; Very exciting for the automobile companies.&nbsp; Very exciting for &#8212; I can think of any &#8212; as an example, North Carolina, they had the great &#8212; I used to go there to buy furniture for hotels, and it&#8217;s been wiped out.&nbsp; That business all went to other countries, and now it&#8217;s all going to come back into North Carolina &#8212; the furniture manufacturing business.<br><br>Please.&nbsp;&nbsp;<br><br>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Mr. President &#8212;<br><br>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Is the Ukraine minerals deal now dead, or can it be revived?&nbsp; What &#8212; whats your &#8212;<br><br>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Well, I&#8217;ll let you know.&nbsp; We&#8217;re making a speech &#8212; you probably heard about it &#8212; tomorrow night, so I&#8217;ll let you know tomorrow night.&nbsp;<br><br>But, no, I don&#8217;t think so.&nbsp; I think it&#8217;s &#8212; look, it&#8217;s a great deal for us, because, you know, Biden very, very, foolishly &#8212; stupidly, frankly &#8212; gave $300 billion and &#8212; $350 billion, more accurately &#8212; to a country to fight and to try and do things.&nbsp; And you know what happened?&nbsp; We get nothing.&nbsp; We get nothing &#8212; just gave it.&nbsp;<br><br>We could have rebuilt our entire U.S. Navy with $350 billion.&nbsp; Think of it.&nbsp; Three hundred and fifty billion, we could have rebuilt our U.S. Navy.<br><br>So, he gave it away as fast as the money could be gone.&nbsp; And what we&#8217;re doing is getting that all back and a lot more than that.&nbsp; And what we need &#8212; its very important for this business that we&#8217;re talking about here, with chips and semiconductors and everything else &#8212; we need rare earths.&nbsp; And the deal we have is we have the finest rare earths that you can.&nbsp;<br><br>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Sir, on Ukraine.&nbsp; Sir, on Ukraine.</p>



<p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Are you going to press back &#8212;<br><br>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Thank you, Mr. President.&nbsp; What do you need to see from President Zelenskyy to restart these negotiations?<br><br>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Well, I just think he should be more appreciative, because this country has stuck with them through thick and thin.&nbsp; We&#8217;ve given them much more than Europe, and Europe should have given more than us, because, as you know, that&#8217;s right there.&nbsp; That&#8217;s the border.&nbsp;<br><br>This country really was like the fence on the border.&nbsp; It was very important to Europe.&nbsp; And I&#8217;m not knocking Europe, I&#8217;m saying theyre just &#8212; they were a lot smarter than Joe Biden, because Joe Biden didn&#8217;t have a clue.&nbsp; He just gave money hand over a fist, and they should have been able to equalize with us.&nbsp;<br><br>In other words, if we gave a dollar, they should have given.&nbsp; Well, we gave $350 billion.&nbsp; They probably gave 100, but on top of it all, they get their money back, because they are doing it in the form of a loan, and it&#8217;s a secured loan.&nbsp;&nbsp;<br><br>So, when I saw that, which I&#8217;ve known about for a little while, I said, It&#8217;s time for us to be smart.&nbsp; At the same time, it&#8217;s great for them, because they get us in the country taking the rare earth, which is going to fuel this big engine, and especially the engine that we&#8217;ve, in a very short time, created.&nbsp; And we get something, and we&#8217;re in the &#8212; we&#8217;re there.&nbsp; We have a presence there.&nbsp;<br><br>With all of that being said, I want one thing to happen: I want all of those young people to stop being killed.&nbsp; They&#8217;re being killed by the thousands every single week.&nbsp; Last week, 2,700 were killed.&nbsp; Twenty-seven hundred young &#8212; in this case, just about, all young boys from Ukraine and from Russia.&nbsp; And that&#8217;s not young people from the United States, but it&#8217;s on a human basis.&nbsp;<br><br>I want to see it stop.&nbsp; The money is one thing, but the death.&nbsp; And they&#8217;re losing thousands of soldiers a week, and that&#8217;s not including the people that get killed every time a town goes down or a missile goes into a town.<br><br>(Cross-talk.)<br><br>We &#8212; and &#8212; and I want to see it stop.&nbsp;<br><br>Yes.&nbsp;&nbsp;<br><br>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Mr. President, are you considering canceling military aid to Ukraine?&nbsp; And can we get a reaction to what the Kremlin just said, that your administration is bringing U.S. worldview in alignment with Moscows?&nbsp;&nbsp;<br><br>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; So, this is a deal that should have never happened.&nbsp; This is a deal that would have never happened, and it didn&#8217;t happen &#8212; for four years, it didn&#8217;t happen.&nbsp; It was never even close to happening.&nbsp; If I were president, would not have happened.&nbsp; And October 7th would have &#8212; would not have happened in Israel.&nbsp; And inflation wouldn&#8217;t have happened.&nbsp;<br><br>And Afghanistan, disastrous &#8212; the way they withdrew &#8212; not the fact that they withdrew but the way they withdrew &#8212; would have never happened.&nbsp; And we would have had Bagram right now instead of China having it.&nbsp; It was one hour away from where China makes their nuclear weapons.&nbsp; We would have kept Bagram &#8212; one of the biggest air bases in the world.&nbsp;<br><br>All of these things happened, and it&#8217;s a shame.&nbsp; But it is what it is, and now we&#8217;re here.&nbsp; I want to see it end fast.&nbsp; I don&#8217;t want to see this go on for years and years.<br><br>Now, President Zelenskyy supposedly made a statement today in AP &#8212; I&#8217;m not a big fan of AP, so maybe it was an incorrect statement &#8212; but he said he thinks the war is going to go on for a long time, and he better not be right about that.&nbsp; That&#8217;s all I&#8217;ll say.<br><br>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Mr. President, is there any &#8212;</p>



<p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Could this project &#8212; could this minimize the impact of the U.S. with chips should China decide to isolate Taiwan or China decide to take Taiwan?&nbsp;<br><br>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Well, it&#8217;s a very interesting point.&nbsp; It&#8217;s a great question, actually.&nbsp; But this would certainly &#8212; I can&#8217;t say minimize.&nbsp; That would be a catastrophic event, obviously.&nbsp; But it will at least give us a position where we have &#8212; in this very, very important business, we would have a very big part of it in the United States.&nbsp; So, it would have a big impact if something should happen with Taiwan.<br><br>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; And with Russia sanctions, are you looking at relieving Russian sanctions if there is a peace deal?<br><br>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Well, we&#8217;re going to make deals with everybody to get this war, including Europe and European nations.&nbsp; And they&#8217;ve acted very well.&nbsp; You know, they&#8217;re good people.&nbsp; I know; most of them are friends of mine &#8212; the heads of state, the heads of the various countries, prime ministers from the different &#8212; I got four prime ministers and five presidents called me over the last two days, and they want to work it out.&nbsp; They want to get it worked out.&nbsp;&nbsp;<br><br>And I think they&#8217;re also &#8212; you know, they&#8217;re talking money, but the money is less important than the deaths.&nbsp; We&#8217;re talking thousands of young people a week.&nbsp; And people would say why do I care about Ukraine, young people; why do I care about &#8212; and not all young, but they&#8217;re pretty young.&nbsp; You know, Ukraine is running a little bit low, and they&#8217;re getting older.&nbsp; They&#8217;re recruiting older people.&nbsp; It&#8217;s a very, very sad thing that&#8217;s happening over there, and we want to get it finished.&nbsp; We want to stop the death.&nbsp;<br><br>(Cross-talk.)<br><br>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Mr. President, on the tariffs.&nbsp; Is there any room left for Canada and Mexico to make a deal before midnight?&nbsp; And should we expect those Chinese tariffs, the extra 10 percent to take effect tomorrow?<br><br>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; No room left for Mexico or for Canada.&nbsp; No, the tariffs, you know, they&#8217;re all set.&nbsp; They go into effect tomorrow.<br><br>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Mr. President, just a follow-up on my colleagues question.&nbsp; Hearing &#8212;<br><br>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; And just so you understand, vast amounts of fentanyl have poured into our country from Mexico and, as you know, also from China, where it goes to Mexico and goes to Canada.&nbsp; And China also had an additional 10, so it&#8217;s 10 plus 10.&nbsp;&nbsp;<br><br>And it comes in from Canada, and it comes in from Mexico, and that&#8217;s a very important thing to say.<br><br>Yeah, please.&nbsp; Go ahead.<br><br>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Have you decided if you&#8217;re going to suspend military aid to Ukraine?&nbsp; Have you made that decision?<br><br>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Well, I haven&#8217;t even talked about that right now.&nbsp; I mean, right now, we&#8217;ll see what happens.&nbsp; A lot of things are happening right now, as we speak &#8212; I mean, literally as we speak.&nbsp; I could give you an answer and go back to my office &#8212; the beautiful Oval Office.&nbsp; I could go back into the Oval Office and find out that the answer is obsolete.<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; It&#8217;s like his business.&nbsp; It&#8217;s obsolete.&nbsp; You come up with a new chip, and it&#8217;s obsolete about two minutes later, right?&nbsp; But that&#8217;s what&#8217;s good about his business.&nbsp; That&#8217;s why he&#8217;s the only one that&#8217;s successful in it.&nbsp; But &#8212;&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; And on tariffs, sir.<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Mr. President, just to follow up my colleagues question from Russia is saying that your foreign policy is largely in line with their vision.&nbsp; Should that be concerning to Americans?&nbsp;<br><br>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Said what?<br><br>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Should that be concerning to Americans?<br><br>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Read the statement.<br><br>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; That Russia &#8212; Russia says that your administration&#8217;s foreign policy is, quote, largely in line with their vision.<br><br>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Well, I tell you what, I think it takes two to tango, and you&#8217;re going to have to make a deal with Russia, and you&#8217;re going to have to make a deal with Ukraine.&nbsp; You&#8217;re going to have to have the ascent, and you&#8217;re going to have to have the consent from the European nations, because I think that&#8217;s important, and from us.&nbsp;<br><br>I think everybody has to get into a room, so to speak, and we have to make a deal.&nbsp; And the deal could be made very fast.&nbsp; It should not be that hard a deal to make.&nbsp; It could be made very fast.&nbsp;<br><br>Now, maybe somebody doesn&#8217;t want to make a deal, and if somebody doesn&#8217;t want to make a deal, I think that person won&#8217;t be around very long.&nbsp; That person will not be listened to very long.&nbsp; Because I believe that Russia wants to make a deal.&nbsp; I believe, certainly, the people of Ukraine want to make a deal.&nbsp; They&#8217;ve suffered more than anybody else.&nbsp; We talk about suffering &#8212; they&#8217;ve suffered.<br><br>But if you think about it, under President Bush, they got Georgia, right?&nbsp; Russia got Georgia.&nbsp; Under President Obama, they got a nice, big submarine base, a nice big chunk of land where they have their submarines.&nbsp; You know that, right?&nbsp; Crimea.&nbsp; Under President Trump, they got nothing.&nbsp; And under President O-Biden, they tried to get the whole thing.&nbsp; They tried to get the whole big Ukraine, the whole thing.&nbsp; If I didn&#8217;t get in here, they wouldve gotten the whole thing.&nbsp;&nbsp;<br><br>So, I can only say &#8212; you can go back to Bush, you go back to Obama, and go back to Biden &#8212; they took a lot.&nbsp; The only one they didn&#8217;t get &#8212; you know what I gave them?&nbsp; I gave them anti-tank missiles.&nbsp; That&#8217;s what I gave them.&nbsp; I gave them sanctions on Russia &#8212; on Russia.&nbsp; I gave them Javelins.&nbsp; You know the Javelins?&nbsp; You know when they took out all those tanks?<br><br>You know, the tanks were heading to Kyiv by the hundreds, and they were unstoppable, and I gave them Javelins.&nbsp;<br><br>So, you know, I really &#8212; Putin is the one that will tell you this has not been so good for them.&nbsp; The fact is that I just want fairness.&nbsp; I want fairness.&nbsp;<br><br>But think of it.&nbsp; I gave Russia nothing except grief.&nbsp; I gave them nothing.&nbsp; I gave them sanctions and Javelins.&nbsp; That&#8217;s what I gave them.&nbsp;<br><br>Obama gave them sheets.&nbsp; And you heard that statement before.&nbsp; It&#8217;s a very famous &#8212; Trump gave them Javelins, and Obama gave them sheets.&nbsp; And then they say how close I am to Russia.&nbsp;<br><br>Let me tell you, we have to make a deal, because there are a lot of people being killed that shouldn&#8217;t be killed.&nbsp; But remember, Trump gave them nothing, and the other presidents gave them a lot.&nbsp; They gave them everything.<br><br>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Mr. President, on trade.&nbsp; You met with president &#8212; Argentine President Javier Milei at CPAC.&nbsp; He wants to sign a free trade agreement &#8212;<br><br>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Right.&nbsp;<br><br>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &#8212; with the United States.&nbsp; Is that something that you would consider, even with Argentina, or any other country?<br><br>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; I&#8217;ll consider anything.&nbsp; And Argentina &#8212; I think he&#8217;s great, by the way.&nbsp; I think he&#8217;s a great leader.&nbsp; He&#8217;s doing a great job.&nbsp; He&#8217;s doing a fantastic job.&nbsp; Brought it back from oblivion.&nbsp;<br><br>Yeah, we&#8217;ll look at things.&nbsp; We&#8217;re looking at the UK with things.&nbsp; It doesn&#8217;t have to be tariffs.&nbsp; But tariffs are easy, they&#8217;re fast, they&#8217;re efficient, and they bring fairness.&nbsp;<br><br>For instance, when people kill their dollar, their equivalent of the dollar, whatever &#8212; whether it&#8217;s the yuan or the yen in Japan or the yuan in China &#8212; when they drop them down, that gives us &#8212; that puts us at a very unfair disadvantage.&nbsp; So, all I have to do is say, Howard, we&#8217;re going to have to raise the tariffs a little bit.<br><br>Because I&#8217;ve called President Xi, I&#8217;ve called the leaders of Japan to say, You can&#8217;t continue to reduce and break down your currency.&nbsp; You can&#8217;t do it, because it&#8217;s unfair to us.&nbsp; It&#8217;s very hard for us to make tractors &#8212; Caterpillar &#8212; here, when Japan, China, and other places are killing their currency, meaning driving it down.&nbsp;<br><br>So, all of these things add up, and the way you solve it very easily is with tariffs.&nbsp; Because when they do that, instead of having to make phone calls every day, like I used to do with certain leaders &#8212; President Xi, a little bit &#8212; a lot of phone calls talking about the fact that they&#8217;re lowering their yuan.&nbsp; They&#8217;re lowering it down.&nbsp; And that makes it very, very hard for us.&nbsp;<br><br>So, this way, I just say, Look, let them do that, and we make up for it with the tariffs.&nbsp; But &#8212;<br><br>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Will you be speaking with Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum about tariffs today?&nbsp;<br><br>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Yeah, sure, I will.&nbsp; I have a lot of respect for her.&nbsp; I have a lot of respect for her.&nbsp;<br><br>(Cross-talk.)&nbsp;<br><br>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; After the 10 percent tariff take ef- &#8212;<br><br>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Yeah.&nbsp;<br><br>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &#8212; takes effect, itll be 20 percent on China now.&nbsp; How high are you willing to go against China?</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Well, I can&#8217;t say.&nbsp; It depends on what they do with their currency.&nbsp; It depends on what they do in terms of a retaliation with some kind of an economic retaliation, which I don&#8217;t think they&#8217;re going to retaliate too much.&nbsp;&nbsp;<br><br>Hey, look, the United States has been taken advantage of for 40 years.&nbsp; The United States has been a laughing stock for years and years.&nbsp; That&#8217;s why this gentleman has built in Taiwan, instead of building here.&nbsp; It would have been better if he built here.&nbsp;&nbsp;<br><br>If we had a president that knew what they were doing &#8212; and we had a lot of them very bad on trade.&nbsp; Look, I&#8217;m a huge fan of Ronald Reagan, but he was bad on trade.&nbsp; Very bad on trade.&nbsp; He allowed a lot of people, a lot of businesses, to be taken.&nbsp; So, I say that with due respect, because I &#8212; he was so great on other things, but he was bad on trade.&nbsp;<br><br>We are setting records right now &#8212; records like nobody has ever seen before.&nbsp; When you have companies like this coming in and almost 40 percent of their company, in one signature, is going to be devoted to what he does, which is one of the most important &#8212; important businesses in the world, that&#8217;s an unbelievable thing.&nbsp; When Apple now is going to start building all of their plants here, all because of what we&#8217;ve done in terms of &#8212; it&#8217;s not because he likes me or they like me.&nbsp; They don&#8217;t probably like me at all.&nbsp; I don&#8217;t know.&nbsp; I think he likes me a little bit, at least.&nbsp; (Laughter.)<br><br>MR. WEI:&nbsp; No, I like you.<br><br>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; But you know what?&nbsp; It&#8217;s the incentive weve created or the negative incentive.&nbsp; I mean, it&#8217;s going to be very costly for people to take advantage of this country.&nbsp; They can&#8217;t come in and steal our money and steal our jobs and take our factories and take our businesses and expect not to be punished, and they&#8217;re being punished by tariffs.&nbsp;</p>



<p>It&#8217;s a very powerful weapon that politicians haven&#8217;t used because they were either dishonest, stupid, or paid off in some other form.&nbsp; And now we&#8217;re using them.<br><br>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Have you spoken with President Xi?<br><br>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Agriculture &#8212;&nbsp;<br><br>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Say it.&nbsp;<br><br>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Have you spoken with President Xi about this this term?<br><br>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; I don&#8217;t want to tell you that.&nbsp;<br><br>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; On those incentives, sir.<br><br>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Thank you very much, everybody.&nbsp;<br><br>(Cross-talk.)&nbsp;<br><br>Thank you.&nbsp; Thank you very much.</p>



<p class="has-text-align-center">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; END&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 3:07 P.M. EST</p>



<p></p>
</div>
</main>

<script id="wp-block-template-skip-link-js-after">
	( function() {
		var skipLinkTarget = document.querySelector( 'main' ),
			sibling,
			skipLinkTargetID,
			skipLink;

		// Early exit if a skip-link target can't be located.
		if ( ! skipLinkTarget ) {
			return;
		}

		/*
		 * Get the site wrapper.
		 * The skip-link will be injected in the beginning of it.
		 */
		sibling = document.querySelector( '.wp-site-blocks' );

		// Early exit if the root element was not found.
		if ( ! sibling ) {
			return;
		}

		// Get the skip-link target's ID, and generate one if it doesn't exist.
		skipLinkTargetID = skipLinkTarget.id;
		if ( ! skipLinkTargetID ) {
			skipLinkTargetID = 'wp--skip-link--target';
			skipLinkTarget.id = skipLinkTargetID;
		}

		// Create the skip link.
		skipLink = document.createElement( 'a' );
		skipLink.classList.add( 'skip-link', 'screen-reader-text' );
		skipLink.href = '#' + skipLinkTargetID;
		skipLink.innerHTML = 'Skip to content';

		// Inject the skip link.
		sibling.parentElement.insertBefore( skipLink, sibling );
	}() );
	
</script>

.wp-block-post-content{display:flow-root}

260.959L374.301 261.919L354.926 280.166C354.926 280.166 354.926 280.166 354.838 280.166ZM358.082 280.603C357.906 280.515 357.731 280.515 357.556 280.428L375.967 263.141L377.107 266.284L358.082 <path d="M220.348 428.216C216.351 428.216 213.088 427.171 210.558 425.081C208.028 422.991 206.469 420.113 205.883 416.446H213.143C213.473 418.39 214.279 419.893 215.563 420.956C216.883 422.02 218.423 422.551 220.183 422.551C222.126 422.551 223.703 421.91 224.913 420.626C226.159 419.343 226.783 417.363 226.783 414.686C226.783 412.083 226.178 410.121 224.968 408.801C223.794 407.445 222.218 406.766 220.238 406.766C218.954 406.766 217.799 407.041 216.773 407.591C215.746 408.141 214.976 408.911 214.463 409.901H207.973L209.898 388.066H232.063V393.731H212.813L216.333 392.741L215.233 406.326L213.033 405.941C213.913 404.585 215.049 403.503 216.443 402.696C217.836 401.89 219.596 401.486 221.723 401.486C224.253 401.486 226.453 402.036 228.323 403.136C230.229 404.236 231.714 405.776 232.778 407.756C233.878 409.7 234.428 412.046 234.428 414.796C234.428 417.62 233.841 420.04 232.668 422.056C231.494 424.036 229.863 425.558 227.773 426.621C225.683 427.685 223.208 428.216 220.348 428.216Z" fill="white" />

	<div class="entry-content wp-block-post-content has-global-padding is-layout-constrained wp-block-post-content-is-layout-constrained">
<div class="alignfull has-wide-width wp-block-whitehouse-topper">
	<div class="wp-block-whitehouse-topper__inner-container">
		<div class="wp-block-whitehouse-topper__content">
			
							<div class="wp-block-whitehouse-topper__eyebrow">
					<a href="https://www.whitehouse.gov/remarks/">Remarks<svg class="wp-block-whitehouse-topper__eyebrow--icon" width="11" height="11" viewBox="0 0 11 11" fill="none" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">
<path d="M0.724808 1.45055C0.732563 0.940756 1.15149 0.539597 1.66097 0.554084L8.18243 0.73743C8.43709 0.74459 8.66622 0.854307 8.83047 1.02583C8.99471 1.19735 9.09441 1.43101 9.09053 1.68575C9.08278 2.19554 8.66385 2.5967 8.15436 2.58221L3.85933 2.46146L10.0157 8.89043C10.3703 9.2608 10.3618 9.84465 9.99583 10.1951C9.62987 10.5455 9.04621 10.5288 8.69154 10.1584L2.5352 3.72945L2.46984 8.02568C2.46209 8.53547 2.04316 8.93663 1.53368 8.92214C1.02419 8.90766 0.617659 8.48345 0.625575 7.97383L0.724808 1.45055Z" fill="currentColor" />
</svg>
</a>				</div>
			
							<h1 class="wp-block-whitehouse-topper__headline">
					REMARKS BY PRESIDENT TRUMP BEFORE CABINET MEETING				</h1>
			
			
				<div class="wp-block-whitehouse-topper__meta">
					<div class="wp-block-whitehouse-topper__meta--byline-subcategory">
						
<div class="wp-block-whitehouse-byline-subcategory">
	The White House</div>
					</div>
					
					<div class="wp-block-whitehouse-topper__meta--date">
						<div class="wp-block-post-date"><time datetime="2025-02-26T17:58:31-05:00">February 26, 2025</time></div>					</div>
				</div>

			
					</div>
	</div>
</div>



<p class="has-text-align-center">Cabinet Room</p>



<p>11:42 A.M. EST</p>



<p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Okay.&nbsp; Thank you very much.&nbsp; We appreciate you being here.&nbsp; And weve put together a great Cabinet.&nbsp; And we&#8217;ve had tremendous success.&nbsp; We&#8217;ve been given a lot of credit for having a very successful first month, and we want to make that many months &#8212; and years, actually.&nbsp; But we&#8217;re going to have many good months, and we&#8217;re going to have many good years, I hope.&nbsp; And we&#8217;re going to solve a lot of problems.&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; We&#8217;re doing very well with Russia-Ukraine.&nbsp; President Zelenskyy is going to be coming on Friday.&nbsp; It&#8217;s now confirmed.&nbsp; And we&#8217;re going to be signing an agreement, which will be a very big agreement.&nbsp; And I want to thank Howard and Scott for the job you guys did in putting it together.&nbsp; Really did an amazing job.&nbsp; And that&#8217;ll be on rare earth and other things.&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; And as you know, we&#8217;re in for, probably, $350 billion and Europe is in for $100 billion.&nbsp; And that&#8217;s a big difference.&nbsp; So, we&#8217;re in for, probably, three times as much.&nbsp; And yet, it&#8217;s very important to everybody, but Europe is very close.&nbsp; We have a big ocean separating us.&nbsp; So, it&#8217;s very important for Europe.&nbsp; And they, hopefully, will step up and do maybe more than they&#8217;re doing and maybe a lot more.</p>



<p><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; The previous administration put us in a very bad position, but we&#8217;ve been able to make a deal where we&#8217;re going to get our money back and we&#8217;re going to get a lot of money in the future.&nbsp; And I think that&#8217;s appropriate, because we have taxpayers that are &#8212; shouldn&#8217;t be footing the bill, and they shouldn&#8217;t be footing the bill at more than the Europeans are paying.&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; So, it&#8217;s all been worked out.&nbsp; We&#8217;re happy about it.&nbsp; And I think that, very importantly, we&#8217;re going to be able to make a deal.&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Most importantly, by far, we&#8217;re going to make a deal with Russia and Ukraine to stop killing people.&nbsp; They&#8217;ll stop killing young Russian soldiers and young Ukrainian soldiers and other people, in addition, in the towns and cities.&nbsp; And we will consider that a very important thing and a big accomplishment, because it was going nowhere until this administration came in.&nbsp; They hadn&#8217;t spoken to President Putin in two years.&nbsp; And so, we&#8217;ll keep you advised.<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Before we begin the Cabinet, I&#8217;d like to have Scott</p>



<p>and a couple of people say a few things.&nbsp; But most importantly &#8212; where are you?<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; SECRETARY TURNER:&nbsp; Im right here, sir.<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; This is a gentleman who&#8217;s going places &#8212; the head of HUD.&nbsp; And he&#8217;s going to say &#8212; you all know him.&nbsp; And you&#8217;re going to say grace &#8212;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; SECRETARY TURNER:&nbsp; Yes, sir.<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; &#8212; and then well have our meeting, right?</p>



<p>SECRETARY TURNER:&nbsp; Yes.</p>



<p><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Thank you very much.&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; SECRETARY TURNER:&nbsp; Thank you, Mr. President.&nbsp; Let&#8217;s pray.<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Father, we thank you for this awesome privilege, Father, to be in your presence.&nbsp; God, thank you that you&#8217;ve allowed us to see this day.&nbsp; The Bible says that your mercies are new every morning.&nbsp; And, Father God, we give you the glory and the honor.&nbsp; Thank you, God, for President Trump, Father, for appointing us.&nbsp; Father God, thank you for anointing us to do this job.&nbsp; Father, we pray you&#8217;ll give the president and the vice president wisdom, Father God, as they lead.&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Father, I pray for all of my colleagues that are here around the table and in this room.&nbsp; Lord God, we pray that we would lead with a righteous clarity, Father God, and as we serve the people of this country and every perspective agency, every job that we have, Father, we would humble ourselves before you that we would lead in a manner that you&#8217;ve called us to lead and to serve.&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Father, the Bible says the blessed is the nation whose God is the Lord.&nbsp; But, Father, we today honor you.&nbsp; And in your rightful place, Father, thank you for giving us this opportunity to restore faith in this country and be a blessing to the people of America.&nbsp; And, Lord God, today in our meeting, we pray that you will be glorified in our conversation.<br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; In Jesus name, amen.<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; PARTICIPANTS:&nbsp; Amen.<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Scott, that was a very good job you did.&nbsp; You&#8217;ve done that before, havent you?&nbsp; (Laughter.)&nbsp; Wow.&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; So, Scott Turner is a terrific young guy.&nbsp; He&#8217;s heading up HUD, and he&#8217;s going to make us all very proud, right?<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; SECRETARY TURNER:&nbsp; Thank you, Mr. President.&nbsp; Yes, sir.</p>



<p><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Thank you very much.&nbsp; Great job.&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; In just over one month, illegal border crossings have plummeted by numbers that nobody has actually ever seen before.&nbsp; Its much more than 100 percent.&nbsp;</p>



<p>And we&#8217;ve unleashed American energy at levels that will soon be reported, but we think we&#8217;re going to get it going very quickly.&nbsp; We have incredible people on the energy front.&nbsp;</p>



<p>I think we have really great people on every front.&nbsp; I&#8217;ll let you know if they&#8217;re not good, but I think they really are.&nbsp;</p>



<p>And we&#8217;re fighting every day to get the prices down.&nbsp; The inflation is stopping slowly, but part of the reason its stopping is because of high interest rates and other problems that we inherited.&nbsp; But we have to get the prices down &#8212; not the inflation down &#8212; the prices of eggs and various other things.&nbsp; Eggs are a disaster.&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; The secretary of Agriculture is going to be showing you a chart that&#8217;s actually mindboggling what&#8217;s happened &#8212; how low they were with us and how high they are now.&nbsp; But I think we can do something about it &#8212;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; SECRETARY ROLLINS:&nbsp; Yes, sir.<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; &#8212; Madam Secretary.<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; SECRETARY ROLLINS:&nbsp; Yes, sir.<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; And I think you&#8217;re going to do a fantastic job in that position.&nbsp;</p>



<p>One of the most important initiatives is DOGE, and we have cut billions and billions and billions of dollars.&nbsp; We&#8217;re looking to get it maybe to a trillion dollars.&nbsp; If we can do that, we&#8217;re going to start getting to be at a point where we can think in terms of balancing budgets, believe it or not, something you haven&#8217;t heard in many, many years &#8212; decades, actually.&nbsp; And it&#8217;s a big &#8212; whether it&#8217;s this year or next year, I think we&#8217;ll be very close to balancing budgets.&nbsp; And the DOGE is very important.&nbsp;</p>



<p>And Elon is here to give you a summary of what&#8217;s happening, some of the things they found &#8212; some of the horrible things they found &#8212; some of the theft and fraud, and we call it waste and abuse, but a lot of fraud, and probably some fraud that we&#8217;re not going to be able to prove is fraud, but when you hear the names and the places where this money is going, it&#8217;s a disgrace.&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; But we&#8217;ve requested that a lot of people &#8212; we want to make sure that the people are working.&nbsp; So, letters were sent out, and I think everyone at this table is very much behind it.&nbsp; And if they aren&#8217;t, I&#8217;d want them to speak up.&nbsp; But they&#8217;re very much behind it.&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Letters were sent out to people just to find out, if the people exist, do they work?&nbsp; Who do they work for?&nbsp; Where are they?&nbsp; You know, where have they been working?&nbsp; Have they been working for other companies or other entities at all and being paid by the government, so they have two jobs, but they&#8217;re supposed to have one?&nbsp;</p>



<p>And the letter asks some simple questions like, What have you done lately?&nbsp; And if they can answer that &#8212; because I can.&nbsp; I can tell you everything I&#8217;ve done for the last long period of time &#8212; a lot more than a week.&nbsp;</p>



<p>And in many cases, we haven&#8217;t gotten responses.&nbsp; Usually that means that maybe that person doesn&#8217;t exist or that person doesn&#8217;t want to say they&#8217;re working for another company while being paid by the United States government.&nbsp;</p>



<p>So, there&#8217;s a lot of interesting things.&nbsp; It&#8217;s very unique, but we have a very unique situation because we have a lot of people that were scamming our country.&nbsp; We have a lot of dishonest people.&nbsp; We have a lot of people that took advantage of a lot of different situations, and we&#8217;re not going to let that happen.&nbsp;</p>



<p>So, I&#8217;m going to ask, if it&#8217;s possible, to have Elon get up first and talk about DOGE, because it seems to be of great interest to everyone.&nbsp;</p>



<p>I will say that there is a large group of people in this country that have such admiration for what we&#8217;re doing.&nbsp; I got elected with a tremendous vote &#8212; winning every swing state, winning the popular vote, winning the counties by thousands of counties.&nbsp; I think it was 2,800 to 500.&nbsp; 2,800 counties to 500 counties.&nbsp; Think of that.&nbsp;</p>



<p>And so, we have a mandate to do this, and this is part of the reason I got elected.&nbsp; I got elected based on taxes and based on many things, the border, but also based on balancing budgets and getting our country back into shape, and this is a big part of it.&nbsp;</p>



<p>So, Elon, if you could get up and explain where you are, how you&#8217;re doing, and how much we&#8217;re cutting.&nbsp; And it&#8217;s an honor to have you.&nbsp; Hes been a tremendously successful guy.&nbsp; He&#8217;s really working so hard.&nbsp; And he&#8217;s got businesses to run.&nbsp; And in many ways, they say, How do you do this?&nbsp; And, you know, he&#8217;s sacrificing a lot and &#8212; getting a lot of praise, I&#8217;ll tell you, but he&#8217;s also getting hit.&nbsp; And we would expect that, and that&#8217;s the way it works.&nbsp;</p>



<p>So, I&#8217;d like to have Elon Musk please say a few words.<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; MR. MUSK:&nbsp; Well, tha- &#8212; thank you &#8212;<br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Thank you, Elon.</p>



<p>MR. MUSK:&nbsp; Thank you, Mr. President.&nbsp; Well, I a- &#8212; I actually just call myself humble tech support here &#8212; (laughter) &#8212; because this is actually &#8212; as crazy as it sounds, that &#8212; that is almost a literal description of the work that the DOGE team is doing is helping fix the government computer systems.&nbsp; Many of these systems are extremely old.&nbsp; They don&#8217;t communicate.&nbsp; There are a lot of mistakes in the systems.&nbsp; The software doesn&#8217;t work.&nbsp; The &#8212; so, we are actually tech support.&nbsp; It&#8217;s &#8212; its a &#8212; it&#8217;s ironic, but it&#8217;s true.</p>



<p>The &#8212; the overall goal here with the DOGE team is to help address the enormous deficit.&nbsp; We simply cannot sustain, as a country, $2 trillion deficits.&nbsp; The interest rates &#8212; just the interest on the national debt now exceeds the Defense Department spending.&nbsp;</p>



<p>We spend a lot on the Defense Department, but we&#8217;re spending, like, over a trillion dollars on interest.&nbsp; If this continues, the country will go &#8212; become de facto bankrupt.&nbsp; It&#8217;s &#8212; its not an optional thing.&nbsp; It is an essential thing.&nbsp; That &#8212; thats &#8212; that&#8217;s the reason I&#8217;m here and taking a lot of flak and getting a lot of death threats, by the way.&nbsp; I can, like, stack them up, you know.</p>



<p>But if we don&#8217;t do this, America will go bankrupt.&nbsp; That&#8217;s why it has to be done.&nbsp; And I&#8217;m confident, at this point &#8212; knock on wood, you know &#8212; knock on my wooden head &#8212; (laughter) &#8212; the &#8212; theres a lot of wood up there &#8212; that we can actually find a trillion dollars in savings.&nbsp; That would be roughly 15 percent of the $7 trillion budget.</p>



<p>And obviously, that can only be done with the support of everyone in this room.&nbsp; And I&#8217;d like to thank everyone for &#8212; for your support.&nbsp; Thank you very much this.&nbsp; This &#8212; this can only be done with &#8212; with your support.</p>



<p>So, this is &#8212; it&#8217;s really &#8212; DOGE is a support function for the president and for the &#8212; the agencies and departments to help achieve those savings and to effect- &#8212; effectively find 15 percent in reduction in fraud and &#8212; and waste.</p>



<p>And &#8212; and we bring the receipts.&nbsp; So, people say, like, Well, is this real?&nbsp; Just go to DOGE.gov.&nbsp; We l- &#8212; we &#8212; line item by line item, we specify each item.&nbsp; So &#8212; and w- &#8212; and I &#8212; I should say, we &#8212; also, we will make mistakes.&nbsp; We won&#8217;t be perfect.&nbsp; But when we make mistake, we&#8217;ll fix it very quickly.&nbsp;</p>



<p>So, for example, with USAID, one of the things we accidentally canceled, very briefly, was Ebola &#8212; Ebola prevention.&nbsp; I think we all wanted Ebola prevention.&nbsp; So, we restored the Ebola prevention immediately, and there was no interruption.</p>



<p>But we do need to move quickly if we&#8217;re &#8212; if we&#8217;re to achieve a trillion-dollar deficit reduction in tw- &#8212; in &#8212; in financial year 2026.&nbsp; It requires saving $4 billion per day, every day from now through the end of September.&nbsp; But we can do it, and we will do it.</p>



<p>Thank you.&nbsp;</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Well, do you have any questions of Elon while we&#8217;re on the subject of DOGE?&nbsp; Because we&#8217;ll finish off with that.&nbsp; And if you would have any questions, please ask &#8212; you could ask me or Elon.</p>



<p>Go ahead, please.&nbsp;</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Thank you, Mr. President.&nbsp; Thank you, Mr. Musk.&nbsp; I just wanted to ask you, the &#8212; President Trump put out a Truth Social today saying that everybody in the Cabinet was &#8212; was happy with you.&nbsp; I just wondered if that &#8212; if you had heard otherwise, and if you had heard anything about members of the Cabinet who weren&#8217;t happy with the way things were going.&nbsp; And if so, what are you doing to address those &#8212; any dissatisfaction?</p>



<p>MR. MUSK:&nbsp; To the best of &#8212;</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Hey, Elon, let the Cabinet speak just for a second.&nbsp; (Laughter.)&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Is anybody unhappy with Elon?&nbsp; If you are, we&#8217;ll throw them out of here.&nbsp; (Laughter.)&nbsp; Is anybody unhappy?&nbsp; (Applause.)</p>



<p>They are &#8212; they have a lot of respect for Elon and that he&#8217;s doing this.&nbsp; And some disagree a little bit, but I will tell you, for the most part, I think everyone is not only happy, they&#8217;re thrilled.&nbsp;</p>



<p>So, go ahead, Elon.</p>



<p>SECRETARY ROLLINS:&nbsp; And grateful.</p>



<p>MR. MUSK:&nbsp; And President Trump has put together, I think, the best cabinet ever, literally.&nbsp; So, I &#8212; and I do not give false praise.&nbsp; This &#8212; this is an incredible group of people.&nbsp; I don&#8217;t think such a talented team has actually ever been assembled.&nbsp; I think it&#8217;s literally the best cabinet that the country has ever had.&nbsp; And I think the companies should be incredibly appreciative of the people in this room.</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Mr. President &#8212;</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Please.&nbsp; Yeah.&nbsp; Go ahead.</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Mr. President, thank you.&nbsp; Mr. Musk.&nbsp; Are there &#8212; about half of the government employees so far appear to have responded to your request for what they&#8217;ve been doing over the past week.&nbsp; Is there a timeline in place for next moves for people being fired?&nbsp; And when can the American people expect to see results from that?</p>



<p>MR. MUSK:&nbsp; Yes.&nbsp; Well, to be &#8212; to be clear, like, the &#8212; I think that email, perhaps, was misinterpreted as a performance review, but actually it was a pulse check review.&nbsp; Do you have a pulse?&nbsp; (Laughter.)&nbsp; Do you have a pulse and two neurons?&nbsp; (Laughter.)&nbsp; So, if you have a pulse and two neurons, you can reply to an email.</p>



<p>This is, you know, I think, not a high bar, is what I&#8217;m saying.&nbsp; This is a &#8212; should be &#8212; anyone could accomplish this.&nbsp;</p>



<p>But what we are trying to get to the bottom of is we think there are a number of people on the government payroll who are dead, which is probably why they can&#8217;t respond, and &#8212; and some people who are not real people, like they&#8217;re literally fictional individuals that are collecting payche- &#8212; well, somebody is collecting paychecks on a fictional individual.&nbsp; So, we&#8217;re just literally trying to figure out are these people real, are they alive, and can they write an email, which I think is a reasonable expectation for the Amer- &#8212; you know, the American public would have at least that expectation of someone in the public sector.</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Mr. Musk &#8212;</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Mr. Musk &#8212;</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &#8212; roughly a million employees &#8212;</p>



<p>MR. MUSK:&nbsp; (Laughs.)&nbsp; This is not a &#8212; this is not a high bar, guys.&nbsp; Come on.&nbsp; (Laughter.)</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Roughly a million employees have responded so far to this email.&nbsp; Does that mean that the remaining 1 million or so federal employees now risk being terminated?&nbsp; And is it your understanding and expectation when you post a directive on X that the Cabinet secretaries will follow that order?&nbsp; Because several agencies have instructed employees that this is voluntary or not to respond.</p>



<p>MR. MUSK:&nbsp; Yeah.&nbsp; Well, I mean, to be cl &#8212; so, I guess there was a &#8212; like, last week, the president en- &#8212; encouraged me, via Truth Social and also via phone call, to be more aggressive.&nbsp; And I was like, Okay.&nbsp; You know, Yes, sir, Mr. President.&nbsp; We will indeed do that.&nbsp; The president is the commander in chief.&nbsp; I &#8212; I do what the president asks.</p>



<p>So &#8212; and I said, Can we send out an email to everyone, just saying, What did you get done last week?&nbsp; The president said yes.&nbsp; So, I &#8212; I did that.&nbsp;</p>



<p>And, you know, we &#8212; we got a partial response.&nbsp; But we &#8212; we&#8217;re going to send another email.&nbsp; But we &#8212; our &#8212; our goal is not to be capricious or &#8212; or unfair.&nbsp; It&#8217;s &#8212; we want to give people every opportunity to send an email and the email could simply be What I&#8217;m working on is too sensitive or classified to &#8212; to describe.&nbsp; Like, literally, just re- &#8212; that would be sufficient.&nbsp; Were &#8212; were &#8212; you know, I think this is just common sense.&nbsp;</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; And what is your target number for &#8212; for how many workers, employees you&#8217;re looking to cut total?</p>



<p>MR. MUSK:&nbsp; We &#8212; we wish to keep everyone who is doing a job that is essential and doing that job well.&nbsp; But if &#8212; if they&#8217;re &#8212; if the job is not essential or they&#8217;re not doing the job well, they obviously should not be on the public payroll.&nbsp;</p>



<p>(Cross-talk.)</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; No, I have to &#8212; I would like to add &#8212;</p>



<p>(Cross-talk.)</p>



<p>Wait a minute.&nbsp; Wait.&nbsp; Wait.&nbsp; I&#8217;d like to add that those million people that haven&#8217;t responded, though, Elon, they are on the bubble.&nbsp; You know, I wouldn&#8217;t say that we&#8217;re thrilled about it.&nbsp; You know, they haven&#8217;t responded.&nbsp; Now, maybe they don&#8217;t exist.&nbsp; Maybe we&#8217;re paying people that don&#8217;t exist.</p>



<p>Don&#8217;t forget, we just got here.&nbsp; This group just got here.&nbsp; But those people are on the bubble, as they say.&nbsp; You know, maybe they&#8217;re going to be gone.&nbsp; Maybe they&#8217;re not around.&nbsp; Maybe they have other jobs.&nbsp; Maybe they moved and they&#8217;re not where they&#8217;re supposed to be.&nbsp; A lot of things could have happened.</p>



<p>I wouldn&#8217;t say that Biden ran a very tight administration.&nbsp; They spent money like nobody has ever spent money before, wasted money &#8212; the Green New Scam, all of the different things they spent money on.&nbsp;</p>



<p>And you&#8217;ve seen that.&nbsp; You&#8217;ve seen that with some of the things that I read in speeches.&nbsp; I read them, and people can&#8217;t believe, when I read them, $20 million here, $30 million here for, you know, a little educational course on something.&nbsp; Circumcision, right?&nbsp; Circumcision.&nbsp; $20 million to inform the people of such-and-such a country on other things and other things other than that.</p>



<p>So, yeah, those people are &#8212; right now, we&#8217;re trying to find out who those people are that haven&#8217;t responded.&nbsp; Now, there&#8217;ll be some agencies &#8212; like Marco has people within State that are right now doing very classified, very confidential work.&nbsp; And we understand that, and we&#8217;ve talked.&nbsp; And, you know, we&#8217;re being a little more surgical.&nbsp;</p>



<p>And Marco is doing a lot of things himself.&nbsp; He&#8217;s &#8212; and some of the secretaries are.&nbsp; We&#8217;re going to be going to them.&nbsp; We&#8217;re going to be talking about it today.&nbsp; We&#8217;re going to ask them to do their own DOGE.&nbsp; In other words, they&#8217;ll look in their group and who &#8212;</p>



<p>I spoke with Lee Zeldin, and he thinks he&#8217;s going to be cutting 65 or so percent of the people from Environmental, and we&#8217;re going to speed up the process, too, at the same time.&nbsp; He had a lot of people that weren&#8217;t doing their job &#8212; they were just obstructionists &#8212; and a lot of people that didn&#8217;t exist, I guess, Lee, too.&nbsp; You found a lot of empty spots that the people weren&#8217;t there.&nbsp; They didn&#8217;t exist.</p>



<p>And I think Education is going to be one of those.&nbsp; You go around Washington, you see all these buildings &#8212; the Department of Education.&nbsp; We want to move education back to the states, where it belongs.&nbsp; Iowa should have education.&nbsp; Indiana should run their own education.&nbsp; You&#8217;re going to see education go way up.</p>



<p>Right now, we&#8217;re ranked at the very bottom of the list, but we&#8217;re at the top of the list in one thing: the cost per pupil.&nbsp; We spend more money per pupil than any other country in the world, and yet it&#8217;s Denmark and Norway, Sweden.&nbsp; And I &#8212; you hate to say this &#8212; and, you know, we&#8217;re going to get along very well with China, but it&#8217;s a competitor: They&#8217;re at the top of the list.&nbsp; They&#8217;re among the top 10, usually.&nbsp; And they&#8217;re a very big country, so we can&#8217;t use that as an excuse &#8212; right? &#8212; because we&#8217;re a very big country too.</p>



<p>But we&#8217;re &#8211; we were ranked last time &#8212; under Biden, we were ranked 40 out of 40.&nbsp; They do the 40 certain nations that they&#8217;ve done for a long time.&nbsp; It seems to be 40, for whatever reason.&nbsp; And we were ranked number 40.&nbsp; A year ago, we were 38.&nbsp; Then we were 39.&nbsp; Were &#8212; we hit 40.&nbsp; And so, we&#8217;re last in that, and we&#8217;re first in cost per pupil.&nbsp; So, I would say that&#8217;s unacceptable.</p>



<p>Lawrence, do you have something?&nbsp; Go ahead.</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; So, Mr. President, I know you like competition, and I know it&#8217;s early.&nbsp; So, which department are you most impressed with?&nbsp;</p>



<p>And then, to Mr. Mu- &#8212; (laughter).&nbsp; Thats the first one.&nbsp; And, Mr. Musk, which department have you received the most resistance from?&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Mr. President, you first.</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Well, I think both of those questions are a little bit &#8212; well, you&#8217;re a pretty controversial guy.&nbsp; (Laughter.)&nbsp; Look, it&#8217;s very early.&nbsp; Right now, I think I&#8217;m impressed with everybody.&nbsp; So far, everybody.&nbsp; If I wasn&#8217;t, in the first month, wed &#8212; and some of them just got here.&nbsp; They just got approved two days ago, right?</p>



<p>But I think I&#8217;m very impressed with everybody.&nbsp; So far, I&#8217;m very happy with all of the choices.</p>



<p>I think that Elon has done incredibly with some groups.&nbsp; And some groups are much easier than others.&nbsp; It is true: State is a, you know, very difficult situation.&nbsp; We&#8217;re right now negotiating very successfully, I think, with Russia and with Ukraine, and we have a lot of countries involved.&nbsp; And we have to be a little bit careful what we do and who we&#8217;re terminating.&nbsp; But Marco is doing that very &#8212; I think he&#8217;s going to be very precise.&nbsp; It&#8217;s going to be &#8212;</p>



<p>We&#8217;re cutting down government.&nbsp; We&#8217;re cutting down the size of government.&nbsp; We have to.&nbsp; We&#8217;re bloated.&nbsp; We&#8217;re sloppy.&nbsp; We have a lot of people that aren&#8217;t doing their job.&nbsp; We have a lot of people that don&#8217;t exist.&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; You look at Social Security as an example.&nbsp; I mean, you have so many people in Social Security where, if you believe it, they&#8217;re 200 years old.&nbsp; And what we&#8217;re doing is finding out: Are checks going out for that and is somebody cashing those checks who&#8217;s maybe 35 years old?&nbsp; Okay?&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; So, there&#8217;s a lot of dishonesty.&nbsp; There&#8217;s a lot of fraud.&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; But I think at this moment, Ill take Elon off the spot.&nbsp; I think that he&#8217;s impressed &#8212; he said it very well &#8211;better than I can say it &#8212; that he&#8217;s impressed with the people in this room.&nbsp; Very impressed.&nbsp; And I am too.&nbsp; And it&#8217;s too early to say, but I think everybody is on board.&nbsp; They all know &#8212; we want to balance a budget.&nbsp; We want to have a balanced budget within a reasonably short period of time, meaning maybe by next year or the year after, but maybe &#8212; maybe even sooner than that.&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Mr. President, your &#8212; your number one issue was the border.&nbsp; We just got new information that they&#8217;re doxing our federal agents.&nbsp; They&#8217;re putting their personal information out there, these activists, and they&#8217;re disrupting the operations.&nbsp; So, you got Tren de Aragua running all across the country &#8212;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Well, we have activists.&nbsp; That&#8217;s true.&nbsp; And a lot of those &#8212;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; So, what are we going to do about the activists &#8212;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Yeah.&nbsp; A lot of those activists are acting illegally.&nbsp; And we&#8217;ll give that to our attorney general, and she&#8217;ll take a look at that very strongly.&nbsp; But were also having tremendous support from Border Patrol, from ICE.&nbsp; The ICE agents have been unbelievable.&nbsp; Border Patrol &#8212; their leadership at Border Patrol has been incredible, and they&#8217;re working very well.&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; And, as you know &#8212; and I saw you reporting it this morning, actually &#8212; we set records on the least number of illegal aliens coming in, migrants coming into our country that we&#8217;ve had in more than 50 years.&nbsp; And we did this all within a period of weeks, because we took over a mess.&nbsp; The world was pouring in.&nbsp; And remember, they were coming in from jails and prisons and mental institutions and insane asylums, and they were gang members and drug dealers.&nbsp; Anybody who wanted to come in, they came.&nbsp; And from not just South America, from all over the world.&nbsp; So, it&#8217;s amazing what they&#8217;ve done.&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; And Kristi and &#8212; and Tom Homan, the job they&#8217;ve done has been absolutely amazing.&nbsp; We set records for &#8212; and we want people to come into our country, by the way, but they want to come in &#8212; they have to come in legally.&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; I want that to be really understood.&nbsp; We want people in our country, but they have to come in legally.&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Can I follow on that, Mr. President?</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Mr. President.</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; About the &#8212; the Trump gold card idea &#8212;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Yeah.<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &#8212; that you unveiled yesterday.<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; I hope you liked it.&nbsp; (Laughter.)<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; I await more information.&nbsp; But the question is: Does this reflect a view, on your part, that the American immigration system has never been properly monetized as you feel it should be?<br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</p>



<p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Well, not so much monetized.&nbsp; It hasn&#8217;t been properly run.&nbsp; I get calls from, as an example, companies where they want to hire the number one student at a school.&nbsp; A person comes from India, China, Japan, lots of different places, and they go to Harvard, the Wharton School of Finance.&nbsp; They go to Yale.&nbsp; They go to all great schools.&nbsp; And they graduate number one in their class, and they are made job offers, but the offer is immediately rescinded because you have no idea whether or not that person can stay in the country.&nbsp; I want to be able to have that person stay in the country.&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; These companies can go and buy a gold card, and they can use it as a matter of recruitment.&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; At the same time, the company is using that money to pay down debt.&nbsp; We&#8217;re going to &#8212; we&#8217;re going to pay down a lot of debt with that.<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Are they going to have to &#8212;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; And I think the gold card is going to be used by &#8212; not only for that.&nbsp; I mean, they&#8217;ll be used by companies.&nbsp; I mean, I could see Apple &#8212; I&#8217;ve spoken with Tim Cook &#8212; and, by the way, hes going to make a $500 billion investment in the country only because of the results of the election and, I think, because of tariffs.&nbsp; He&#8217;s going to want to be in the country because of tariffs.&nbsp; Because if you&#8217;re in the country, there is no tariff.&nbsp; If you&#8217;re out of the country, you got to pay tariffs.&nbsp; And that&#8217;s going to be a great investment, I think, that he&#8217;s making.&nbsp; I know it&#8217;s going to be a great investment.&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; But we have to be able to get people in the country, and we want people that are productive people.&nbsp; And I will tell you, the people that can pay $5 million, they&#8217;re going to create jobs.&nbsp; They&#8217;re going to spend a lot of money on jobs.&nbsp; They&#8217;re going to have to pay taxes on that too.&nbsp; So, they&#8217;re going to be hiring people, they&#8217;re going to be bringing people in and companies in.&nbsp; And, I don&#8217;t know, maybe it will sell like crazy.&nbsp; I happen to think it&#8217;s going to sell like crazy.&nbsp; It&#8217;s a bargain.<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; But well &#8212;</p>



<p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Will they have to commit to a certain number?<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; &#8212; know fairly soon.&nbsp; I think Howard and &#8212; and Scott &#8212; a few of you, really, are responsible for it.&nbsp; But, Howard, if you want to discuss that for a couple of minutes, I think I&#8217;d like to have you.&nbsp; I think it&#8217;s going to be a very successful program.<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; SECRETARY LUTNICK:&nbsp; Sure.<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; This is Commerce.<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; SECRETARY LUTNICK:&nbsp; So, the EB-5 program, which has been around for many years, had investment of a million dollars into projects in America.&nbsp; And those projects were often suspect, they didn&#8217;t really work out, there wasn&#8217;t any oversight of it.&nbsp; And so, for a million-dollar investment, you got a visa, and then you came into the country and ended up with a green card.&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; So, it was poorly overseen, poorly executed.&nbsp; Then you had our border open, where millions of people came through.&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; So, the idea is we will have a proper business.&nbsp; We will modify the EB-5 agreement.&nbsp; Kristi and I are working on it together.&nbsp; For $5 million, they&#8217;ll get a license from the Department of Commerce.&nbsp; Then they&#8217;ll make a proper investment on the EB-5, right?&nbsp; And we think Scott and I will design the EB-5 investment model, because Scott and I are the best people together to do that.&nbsp; So, this is joint.&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; This is exactly the Trump administration.&nbsp; We all work together.&nbsp; We work it out to be the best.&nbsp; And if we sell &#8212; just remember &#8212; 200,000 &#8212; there&#8217;s a line for EB-5 of 250,000 right now &#8212; 200,000 of these gold green cards is $1 trillion</p>



<p>to pay down our debt, and that&#8217;s why the president is doing it, because we are going to balance this budget, and we are going to pay off the debt under President Trump.&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Mr. &#8212;</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; And to qualify, do you have to promise and make commitments to create a certain number of jobs here in the U.S.?<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; No.&nbsp; No.&nbsp; Because not all these people are going to be job builders.&nbsp; They&#8217;ll be successful people, or they&#8217;ll be people that were hired from colleges, like &#8212; sort of like paying an athlete a bonus.&nbsp; I mean, Apple or one of the companies will go out and they&#8217;ll spend five mil- &#8212; they&#8217;ll buy five of them, and they&#8217;re going to get five people.&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Look, I&#8217;ve had the complaint where &#8212; I&#8217;ve had the complaint from a lot of companies where they go out to hire people, and they can&#8217;t hire them b- &#8212; out of colleges.&nbsp; And you know what they do?&nbsp; They go back to India, or they go back to the country where they came, and they open up a company, and they become billionaires.&nbsp; They become &#8212; and they&#8217;re employing thousands and there are a lot of examples.&nbsp;</p>



<p>There are some really big examples where they were forced out of the country.&nbsp; They graduated top in their class at a great school, and they weren&#8217;t able to stay.&nbsp; This is all the time you hear it.&nbsp;</p>



<p>And the biggest complaint I get from companies, other than overregulation, which we took care of, but we&#8217;re going to have to take care of it here, because a lot of that was put back on by Biden.&nbsp; But the biggest complaint is the fact that they can&#8217;t have any longevity with people.&nbsp; This way, they have pretty much unlimited longevity.&nbsp;</p>



<p>Also, with the $5 million, you know, that&#8217;s a path to citizenship.&nbsp; So, that&#8217;s going to be &#8212; it&#8217;s sort of a green card-plus, and it&#8217;s a path to citizenship.&nbsp; We&#8217;re going to call it the gold card.&nbsp; And I think it&#8217;s going to be very treasured.&nbsp; I think it&#8217;s going to do very well.&nbsp; And we&#8217;re going to start selling, hopefully, in about two weeks.</p>



<p>Now, just so you understand, if we sell a million &#8212; right? &#8212; a million, that&#8217;s $5 trillion.&nbsp; Five trillion.&nbsp; Howard was using a different number, but that&#8217;s $5 trillion. &nbsp;If we sell 10 million, which is possible &#8212; 10 million highly productive people coming in or people that we&#8217;re going to make productive &#8212; they&#8217;ll be young, but they&#8217;re talented, like a talented athlete &#8212; that&#8217;s $50 trillion.&nbsp;</p>



<p>That means our debt is totally paid off, and we have $15 trillion above that.&nbsp; And &#8212; now, I don&#8217;t know that we&#8217;re going to sell that many.&nbsp; Maybe we won&#8217;t so many at all.&nbsp; But I think we&#8217;re going to sell a lot, because I think there&#8217;s &#8212; there really is a thirst.&nbsp;</p>



<p>No other country can do this, because people don&#8217;t want to go to other countries.&nbsp; They want to come here.&nbsp; Everybody wants to come here, especially since November 5th.&nbsp; (Laughter.)</p>
