<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Mr. President, on Ukraine.&nbsp; Can you talk a lot &#8212; a little bit about what type of security guarantees you&#8217;re willing to make?</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Well, I&#8217;m not going to make security guarantees beyond very much.&nbsp; We&#8217;re going to have Europe do that, because it&#8217;s in &#8212; you know, we&#8217;re talking about Europe is their next-door neighbor.&nbsp; But we&#8217;re going to make sure everything goes well.&nbsp;</p>



<p>And as you know, we&#8217;ll be making a &#8212; we&#8217;ll be really partnering with Ukraine in terms of rare earth.&nbsp; We very much need rare earth.&nbsp; They have great rare earth.&nbsp; We&#8217;ll be working with Secretary Burgum and with Chris.&nbsp; You&#8217;ll be working on that together.&nbsp;</p>



<p>And we&#8217;re going to be able to have tremendous &#8212; I mean, this gives us &#8212; because we don&#8217;t have that much of it here.&nbsp; We have some, but we don&#8217;t have that much, and we need a lot more to really propel us to the next level of &#8212; to lead in every way.&nbsp; We&#8217;re leading right now with AI.&nbsp; We&#8217;re leading with everything right now, but we have to &#8212; we need resources.&nbsp;</p>



<p>We have to double our electric capacity.&nbsp; We have to do many things.&nbsp; We have to really triple, if you think of it, the electric capacity from what we have right now, if you can believe it.&nbsp; (Laughter.)&nbsp;</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; But will the United States &#8212; can I &#8212;</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; So, I just say this.&nbsp; So, the deal we&#8217;re making gets us &#8212; it brings us great wealth.&nbsp; We get back the money that we spent, and we hope that we&#8217;re going to be able to settle this up.&nbsp;</p>



<p>We want to settle it.&nbsp; We want to stop &#8212; I tell you what.&nbsp; I&#8217;m doing it for two reasons, but the number one reason, by far, is to watch &#8212; all these people being killed.&nbsp; I see pictures every week from &#8212; I assume satellite pictures, mostly, but there&#8217;s some pictures on site of thousands of soldiers that are being killed.&nbsp; They&#8217;re being decimated, because equipment today &#8212; military equipment is so powerful and so devastating.&nbsp; And, number one, I want to see people stop.&nbsp;</p>



<p>And they&#8217;re not from here.&nbsp; They&#8217;re from primarily two other countries.&nbsp;</p>



<p>And then, by the way, let&#8217;s talk about the Middle East.&nbsp; We got to solve that problem too.&nbsp; And that&#8217;s come a long way.&nbsp; We&#8217;re doing very well in that also.&nbsp; A lot of things are happening on that.&nbsp; But I&#8217;m watching soldiers being killed &#8212; Ukrainian and Russian soldiers being killed.&nbsp; My number one thing is to get that stopped.&nbsp;</p>



<p>My number two thing is I don&#8217;t want to have to pay any more money, because we&#8217;ve &#8212; Biden has spent $350 billion without any chance of getting it back.&nbsp; Now we&#8217;re going to be getting all of that money back, plus a lot more.&nbsp; And we provided a great thing. &nbsp;I mean, weve provided something very important, and we&#8217;ll be working with Ukraine and &#8212; because we&#8217;ll be taking that &#8212; we&#8217;re going to be taking what we&#8217;re entitled to take.&nbsp;</p>



<p>Now, they spent $350 billion, and Europe spent $100 billion.&nbsp; Now, does anybody really think that&#8217;s fair?&nbsp; But then we find out, a little while ago &#8212; not so long ago, a few months ago, I found out that the money they spent, they get back, but the money we spent, we don&#8217;t get back.&nbsp; I said, Well, we&#8217;re going to get it back.&nbsp;</p>



<p>And we&#8217;ll be able to make a deal.&nbsp; And again, President Zelenskyy is coming to sign the deal.&nbsp; And it&#8217;s a great thing.&nbsp; It&#8217;s a great deal for Ukraine, too, because they get us over there, and we&#8217;re going to be working over there.&nbsp; We&#8217;ll be on the land.&nbsp; And, you know, in that way, it&#8217;s &#8212; theres sort of automatic security, because nobody&#8217;s going to be messing around with our people when we&#8217;re there.&nbsp; And so, we&#8217;ll be there in that way.&nbsp;</p>



<p>But Europe will be watching it very closely.&nbsp; I know that UK has said and France has said that they want to put &#8212; they volunteered to put so-called peacekeepers on the site.&nbsp; And I think that&#8217;s a good thing.</p>



<p>(Cross-talk.)</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Mr. President, you had mentioned the high cost of eggs, and we&#8217;ve seen consumer confidence this week have a sharp drop from last month &#8212; the biggest dip in, I believe, three years.&nbsp; Why is that &#8212; your assessment, why is that the case and is there anything you can do?&nbsp;</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Well, I think that consumer confidence &#8212; if you look at confidence in the nation, it had the biggest increase in the history of the chart.&nbsp; It went up 42 points in a period of, like, days after the election, since the election.&nbsp; So, since the election, the confidence in our nation &#8212; including right track, wrong track &#8212; the first time it&#8217;s ever happened, where we were on the right track, because this country has been on the wrong track for a long time.&nbsp;</p>



<p>So, the confidence in business, confidence in the country has reached an all-time high.&nbsp; We have never reached levels like we are right now.</p>



<p>Okay.</p>



<p>(Cross-talk.)</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Mr. President, you said &#8212; Mr. President, you&#8217;ve been very clear in saying that as long as you&#8217;re president, Iran will never get a nuclear weapon.&nbsp;</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; That&#8217;s true.&nbsp;</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Is it also your policy that as long as you&#8217;re president, China will never take Taiwan by force?</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; I never comment on that.&nbsp; I don&#8217;t comment on any &#8212; because I don&#8217;t want to ever put myself in that position.&nbsp; And if I said it, I certainly wouldn&#8217;t be saying it to you.&nbsp; I&#8217;d be saying it to other people, maybe people around this table &#8212; (laughter) &#8212; and very specific people around this table.&nbsp;&nbsp;</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Is it a concern (inaudible)?</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; So, I don&#8217;t want to put myself in that position.&nbsp; But I can tell you what, I have a great relationship with President Xi.&nbsp; I&#8217;ve had a great relationship with him.&nbsp; We want them to come in and invest.&nbsp;</p>



<p>I see so many things saying that we don&#8217;t want China in this country.&nbsp; That&#8217;s not right.&nbsp; We want them to invest in the United States.&nbsp; That&#8217;s good.&nbsp; Thats a lot of money coming in.&nbsp; And we&#8217;ll invest in China.&nbsp; We&#8217;ll do things with China.&nbsp;</p>



<p>The relationship we&#8217;ll have with China would be a very good one.&nbsp; I see all of these phony reports that we don&#8217;t want their money; we don&#8217;t want anything to do with them.&nbsp; That&#8217;s wrong.&nbsp;</p>



<p>We&#8217;re going to have a good relationship with China, but they won&#8217;t be able to take advantage of us.&nbsp; What they did to Biden was &#8212; he didn&#8217;t know what was happening.&nbsp; He didn&#8217;t know what he was doing.&nbsp; The administration didn&#8217;t know what they were doing.&nbsp; It was very sad to watch.&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; But we&#8217;re going to have a good relationship with China and Russia and Ukraine and the Middle East.&nbsp; We&#8217;re doing things that &#8212;</p>



<p>Look, when I left, we had no wars.&nbsp; We had defeated ISIS totally.&nbsp; We had no inflation.&nbsp; We didn&#8217;t have the Afghanistan withdrawal &#8212; the worst withdrawal anybody has ever seen.&nbsp; I think that&#8217;s one of the reasons that President Putin looked at that.&nbsp; He said, Wow, these guys are a paper tiger.&nbsp; Look at &#8212; were no paper tiger.&nbsp;</p>



<p>Don&#8217;t forget: We got rid of ISIS in three weeks.&nbsp; People said it would take five years.&nbsp; We did it, because when I came in, I let them do what they had to do.&nbsp; And the man that headed that operation is now going to be your &#8212; your chairman, right?</p>



<p>SECRETARY HEGSETH:&nbsp; Yes, sir.</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Chairman of the Joint Chiefs.&nbsp;</p>



<p>SECRETARY HEGSETH:&nbsp; Yes, sir.</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; And &#8212; Razin Caine.&nbsp; I liked him right from the beginning.&nbsp; As soon as I heard his name, I said, That&#8217;s my guy.&nbsp;</p>



<p>Okay.&nbsp; Any other questions?</p>



<p>(Cross-talk.)</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Mr. President, has there been enough de- &#8212; decreases in crossings at the border for you to continue the pause on tariffs against Mexico and Canada?&nbsp; And, if not &#8212;</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; No, no.&nbsp; I&#8217;m going to &#8212; Im not stopping the tariffs, no.&nbsp; Millions of people have died because of the fentanyl that comes over the border.&nbsp;</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Even with the 90 percent drop in border crossings, though, this &#8212;</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Well, that&#8217;s &#8212; well &#8212;</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &#8212; last month compared to about a year ago?</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Yeah, they&#8217;ve been good, but that&#8217;s also due to us.&nbsp; Mostly due to us.&nbsp; I mean &#8212;</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Mr. President &#8212;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Mr. President, on CBS &#8212;&nbsp;</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; &#8212; it&#8217;s very hard.&nbsp; It&#8217;s, right now, very hard to come through the border.&nbsp; But the &#8212; look, the damage has been done.&nbsp; We&#8217;ve lost millions of people due to fentanyl.&nbsp; It comes mostly from China, but it comes through Mexico, and it comes through Canada.&nbsp;</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Mr. Presi- &#8212;</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; And I have to tell you that, you know, on April 2nd &#8212; I was going to do it on April 1st, but I&#8217;m a little bit superstitious, so I made it April 2nd &#8212; the tariffs go on, not all of them but a lot of them.&nbsp; And I think you&#8217;re going to see something that&#8217;s going to be amazing.&nbsp;</p>



<p>We&#8217;ve been taken advantage of as a country for a long period of time.&nbsp; We&#8217;ve been &#8212; we&#8217;ve been tariffed, but we didn&#8217;t tariff.&nbsp; Now, I did.&nbsp; When I was here, I tariffed.&nbsp; We took in $700 billion from China &#8212; $700 billion.&nbsp; Not one president in this &#8212; in the history of our country took in 10 cents from China.&nbsp; At the same time, China respected us.&nbsp;</p>



<p>Now, when COVID came in, that was a different deal.&nbsp; I used to call it the China virus.&nbsp; I guess I can call it the China virus again, but, you know, it was &#8212; its an accurate term, but I won&#8217;t do that out of respect to China.&nbsp; Okay?</p>



<p>(Cross-talk.)</p>



<p>Say it again.&nbsp; What?</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; On Gaza.&nbsp; I just wondered if there&#8217;s any progress towards the second phase of the ceasefire that you can tell us about.</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Well, I&#8217;m very disappointed when I see four &#8212; four bodies came in today.&nbsp; These are young people.&nbsp; Young people don&#8217;t die.&nbsp; Okay?&nbsp; Young people don&#8217;t die.&nbsp; These are young people.&nbsp; Four bodies came in today.&nbsp; They think they&#8217;re doing us a favor by sending us bodies.&nbsp;</p>



<p>So, look, that&#8217;s a decision that has to be made by Israel, by Bibi, but Israel has to make that decision.&nbsp; We got a lot of hostages back, but it&#8217;s very sad what happened to those people.&nbsp; I mean, you had a young lady with her hand practically blown off.&nbsp; You know why it blew up?&nbsp; Because she put up her hand to try and stop a bullet that was coming her way, and it hit her hand and blew off her fingers, big part of her hand.&nbsp;</p>



<p>This is a vicious group of people, and Israel is going to have to decide what they&#8217;re doing.&nbsp; Phase one is going to be ending.&nbsp; Think of it: Today, they sent in four bodies.&nbsp; Bodies.&nbsp;</p>



<p>And I will say one thing, though.&nbsp; I&#8217;ve spoken to a lot of the parents and a lot of the people involved.&nbsp; They want those bodies almost as much and maybe even just as much as they wanted their son or their daughter.&nbsp; Amazing.&nbsp; Please, sir.&nbsp; Please.&nbsp; My son is dead, but they have his body.&nbsp; Please can you get it for us?&nbsp; They &#8212; it&#8217;s the biggest thing.&nbsp; It&#8217;s incredible the level &#8212; they want the bodies of these people.&nbsp; They&#8217;re dead.&nbsp; They&#8217;re dead.&nbsp;</p>



<p>And, you know, when I saw the ones that came in two weeks ago, they looked like they just got out of a concentration camp.&nbsp; Then, the following week, a group came in, and they weren&#8217;t as bad &#8212; in as bad of shape.</p>



<p>But Israel is going to have to make a decision.&nbsp; You&#8217;re right, phase one, and now phase two has started.&nbsp; And today, we got some, you know, very, very sad &#8212; we knew they were dead, by the way.&nbsp; We knew they were going to be bodies, as opposed to people that were living.&nbsp; But its a very sad situation.&nbsp;</p>



<p>At some point, somebody is going to say we got to do something about this.</p>



<p>(Cross-talk.)</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Mr. President, you were just talking about Afghanistan and the botched withdrawal.&nbsp; Have all the generals or command staff that were involved with the withdrawal been fired or relieved of duty?</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Well, that&#8217;s a great idea.&nbsp; Its &#8212; (laughter) &#8212; sorry, I&#8217;m not going to tell this man what to do, but I will say that.&nbsp; If I had his place, I&#8217;d fire every single one of them, Pete.&nbsp; Pete, that&#8217;s a very good question.&nbsp;</p>



<p>SECRETARY HEGSETH:&nbsp; Well, it&#8217;s a question we&#8217;ve thought a lot about.&nbsp; We&#8217;re doing a complete review of every single aspect of what happened with the botched withdrawal of Afghanistan and plan to have full accountability.&nbsp; It&#8217;s one of the first things we announced at the Defense Department for that reason, sir.&nbsp;</p>



<p>Certainly General Razin Caine, who&#8217;s on his way in, was not a part of that.&nbsp; Instead, was a part of leading the effort against ISIS by untying the hands of war fighters and finishing the job properly and then bringing our troops home.&nbsp;</p>



<p>So, we&#8217;re taking a very different view, obviously, than the previous administration, and there will be full accountability.&nbsp;</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; I don&#8217;t see big promotions in that group.&nbsp; (Laughter.)&nbsp; And I think they&#8217;re going to be largely gone.&nbsp; I know the man on my left.&nbsp; I think they&#8217;re going to be largely gone.&nbsp;</p>



<p>That was a horrible display.&nbsp; And, you know, I&#8217;ve dealt with the parents and the family of the 13 that were killed.&nbsp; But, you know, nobody ever talks about the 40 that were so badly hurt, with the arms and the legs and the face and the whole thing &#8212; the missing arms and legs.&nbsp; It was so terrible, the way that was handled.</p>



<p>And it should have been gone through Bagram.&nbsp; We have a big base with big fences that nobody can get in, and you have, you know, hundreds of acres, instead of a little local airport where the whole place went crazy.&nbsp; That was so badly handled.&nbsp; And I would think that most of those people are going to be gone.&nbsp;</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Are we going to take Bagram back?</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT: &nbsp;So, I&#8217;ll tell you what has bothered me very much &#8212; very, very much: We give billions of dollars to Afghanistan.&nbsp; Nobody knows that.&nbsp; Nobody knew that.&nbsp; Do you know we give billions of dollars to Afghanistan?&nbsp; And yet we left behind all of that equipment, which wouldn&#8217;t have happened.&nbsp;</p>



<p>You know, we were getting out under me.&nbsp; I&#8217;m the one that got it down to 5,000 people.&nbsp; We were going to get out, but we were going to keep Bagram, not because of Afghanistan but because of China, because it&#8217;s exactly one hour away from where China makes its nuclear missiles.&nbsp;</p>



<p>So, we were going to keep Bagram.&nbsp; We were going to keep a small force on Bagram.&nbsp; We were going to have Bagram Air Base, one of the biggest air bases in the world.&nbsp; One of the biggest runways, one of the most powerful runways, in the sense that it was very heavy concrete and steel.&nbsp; You could carry about anything.&nbsp; You could land anything on those runways.&nbsp;</p>



<p>We gave it up.&nbsp; And you know who&#8217;s occupying it right now?&nbsp; China.&nbsp; China. &nbsp;Biden gave it up.&nbsp; So, we&#8217;re going to keep that, and we&#8217;re going to have a withdrawal, and we&#8217;re going to take our equipment.&nbsp; We&#8217;re going to do it properly.&nbsp; We&#8217;re going to do it very &#8212; we&#8217;re going to keep the equipment.&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Well, they ran out.&nbsp; It was &#8212; what happened there was a &#8212; in fact, you know, in all fairness to Putin, when he saw that, he said, Well, this is our time to go and go into Ukraine, I guess, because it was &#8212; the timing seemed to be about right.&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; But we send them billions of dollars in aid, which nobody knows.&nbsp; If they &#8212; if the American public knew that &#8212; they know it now.&nbsp; And if we&#8217;re doing that, I think they should give our equipment back.&nbsp; And I told Pete to study that.&nbsp;</p>



<p>But we left billions &#8212; tens of billions of dollars worth of equipment behind.&nbsp; Brand-new trucks.&nbsp; You see them display it every year on their little roadway someplace where they have a road and they drive the &#8212; you know, waving the flag and talking about America.&nbsp; Beautiful equipment that&#8217;s all &#8212; I mean, the top-of-the-line stuff, brand-new stuff.&nbsp; Now it&#8217;s getting older.&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; But you know what?&nbsp; We&#8217;re going to pay them.&nbsp; I think we should get a lot of that equipment back.&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; You know that Afghanistan is one of the biggest sellers of military equipment in the world.&nbsp; You know why?&nbsp; They&#8217;re selling the equipment that we left.&nbsp; We&#8217;re first.&nbsp; They were second or third.&nbsp; Can you believe it?&nbsp; They&#8217;re selling 777,000</p>



<p>rifles, 70,000 armor-plated &#8212; many of them were armor-plated trucks and vehicles &#8212; 70,000.&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; If you think of a used car lot, the biggest one in the country, you have &#8212; I would say, JD, if somebody had 500 cars, that would be a lot.&nbsp;</p>



<p>THE VICE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Yeah, that would be quite a lot.</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; This is 70,000 vehicles we had there, and we left it for them.&nbsp; I think we should get it back.<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; (Cross-talk.)<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Mr. President, the spending bill that passed last night aims to cut $2 trillion.<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Right.<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Can you guarantee that Medicare, Medicaid, Social Security will not be touched?<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Yeah.&nbsp; I mean, I have said it so many times, you shouldn&#8217;t be asking me that question.&nbsp; Okay?&nbsp; This will not be read my lips.&nbsp; It won&#8217;t be read my lips anymore: We&#8217;re not going to touch it.<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Now, we are going to look for fraud.&nbsp; I&#8217;m sure you&#8217;re okay with that, like people that shouldn&#8217;t be on, people that are illegal aliens and others &#8212; criminals, in many cases.&nbsp; And that&#8217;s with Social Security.&nbsp; We have a lot of people &#8212; you see that immediately.&nbsp; When you see people that are 200 years old that are being sent checks for Social Security &#8212; some of them are actually being sent checks.&nbsp;</p>



<p>So, we&#8217;re tracing that down, and I have a feeling that Pam is going to do a very good job with that.&nbsp; But you have a lot of fraud.&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; But, no, I&#8217;m not &#8212; we&#8217;re not doing anything on that.<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Mr. President, part of your mission, sir &#8212;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Mr. President &#8212; Mr. President, on CBS News.&nbsp; Mr. President, youre in litigation &#8212;<br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Part of your mission has been &#8212; thank you.&nbsp; I&#8217;m sorry.&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Part of your mission has been to restore executive control over the executive branch.&nbsp; Is it your view of your authority that you have the power to call up any one of or all of the people seated at this table and issue orders that theyre bound to follow?<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Oh, yeah.&nbsp; They&#8217;ll follow the orders.&nbsp; Yes, they will.&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; No exceptions?&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; No except- &#8212; well, let&#8217;s see.&nbsp; Let me think.&nbsp; Oh, yeah.&nbsp; Yeah.&nbsp; She&#8217;ll have an exception.&nbsp; (The president points at Secretary Rollins.)&nbsp; (Laughter.)<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Of course, no exceptions.&nbsp; You know that.<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Mr. President, can you clarify the Canada/Mexico tariffs.&nbsp; You had put that 30-day pause.&nbsp;</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Yeah.</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; You just referred to &#8212;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Its 25 percent.<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Twenty-five percent.&nbsp; When does it go into effect?<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; April 2nd.&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; April 2nd for Canada and Mexico?<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Correct.&nbsp; And for &#8212;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; And for the reciprocal?<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; &#8212; and for everything.&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; SECRETARY LUTNICK:&nbsp; Well, we have the &#8212; the &#8212; fentanyl-related is a pause.&nbsp; If they can prove to the president they&#8217;ve done an excellent job, that&#8217;s what they first do in 30 days.<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Have you guys seen any changes?<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; SECRETARY LUTNICK:&nbsp; But then the overall is April 2nd.&nbsp; So, the big transaction is April 2nd, but the fentanyl-related things, if they&#8217;re working hard on the border, at the end of that 30 days, they have to prove to the president that they&#8217;ve satisfied him to that regard.&nbsp; If they have &#8212;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Its going to be hard to satisfy.<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; SECRETARY LUTNICK:&nbsp; &#8212; then well give them a pause or he wont.&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Its going to be hard to satisfy.<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; SECRETARY LUTNICK:&nbsp; But thats up to him to see.<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; We lose 300,000 people a year to fentanyl.&nbsp; Not 100-, not 95-, not 60-, like you read.&nbsp; You know, you&#8217;ve been reading it for years.&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; We lost, in my opinion, over the last couple of years, on average, maybe close to 300,000 people dead, and the families are ruined.&nbsp; You know, when they lose a daughter, when they lose a son, the families are never the same.&nbsp; You&#8217;re never going to be the same.&nbsp; So, you&#8217;re talking about a million people.&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; But when the daughters die, I see it &#8212; daughters die and the sons die because of fentanyl.&nbsp; And in some cases, they don&#8217;t even know they&#8217;re taking it.&nbsp; They &#8212; they&#8217;re buying something else, and it&#8217;s laced with fentanyl, and they end up dying.&nbsp; And Ive known many people who have lost children to fentanyl and for other reasons, but to fentanyl.&nbsp; It&#8217;s such a big killer.&nbsp; And those people are never the same people.&nbsp;<br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; I mean, I&#8217;ve seen people that &#8212; for the rest of their lives, they&#8217;re not the same people.&nbsp; They&#8217;re so different, it&#8217;s not even believable.&nbsp; Dynamic people, happy people that are &#8212; they die a miserable death.&nbsp; And that&#8217;s because of the crap that comes in through China and through Mexico and through Canada.&nbsp; A lot of it comes through Canada.&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; The &#8212; Canada &#8212; look, we support Canada $200 billion a year in subsidies one way or the other.&nbsp; We let them make millions of cars.&nbsp; We let them send us lumber.&nbsp; We don&#8217;t need their lumber.&nbsp; We&#8217;re going to free up our lumber.&nbsp; Lee is going to do &#8212; the head of environmental.&nbsp; We&#8217;re going to free up our lumber.&nbsp; We have the best lumber there is.&nbsp; We don&#8217;t need their lumber.&nbsp; What do we need their lumber for?</p>



<p><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; When you look at the &#8212; we subsidize them $200 billion a year.&nbsp; Without us, Canada can&#8217;t make it.&nbsp; You know, Canada relies on us 95 percent.&nbsp; We rely on them 4 percent.&nbsp; Big difference.&nbsp; And I say Canada should be our 51st state.&nbsp; There&#8217;s no tariffs, no nothing.&nbsp;<br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; And &#8212; and I say that, we give them military protection.&nbsp; They have a very small military.&nbsp; They spend very little money on military.&nbsp; Or NATO, they&#8217;re just about last in terms of payment, because they say, Why should we spend on military?&nbsp; That&#8217;s a tremendous cost.&nbsp; Most nations can&#8217;t afford to even think about it.&nbsp; Why should we spend on military?&nbsp; The United States protects us.&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; And I would say that&#8217;s largely true.&nbsp; We protect Canada.&nbsp; But it&#8217;s not fair.&nbsp; It&#8217;s not fair that they&#8217;re not paying their way.&nbsp; And if they had to pay their way, they couldn&#8217;t exist.&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; When I spoke to &#8212; let&#8217;s call it the prime minister, rather than the governor.&nbsp; (Laughter.)&nbsp; But when I spoke to him, I said, Why are we giving you $200 billion a year?&nbsp; He was unable to answer the question.&nbsp; I said, Why are we letting you make millions of cars and send them in?&nbsp; He was unable to answer the question &#8212; Justin Trudeau, a nice guy.&nbsp; I think he&#8217;s a very good guy.&nbsp; I call him Governor Trudeau.&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; He should be governor, because the fact is that if we don&#8217;t give them cars &#8212; we don&#8217;t have to give them cars.&nbsp; The c- &#8212; tariffs will make it impossible for them to sell cars into the United States.&nbsp; The tariffs will make it impossible to &#8212; for them to sell lumber or anything else into the United States.&nbsp;</p>



<p>And all I&#8217;m asking to do is break even or lose a little bit, but not lose $200 million.&nbsp; And we love Canada.&nbsp; I love Canada.&nbsp; I love the people of Canada.&nbsp; And &#8212; but, honestly, it&#8217;s not fair for us to be supporting Canada.&nbsp; And if we don&#8217;t support them, they don&#8217;t subsist as a &#8212; as a nation.&nbsp;</p>



<p>Okay.</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Mr. President, when you were talking to Elon &#8212;</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Mr. President, on the EU tariffs.&nbsp; Mr. President, have you made a decision on what level you will seek on tariffs on the European Union?</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; We have made a decision, and we&#8217;ll be announcing it very soon.&nbsp; And itll be 25 percent, generally speaking, and that&#8217;ll be on cars and all other things.&nbsp;</p>



<p>And European Union is a different case than Canada &#8212; different kind of case.&nbsp; They&#8217;ve really taken advantage of us in a different way.&nbsp; They don&#8217;t accept our cars.&nbsp; They don&#8217;t accept, essentially, our farm products.&nbsp; They use all sorts of reasons why not.&nbsp; And we accept everything of them, and we have about a $300 billion deficit with the European Union.&nbsp;</p>



<p>Now, I love the countries of Europe.&nbsp; I guess I&#8217;m from there at some point, a long time ago, right?&nbsp; (Laughter.)&nbsp; But indirectly &#8212; well, pretty directly, too, I guess.&nbsp; But I love the countries of Europe.&nbsp; I &#8212; I love all countries, frankly.&nbsp; All different.</p>



<p>But European Union has been &#8212; it was formed in order to screw the United States.&nbsp; I mean, look, let&#8217;s be honest.&nbsp; The European Union was formed in order to screw the United States.&nbsp; That&#8217;s the purpose of it, and they&#8217;ve done a good job of it, but now I&#8217;m president.</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; What will happen if these countries or the EU retaliate?</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; They can&#8217;t.&nbsp; I mean, they can try, but they can&#8217;t.&nbsp;</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; China did.&nbsp; They imposed tariffs &#8212;</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; They are pledging to, sir.</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &#8212; that are &#8212; went into effect, China&#8217;s retaliatory tariffs &#8212;</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; That&#8217;s right.&nbsp; That&#8217;s right.&nbsp; But &#8212;</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &#8212; on the &#8212; the 10th of February.&nbsp; Has there been any &#8212;</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; That&#8217;s right.</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &#8212; impact that youve been able to observe?</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Thats right.&nbsp; No, they can do it, and they can try, but the numbers can never equal what ours, because we can go off.&nbsp; We are the pot of gold.&nbsp; We&#8217;re the one that everybody wants.&nbsp; And they can retaliate, but it cannot be a successful retaliation, because we just go cold turkey.&nbsp; We don&#8217;t buy anymore.&nbsp; And if that happens, we win.&nbsp;</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Are you talking to Erik Prince about privatat- &#8212;</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; No.</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &#8212; privatizing deportations?</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; No, I haven&#8217;t.&nbsp; I havent.</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Mr. President, you&#8217;re in litigation with CBS News.&nbsp; Is this a case that you&#8217;d like to see go to trial, or are you open a settelm- &#8212;</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; With who?</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; CBS, the &#8212; 60 Minutes.</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; CBS?</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Yes.</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Well, CBS did something that was amazing.&nbsp; Kamala was unable to answer a question properly, and they took the question that they asked, and they inserted an answer.&nbsp; They gave her an answer.&nbsp; This was two days before the election, right before &#8212; the Sunday night before the election.&nbsp; And they wrote out a &#8212; they put her words from another question that was asked about a half an hour later, and they put that into the question.&nbsp;</p>



<p>Nobody&#8217;s ever even heard of it before.&nbsp; Nobody&#8217;s ever heard of anything like this before.&nbsp; But they then did it, they say, on numerous occasions.&nbsp; And the FCC is looking at it very strongly, and everybody&#8217;s looking at it, and Im &#8212; but nobody&#8217;s ever seen anything.&nbsp;</p>



<p>Think of it.&nbsp; They took her answers, and they changed them.&nbsp; And I don&#8217;t mean they changed a word or two, or they cut off a half a sentence, or they cut off a couple of words.&nbsp; I mean, I&#8217;ve had that happen too.&nbsp; But that, you &#8212; you just say &#8212; you know, then they say, Well, we want brevity.&nbsp; You know, we wanted to do it for time.&nbsp;</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Would &#8212; would you encourage &#8212;</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; They took out her answer, and they inserted an entirely different answer that made her sound competent.&nbsp; And they did this, and nobody&#8217;s ever &#8212; I thought I&#8217;ve heard of everything when it comes to that stuff.&nbsp; No &#8212; I&#8217;ve never heard of it.&nbsp; Nobody has ever seen.&nbsp; So, we sued, and we are in discussions of settlement.&nbsp;</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; What would a number be?&nbsp; Like a hu- &#8212; what &#8212; whats a number that you would think would be appropriate?</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; I think it&#8217;s a lot.&nbsp; (Laughter.)&nbsp;</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Whats the timeline and process &#8212;</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; No, I mean, it &#8212; look, it could have &#8212; it probably did affect the election.&nbsp; I mean, we won by a lot.&nbsp; As I said, Too big to rig.&nbsp; But it probably did affect the election.&nbsp; Yeah, probably could have won by more, but I could have lost the election because of that.&nbsp;</p>



<p>It&#8217;s &#8212; we have to get to honest elections.&nbsp; We have to go back to paper ballots.&nbsp; We have to go back to voter ID.&nbsp; One-day election, ideally, or short term, not these 48-day and 61-day elections where boxes are put in a room, and, Oh, let&#8217;s move the boxes, because we&#8217;re putting in a new air conditioning system.&nbsp; Then you see the boxes move, and then you say, Well, where are all the boxes?&nbsp; You know, &#8212;</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; But would you &#8212;</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; What happened to the boxes that never came back?&nbsp;</p>



<p>No, our elections are extremely dishonest.&nbsp; We&#8217;re the only country in the world that has mail-in voting and all of these different things that we put in.&nbsp; Nobody &#8212; no other country in the world has it.&nbsp;</p>



<p>You know, France went to &#8212; they had some of the things that we had, and they went to same-day voting, all paper.&nbsp; And, you know, paper is very sophisticated now.&nbsp; It&#8217;s a very sophisticated &#8212; it&#8217;s a very sophisticated form of voting right now.&nbsp; It&#8217;s a very safe form of voting.&nbsp;</p>



<p>You know, the other thing is for the governors.&nbsp; I wish the governors would do it, because the paper ballots will cost 9 percent of the machines, and they&#8217;re 100 percent.&nbsp; You know, they&#8217;re &#8212; I don&#8217;t &#8212; nothing&#8217;s foolproof, but they&#8217;re as close as you get.&nbsp; So, we&#8217;ll see what happens.&nbsp;</p>



<p>But on the 60 Minute thing, nobody&#8217;s ever seen anything like it.&nbsp;</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; And would you link the FCC action to the litigation?&nbsp; I mean, does it make se- &#8212;</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; I don&#8217;t think it&#8217;s linked, but probably the lawyers look at it, you know, because I know it&#8217;s going along.&nbsp; FCC is headed by a very competent person, and you have some very competent people on the board, and so I think they&#8217;re looking at it very seriously.&nbsp;</p>



<p>Yeah.</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Mr. President &#8212;</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Sir, of all the deals that you&#8217;ve done in your life, all the people youve sat across from and negotiated with, is President Putin distinct in any way?</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; He&#8217;s a very smart guy.&nbsp; He&#8217;s a very cunning person.&nbsp; But I&#8217;ve dealt with some people that &#8212; I&#8217;ve dealt with some really bad people.&nbsp; But I will tell you, as far as this is concerned, we&#8217;ve &#8212; you have to understand, he was &#8212; he had no intention, in my opinion, of settling this war.&nbsp; I think he wanted the whole thing.&nbsp;</p>



<p>When I got elected, we spoke, and I think we&#8217;re going to have a deal.&nbsp; I can&#8217;t guarantee you that.&nbsp; You know, a deal is a deal.&nbsp; Lots of crazy things happen in deals, right?&nbsp; But I think we&#8217;re going to have a deal.&nbsp;</p>



<p>If I didn&#8217;t get elected, I believe he would have just continued to go through Ukraine, and over a period of time, a lot of people &#8212; a lot of people would have been killed.&nbsp; It would have lasted for a period of time.&nbsp;</p>



<p>And the reason that Ukraine &#8212; and I give &#8212; I have great respect for the Ukraine as fighters.&nbsp; They have great fighters.&nbsp; But without our equipment, that war would have been over, like people said, in a very short period of time.&nbsp;</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Is there a timeline (inaudible) &#8212;&nbsp;</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; And if you remember, I gave the Javelins, and the Javelins are the things that knocked out those tanks right at the beginning of the war.&nbsp; They said that &#8212; that Obama, at the time, gave sheets, and Trump gave Javelins.&nbsp; Well, I was the one that did that.&nbsp; But I want to see it come to an end.&nbsp;</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Will he have to make concessions &#8212; President Putin?</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Yeah, he will.&nbsp; He will.&nbsp; He&#8217;s going to have to.&nbsp; And &#8212;</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Can you preview that?</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; And I think &#8212; I believe that, because we got elected, that war will come to an end.&nbsp; And I also believe, if we didn&#8217;t get elected, if this administration didn&#8217;t win the election by a lot, that that war would go on for a long time, and he would want to take the whole thing.&nbsp;</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; What concessions?&nbsp; What concessions?</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; On the &#8212; on the &#8212;</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; The big question I had is: Does he want to take the whole thing?&nbsp; But the reason &#8212; and &#8212; and the Ukrainians are good fighters, I have to say, but without the equipment &#8212; without our equipment &#8212; we have the best equipment in the world.&nbsp; We have the best military equipment in the world.&nbsp; Without our equipment, that would have been over very quickly.&nbsp;</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; What concessions would you like to see?&nbsp;</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; On the (inaudible), sir?&nbsp; On &#8212; on the &#8212;</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; What concessions would you like to see?</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Oh, I don&#8217;t want to tell right now.&nbsp; But I can tell you that NATO, you can forget about.&nbsp; That&#8217;s been &#8212; I think that&#8217;s probably the reason the whole thing started.&nbsp; And I think, JD, we can say that.&nbsp;</p>



<p>What &#8212; do you have a statement on that?&nbsp; You&#8217;ve been very much involved.&nbsp;</p>



<p>THE VICE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; (Laughs.)</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; I gave him the beauty.</p>



<p>THE VICE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Great.&nbsp; You gave me the &#8212; the hardest question, sir.&nbsp;</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Concessions from Russia.</p>



<p>THE VICE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; I mean, look, as the president said, we&#8217;re not going to do the negotiation in public with the American media.&nbsp; He&#8217;s going to do it in private with the president of &#8212; of Russia, with the president of Ukraine, and with other leaders.&nbsp; And I think that&#8217;s how this has to go.&nbsp;</p>



<p>I think the &#8212; I just want to push back against some of the criticism I&#8217;ve seen in the administration on this, because every single time the president engages in diplomacy, you guys preemptively accuse him of conceding to Russia.&nbsp; He hasn&#8217;t conceded anything to anyone.&nbsp; He&#8217;s doing the job of a diplomat, and he is, of course, the diplomat in chief as the president of the United States.&nbsp;</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; On the gold cards, sir.&nbsp; Can you talk a little bit more about the vetting process, you know &#8212;</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; They&#8217;ll go through a process.&nbsp; The process is being worked out right now, and we&#8217;re going to be &#8212; we&#8217;re going to be very careful.&nbsp;</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; And will there be restrictions on, for instance, can Chinese nationals get one?&nbsp;</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; No, we&#8217;re not going to restrict.&nbsp;</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Can Iranian nationals get &#8212;</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; We&#8217;re probably not going to be restricting too much in &#8212; in terms of countries, but maybe in terms of individuals.&nbsp; We want to make sure we have people that love our country and are capable of loving the country.</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Is there a process, sir &#8212;</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Mr. President, there is a measles outbreak in Texas at the moment in which a child is reported to have died.&nbsp; Do you have concerns about that?&nbsp; And have you asked Secretary Kennedy to look into that outbreak?&nbsp;</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Well, why don&#8217;t we &#8212; Bobby, do you want to speak on that, please?</p>



<p>SECRETARY KENNEDY:&nbsp; We are following the measles epidemic every day.&nbsp; I think there&#8217;s 124 people who have contracted measles at this point, mainly in Gaines County, Texas; mainly, we&#8217;re told, in the Mennonite community.&nbsp;</p>



<p>There are two people who have died, but the &#8212; we&#8217;re watching it.&nbsp; And there &#8212; there are about 20 people hospitalized, mainly for quarantine.&nbsp;</p>



<p>We&#8217;re watching it.&nbsp; We put out a post on it yesterday, and we&#8217;re going to continue to follow it.&nbsp;</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Mr. President &#8212;</p>



<p>SECRETARY KENNEDY:&nbsp; Inci- &#8212; incidentally, there have been four measles outbreaks this year in this country.&nbsp; Last year, there were 16.&nbsp; So, it&#8217;s not unusual.&nbsp; We have measles outbreaks every year.&nbsp;</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; You sound a little under the weather yourself right now.&nbsp; Are you all right?</p>



<p>SECRETARY KENNEDY:&nbsp; I just &#8212; I have a permanently bad throat.&nbsp;</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; (Inaudible) coughing.</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Mr. President, would you &#8212; would you send U.S. peacekeepers to just &#8212; to support the &#8212; the European peacekeepers?&nbsp; Would you do any sort of U.S. &#8212;</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; No, we&#8217;re going to support Europe, yeah.&nbsp;</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; And how would we do that?&nbsp; How would the United States do that?</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; We&#8217;re very friendly with Europe.&nbsp; We have a great relationship with Europe.&nbsp; I mean, you could ask &#8212; you could talk about France.&nbsp; You could talk about any of them.&nbsp; Yeah, we have a great relationship with Europe.&nbsp;</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; But how will we &#8212; how will the United States do that?&nbsp; Would there be boots on &#8212;</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Well, how?&nbsp; I mean, you&#8217;re asking me a question: What are we doing in the &#8212; let&#8217;s worry &#8212; I hope we have that problem, where we can worry about peacekeeping.&nbsp; We got to get there first.</p>



<p>(Secretary Lutnick knocks on the table.)</p>



<p>But I hope we have the problem of worrying about peacekeeping.&nbsp; That&#8217;ll be the easiest problem, I think, JD, that we&#8217;ve ever had.&nbsp; (Laughter.)</p>



<p>THE VICE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; I think so, sir.</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; That would be part of the deal, presumably, that the Ukrainians &#8212;</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Well &#8212; were &#8212;</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &#8212; would want &#8212;</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; We&#8217;ll do it at the time, but we&#8217;ll &#8212; peacekeeping is very easy.&nbsp; It&#8217;s making the deal that&#8217;s very tough.&nbsp;</p>



<p>And, again, nobody was speaking to Russia at all.&nbsp; And, you know, probably a million and a half soldiers have been killed &#8212; close to a million and a half soldiers, not to mention a treme- &#8212; I will tell you, the &#8212; the thing with that horrible war that should have never started &#8212; it would have never started if I were president, and it didn&#8217;t start for four years, and it was not even thought about starting.&nbsp; But the thing with that war is that you&#8217;re highly underestimating the number of people that have been killed.&nbsp; Far more people have been killed in that war than you talk about.&nbsp; You know, you like to talk about numbers, like, a million people.&nbsp; Well, they had much more than a million soldiers killed.</p>



<p>But you have a lot of cities that have been knocked to the ground.&nbsp; They&#8217;re demolition sites.&nbsp; Literally, demolition sites.&nbsp; Every single building is knocked to the ground, and a lot of people were killed in those buildings.&nbsp; And you&#8217;ll hear a report, Two people were minorly injured or just injured a little bit.&nbsp; No.&nbsp; No.&nbsp; People were killed by the thousands.</p>



<p>And there are a lot more people killed in that war than the media wants to talk about, because Biden did a horrible, horrible job.&nbsp; He should have prevented that war.&nbsp; He could have prevented that war.&nbsp;</p>



<p>Putin would have never gone in.&nbsp; I&#8217;ll tell you one thing: He would have never gone in.&nbsp; That war would never have taken place if I were president.&nbsp;</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; I think what people are trying to understand, Mr. President &#8212;</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Mr. President &#8212;</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &#8212; is how would the United States &#8212; what would you be willing to do to support this European peacekeeping effort?&nbsp; Would there be &#8212;</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Again, youre asking me the same question?&nbsp; (Laughter.)</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Im just trying &#8212;</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; How many times do you have to answer it?&nbsp; You&#8217;re talking about after we make peace.&nbsp; Let me make peace first.&nbsp;</p>



<p>Once we make peace, I&#8217;ll give you all the answers you want.&nbsp; But how many times can you ask the same question?</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Mr. President, on the Middle East.&nbsp; Did you receive &#8212;</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Is loosening the sanctions on &#8212;</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Yeah, go ahead.&nbsp; Behind.</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Is loosening the sanctions on Russia a potential option as part of an overall deal?</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Not now, no.&nbsp; No.&nbsp; We have sanctions on Russia.&nbsp; No, I want to see if we make a deal first.&nbsp; But I think we will.&nbsp; I&#8217;ve had very &#8212;</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; But is it a bargaining chip, Im asking.</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; I&#8217;ve had very good conversations with President Putin.&nbsp; I&#8217;ve had very good conversations with President Zelenskyy.&nbsp; And until four weeks ago, nobody had conversations with anybody.&nbsp; It wasn&#8217;t even a consideration.&nbsp; Nobody thought you could make peace.&nbsp; I think you can.&nbsp;</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Mr. President, just &#8212;</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; But if Mr. Putin gets to keep his &#8212;</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &#8212; just to bring this &#8212;</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &#8212; the land that was claimed by force, if the Russians get to keep the territory that they &#8212; they claimed by force, doesn&#8217;t that send a dangerous message, let&#8217;s say, to China about Taiwan?</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Oh, okay.&nbsp; You try and take it away, right?&nbsp; We&#8217;re going to do the best we can.&nbsp; (Laughter.)&nbsp; We&#8217;re going to do the best we can to make the best deal we can for both sides.&nbsp; But for Ukraine, we&#8217;re going to try very hard to make a good deal so that they can get as much back as possible.&nbsp; We want to get as much back as possible.&nbsp;</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Mr. President, just to bring this full &#8212;</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; And well &#8212; we&#8217;ll cut it out after maybe this question.&nbsp; Go ahead.</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; To bring this full circle, back to &#8212;</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Unless it&#8217;s a bad question, and then we&#8217;ll (inaudible).&nbsp; (Laughter.)</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; And back to &#8212;</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; You always like to finish on a good one.</p>



<p>THE VICE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; But, sir, they want you to negotiate with them instead of President Putin.</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; I know.&nbsp; I know.</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Back to the question about the &#8212;</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; They want to continue to talk about the peacekeepers.&nbsp; (Laughter.)&nbsp; Theyre &#8212; you have a lot of confidence in us, because you assume there&#8217;s going to be peace.&nbsp; You know, it&#8217;s possible it doesn&#8217;t work out.&nbsp; There is possibility.&nbsp;</p>



<p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; And I had &#8212;</p>



<p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; But I hope it does, for the sake of humanity, because if you look at the pictures that I&#8217;ve looked at, you don&#8217;t want to look at them.&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Go ahead.</p>



<p><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; I had a question back on these cuts to the federal workforce.&nbsp; You mentioned you &#8212; youre interested in doing another round of this email.&nbsp; When would you like to</p>



<p>see that?&nbsp; What would be the deadline?&nbsp; And &#8212;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; I &#8212; Im not &#8212; I think &#8212;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &#8212; this time, would it be mandatory?<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; I think Elon &#8212; I think Elon wants to.&nbsp; And I think it&#8217;s a good idea because, you know, those people, as I said before, theyre on the bubble.&nbsp; You got a lot of people that have not responded, so we&#8217;re trying to figure out, do they exist?&nbsp; Who are they?&nbsp; And it&#8217;s possible that a lot of those people will be actually fired.&nbsp;</p>



<p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; And &#8212;</p>



<p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; And if that happened, that&#8217;s okay, because that&#8217;s what we&#8217;re trying to do.&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; This country has gotten bloated and fat and disgusting and incompetently run.&nbsp;</p>



<p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; I think we had the worst president in the history of our country.&nbsp; He just left office.&nbsp; I think he&#8217;s a disgrace.&nbsp; What he&#8217;s done to our country by allowing millions of people to come into our country like that and all of the other things &#8212; the inflation, which he caused because of energy and stupid spending.&nbsp; To spend hundreds of millions, trillions and trillions of dollars on the Green New Scam &#8212; a total scam.&nbsp; I have the best energy people, the best environmental people in the world around this table, and they &#8212; they can&#8217;t even believe he got away with it.&nbsp;</p>



<p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; And then, in leaving office, to send $20 billion here and $20 million there and $10 million and $5 million, and they couldn&#8217;t spend the money fast enough, and Lets get it out before Trump gets in.&nbsp; Let&#8217;s just get it out to anybody.&nbsp; This is a disgrace to our nation.</p>



<p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; And you don&#8217;t write the fair thing.&nbsp; But, look, you know the good news?&nbsp; The people see it, and that&#8217;s why we won the election by so much.&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Thank you very much, everybody.&nbsp; I appreciate it.&nbsp; Thank you.&nbsp; Thank you.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</p>



<p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Thank you, Mr. President.</p>



<p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Thank you very much, Doug.&nbsp; Pulitzer Prize.</p>



<p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; THE VICE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Sir, how many peacekeepers are you going to send to &#8212; (laughter) &#8212;</p>



<p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; What will you do?&nbsp; How will it be?&nbsp; (Laughter.)</p>



<p class="has-text-align-center">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; SECRETARY LUTNICK:&nbsp; How will you address this?<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;END&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 12:47 P.M. EST</p>
</div>

<script id="wp-block-template-skip-link-js-after">
	( function() {
		var skipLinkTarget = document.querySelector( 'main' ),
			sibling,
			skipLinkTargetID,
			skipLink;

		// Early exit if a skip-link target can't be located.
		if ( ! skipLinkTarget ) {
			return;
		}

		/*
		 * Get the site wrapper.
		 * The skip-link will be injected in the beginning of it.
		 */
		sibling = document.querySelector( '.wp-site-blocks' );

		// Early exit if the root element was not found.
		if ( ! sibling ) {
			return;
		}

		// Get the skip-link target's ID, and generate one if it doesn't exist.
		skipLinkTargetID = skipLinkTarget.id;
		if ( ! skipLinkTargetID ) {
			skipLinkTargetID = 'wp--skip-link--target';
			skipLinkTarget.id = skipLinkTargetID;
		}

		// Create the skip link.
		skipLink = document.createElement( 'a' );
		skipLink.classList.add( 'skip-link', 'screen-reader-text' );
		skipLink.href = '#' + skipLinkTargetID;
		skipLink.innerHTML = 'Skip to content';

		// Inject the skip link.
		sibling.parentElement.insertBefore( skipLink, sibling );
	}() );
	
</script>

<main class="wp-block-group site-content is-layout-flow wp-block-group-is-layout-flow">
	<div class="entry-content wp-block-post-content has-global-padding is-layout-constrained wp-block-post-content-is-layout-constrained">
<div class="alignfull has-wide-width wp-block-whitehouse-topper">
	<div class="wp-block-whitehouse-topper__inner-container">
		<div class="wp-block-whitehouse-topper__content">
			
							<div class="wp-block-whitehouse-topper__eyebrow">
					<a href="https://www.whitehouse.gov/remarks/">Remarks<svg class="wp-block-whitehouse-topper__eyebrow--icon" width="11" height="11" viewBox="0 0 11 11" fill="none" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">
<path d="M0.724808 1.45055C0.732563 0.940756 1.15149 0.539597 1.66097 0.554084L8.18243 0.73743C8.43709 0.74459 8.66622 0.854307 8.83047 1.02583C8.99471 1.19735 9.09441 1.43101 9.09053 1.68575C9.08278 2.19554 8.66385 2.5967 8.15436 2.58221L3.85933 2.46146L10.0157 8.89043C10.3703 9.2608 10.3618 9.84465 9.99583 10.1951C9.62987 10.5455 9.04621 10.5288 8.69154 10.1584L2.5352 3.72945L2.46984 8.02568C2.46209 8.53547 2.04316 8.93663 1.53368 8.92214C1.02419 8.90766 0.617659 8.48345 0.625575 7.97383L0.724808 1.45055Z" fill="currentColor" />
</svg>
</a>				</div>
			
							<h1 class="wp-block-whitehouse-topper__headline">
					REMARKS BY PRESIDENT TRUMP <br>BEFORE MARINE ONE DEPARTURE 				</h1>
			
			
				<div class="wp-block-whitehouse-topper__meta">
					<div class="wp-block-whitehouse-topper__meta--byline-subcategory">
						
<div class="wp-block-whitehouse-byline-subcategory">
	The White House</div>
					</div>
					
					<div class="wp-block-whitehouse-topper__meta--date">
						<div class="wp-block-post-date"><time datetime="2025-02-22T14:00:18-05:00">February 22, 2025</time></div>					</div>
				</div>

			
					</div>
	</div>
</div>



<p class="has-text-align-center">South Lawn</p>



<p class="has-text-align-center">(February 22, 2025)</p>



<p>1:35 P.M. EST</p>



<p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; So, we had a lot of news over the last 24 hours.&nbsp; We had the hostages given back today.&nbsp; It&#8217;s disgraceful what&#8217;s going on there.&nbsp; They&#8217;re not in great shape, but we&#8217;ve also seen them in worse shape.&nbsp; But the hostages &#8212; the six hostages were delivered by Hamas.&nbsp; What a terrible situation it is.&nbsp;</p>



<p>I&#8217;m going now to make a speech at CPAC, so I think we&#8217;re going to include a lot of your subjects.&nbsp; And I know it&#8217;s going to be covered by all of you.&nbsp; And so, I&#8217;ll see you at CPAC.</p>



<p>How are you?</p>



<p class="has-text-align-left">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; END&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 1:35 P.M. EST<br></p>
</div>
</main>

{"config":{"whitehouse-header":{"menuOpenTitle":"Open menu","menuCloseTitle":"Close menu","menuOpenLabel":"Menu","menuCloseLabel":"Close","searchOpenTitle":"Open search","searchCloseTitle":"Close search","searchOpenLabel":"Search","searchCloseLabel":"Close","backLabel":"Back"}},"state":{"whitehouse-header":{"popoverOpen":false,"popoverTarget":null,"sticky":false}}}

<script id="wp-block-template-skip-link-js-after">
	( function() {
		var skipLinkTarget = document.querySelector( 'main' ),
			sibling,
			skipLinkTargetID,
			skipLink;

		// Early exit if a skip-link target can't be located.
		if ( ! skipLinkTarget ) {
			return;
		}

		/*
		 * Get the site wrapper.
		 * The skip-link will be injected in the beginning of it.
		 */
		sibling = document.querySelector( '.wp-site-blocks' );

		// Early exit if the root element was not found.
		if ( ! sibling ) {
			return;
		}

		// Get the skip-link target's ID, and generate one if it doesn't exist.
		skipLinkTargetID = skipLinkTarget.id;
		if ( ! skipLinkTargetID ) {
			skipLinkTargetID = 'wp--skip-link--target';
			skipLinkTarget.id = skipLinkTargetID;
		}

		// Create the skip link.
		skipLink = document.createElement( 'a' );
		skipLink.classList.add( 'skip-link', 'screen-reader-text' );
		skipLink.href = '#' + skipLinkTargetID;
		skipLink.innerHTML = 'Skip to content';

		// Inject the skip link.
		sibling.parentElement.insertBefore( skipLink, sibling );
	}() );
	
</script>

<path d="M220.348 428.216C216.351 428.216 213.088 427.171 210.558 425.081C208.028 422.991 206.469 420.113 205.883 416.446H213.143C213.473 418.39 214.279 419.893 215.563 420.956C216.883 422.02 218.423 422.551 220.183 422.551C222.126 422.551 223.703 421.91 224.913 420.626C226.159 419.343 226.783 417.363 226.783 414.686C226.783 412.083 226.178 410.121 224.968 408.801C223.794 407.445 222.218 406.766 220.238 406.766C218.954 406.766 217.799 407.041 216.773 407.591C215.746 408.141 214.976 408.911 214.463 409.901H207.973L209.898 388.066H232.063V393.731H212.813L216.333 392.741L215.233 406.326L213.033 405.941C213.913 404.585 215.049 403.503 216.443 402.696C217.836 401.89 219.596 401.486 221.723 401.486C224.253 401.486 226.453 402.036 228.323 403.136C230.229 404.236 231.714 405.776 232.778 407.756C233.878 409.7 234.428 412.046 234.428 414.796C234.428 417.62 233.841 420.04 232.668 422.056C231.494 424.036 229.863 425.558 227.773 426.621C225.683 427.685 223.208 428.216 220.348 428.216Z" fill="white" />
