<p>But we did a great job on that, but it was a terrible thing for the world.&nbsp; The whole world suffered.&nbsp; It suffered terribly, including China, including other countries.&nbsp; It just was a terrible period of time.&nbsp;</p>



<p>But despite that, we did well.&nbsp; But we had the greatest economy in the history of our country, and I think this time we&#8217;re going to do even better.&nbsp; We had &#8212; we were artificially hurt by COVID.&nbsp; We had to focus on that instead of focusing on &#8212; but just prior to COVID coming in, there&#8217;s never been anything like what we did, what we achieved.&nbsp; And even after, we did very well con- &#8212; and especially considering what all of us had to do with COVID.&nbsp; Some nations were hit so badly, it was &#8212; it was just unbelievable what happened to them.&nbsp;</p>



<p>As part of our effort, I&#8217;ve signed executive orders to keep the United States at the forefront of artificial intelligence and to end Joe Biden&#8217;s war on Bitcoin and crypto.&nbsp; We ended that war totally.&nbsp; That war is over.&nbsp; They were very hostile toward them until the very end, just because there are so many people on Bitcoin and crypto that &#8212; just before the end, the SEC came out, and they were being very nice.&nbsp; I was so nice to people, because so many people were being indicted for no reason whatsoever &#8212; very political group of people.&nbsp; That&#8217;s all they did was they liked indicting people.&nbsp;</p>



<p>But they were being indicted, and many of those indictments were dropped just before the election because they said, Wait a minute.&nbsp; There&#8217;s 100 million, 125 million people using this, and they didn&#8217;t want to have, you know, all these people being &#8212; voting against.&nbsp; But by the time they did that, it was too late.&nbsp; We had that vote entirely, I think.&nbsp; I think anybody would &#8212; smart that believed in that, and there were a lot of people believing it &#8212; anybody that was smart voted for Trump.</p>



<p>And they pulled the indictments.&nbsp; And I see people that were indicted.&nbsp; I said, I saved your life.&nbsp; I saved your life.&nbsp; Because if they thought that &#8212; they actually thought that I was doing &#8212; they said, Why is Trump doing it?&nbsp; Is he doing it for political reasons?&nbsp; I don&#8217;t do anything for political reasons.&nbsp; I do what&#8217;s right.&nbsp; I do &#8212; I want to be on the forefront of every industry.&nbsp; (Applause.)&nbsp;</p>



<p>So, I&#8217;ll be working with the Republican Congress to pass the largest tax cuts in American history.&nbsp; And that includes, obviously &#8212; (applause) &#8212; yeah.&nbsp; That includes we have to extend the Trump tax cuts, which were, until now, the largest.&nbsp;</p>



<p>We&#8217;re going to dramatically cut taxes for families and for workers and for companies, including no tax on tips and hopefully no tax on Social Security and no tax on overtime.&nbsp; And that overtime one is a sleeper, because I think a lot of people are going to be spurred on to do a lot of extra work.&nbsp; When they hear that, it&#8217;s &#8212; a lot of companies really like it and a lot of people really like it.&nbsp;</p>



<p>The new Trump tax cuts will also include 100 percent expensing for new factory construction in the United States and anything else that you&#8217;re going to buy with capital.&nbsp; If you buy something &#8212; if you buy something that is going to be good for our country, we&#8217;re going to let you expense it &#8212; one-year expense.&nbsp; (Applause.)&nbsp; And I did that the first time, and everybody was saying, Can you go back to that?&nbsp; Now you still get, I guess, 40 percent or whatever, but it, you know, pares down.&nbsp; But we&#8217;re going to bring that right up to the &#8212; to the top level.&nbsp; I think that had a lot to do with the success that I had during my first term.&nbsp;</p>



<p>And well substantially cut taxes for all domestic producers of oil and gas and just about everything else that they produce.&nbsp;</p>



<p>In my first term, I brought the business tax down from around 40 percent to 21 percent, which everybody said was an impossible thing to do.&nbsp; I cut it from 40 or &#8212; it actually &#8212; with state and city, it was much higher than 40, but I got it down to 21 percent.&nbsp; And now I&#8217;m bringing it down to a goal of 15 percent, but only if you make your product in America.&nbsp; In other words, you&#8217;re going to be at 21 percent, but if you make your product in America, you&#8217;re going to go from 21 to 15.&nbsp; If you don&#8217;t, you&#8217;re going to pay 21 percent, which is still lower than anything.&nbsp; (Applause.)&nbsp;</p>



<p>So, guys like Elon are going to come and make his great cars in the United States.&nbsp; There &#8212; a lot of &#8212; a lot of people will.&nbsp; A lot of people are calling.&nbsp; A lot of car companies are calling.&nbsp; They called me &#8212; three of them.&nbsp; Three of the majors, they called, and they said, We&#8217;re looking all over the place.&nbsp; We want to be there.</p>



<p>I&#8217;m going to be announcing tariffs on cars and semiconductors and chips and pharmaceuticals &#8212; drugs and pharmaceuticals and lumber, probably, and some other things over the next month or sooner, and it&#8217;s going to have a big impact on America.&nbsp; We&#8217;re bringing our businesses back.&nbsp;</p>



<p>If they don&#8217;t make their product in America, then they &#8212; very simply, they have to pay a tariff.&nbsp; But if they do make their product in America, they ha- &#8212; they don&#8217;t have to pay any tariff, which will bring &#8212; it&#8217;s all going to bring trillions of dollars into our Treasury, or it&#8217;s going to mean that there won&#8217;t be any taxes because we wont have a fair base.&nbsp; If they don&#8217;t have it, we don&#8217;t have it.&nbsp; If they don&#8217;t pay &#8212; if they don&#8217;t charge us, we don&#8217;t charge them.&nbsp; It&#8217;s pretty simple.&nbsp;</p>



<p>The Republican Party is, once again, the party of common sense.&nbsp; We&#8217;re a party of common sense.&nbsp; We want strong borders.&nbsp; We don&#8217;t want men playing in women&#8217;s sports.&nbsp; We don&#8217;t want to have transgender for everybody.&nbsp; We&#8217;re the party of common sense.&nbsp; That&#8217;s how we won the election in such a big manner.&nbsp;</p>



<p>We&#8217;ll no longer allow other countries to ransack and plunder our nation.&nbsp; That&#8217;s why I&#8217;ve announced that we will soon begin imposing reciprocal tariffs on any country that engages in unfair and unequal trading practices.&nbsp; If they tariff us, as I said, we will tariff them at the exact same rate.&nbsp; So, if a certain country &#8212; because some of these countries, even countries that I&#8217;ve already mentioned, are extremely aggressive with tariffs.&nbsp; Nobody knows that.&nbsp;</p>



<p>The European Union, they have a VAT tax that&#8217;s devastating.&nbsp; It&#8217;s very tough for people on the outside.&nbsp; Hard to sell cars.&nbsp; Really impossible to sell them, because they also have nonmonetary tariffs that are very, very tough.&nbsp; But if you take a look at that, it&#8217;s a very unfair situation.&nbsp; And the VAT tax is similar to the tariff.</p>



<p>Around the world, I&#8217;m moving quickly to end wars, settle conflicts, and restore the planet to peace.&nbsp; I want peace, and I don&#8217;t want to see these &#8212; everybody being killed.&nbsp; And you take a look at the death in the Middle East and the death that&#8217;s taking place between Russia and Ukraine thats been going on, and we&#8217;re going to end it.&nbsp;</p>



<p>There&#8217;s no profit for anyone in having World War III, and you&#8217;re not so far away from it.&nbsp; I&#8217;ll tell you right now, you&#8217;re not so far away.&nbsp; If we would have had this administration for another year, you would have been in World War III, and now it&#8217;s not going to happen.</p>



<p><a>In the Middle East, I&#8217;ve restored my policy of maximum pressure on Iran, designed to &#8212; to bring peace.&nbsp; (Applause.)&nbsp; And we&#8217;ve designated the Houthis a terrorist organization.&nbsp; They&#8217;re, you know, destroying shipping lanes all over the place.&nbsp; They&#8217;re making it very hard for people to get their product delivered.&nbsp; Theyre making it very difficult.&nbsp; But we&#8217;ll take care of that situation.</a></p>



<p>And we&#8217;ve secured a ceasefire in Gaza, and we&#8217;re bringing in the hostages, and we&#8217;re bringing them home to their families.&nbsp; Some of them are in pretty bad shape, I have to tell you.&nbsp;</p>



<p>To end the horrible war in Ukraine, I have spoken with President Putin and President Zelenskyy, and our teams began negotiations this week in Saudi Arabia.&nbsp; I want to thank Saudi Arabia for that.&nbsp; That was so great.&nbsp; (Applause.)&nbsp; Yeah.&nbsp;</p>



<p>And I want to thank, in particular &#8212; I mean, we have so many of the people &#8212; Yasir, Mohammed, all the people &#8212; but &#8212; but, in particular, we have to thank Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman for hosting these historic talks &#8212; (applause) &#8212; and talks that went very, very well.&nbsp;</p>



<p>Steve was there &#8212; Steve Witkoff was there, and Michael was there &#8212; Michael Waltz &#8212; and others.&nbsp; And they really went well.&nbsp; It&#8217;s a big &#8212; it&#8217;s a big step.&nbsp; Weve got to get that war over with.&nbsp;</p>



<p>You have to see the people that are dying.&nbsp; I look at the pictures, the &#8212; the satellite pictures of the field.&nbsp; It&#8217;s a level field, and it looks like a modern-day version of Gettysburg, and you know what that means.&nbsp; It is just carnage.&nbsp; It&#8217;s horrible.&nbsp;</p>



<p>And, you know, it&#8217;s not American soldiers.&nbsp; It&#8217;s not even soldiers from the Middle East, in the case of Ukraine-Russia, but it&#8217;s people.&nbsp; It&#8217;s young people from Russia and Ukraine, mostly, that are just being decimated.&nbsp; It&#8217;s flat fields, and a bullet goes, and a bullet only stops when it hits somebody.&nbsp; And the level of people being killed in that battle &#8212; soldiers, young soldiers &#8212; in some cases, old soldiers, because they&#8217;re running out of people; they&#8217;re running out of soldiers, one case.&nbsp;</p>



<p><a>But think of it, </a>a modestly successful comedian, President Zelenskyy, talked the United States of America into spending $350 billion to go into a war that basically couldn&#8217;t be won, that never had to start, and never would have started if I was president &#8212; not even a chance.&nbsp; And it didn&#8217;t start for four years.&nbsp; Never would have started.&nbsp;</p>



<p>But a war that he, without the U.S. and Trump, will never be able to settle.&nbsp; They&#8217;ll never settle that war without our involvement.&nbsp; That&#8217;s why they did such a great job this weekend.&nbsp; That&#8217;s why Saudi Arabia did such a great job this weekend in hosting.</p>



<p>The United States has spent $200 billion more than Europe, and Europe&#8217;s money is guaranteed.&nbsp; They get their money back.&nbsp; It&#8217;s a form of a loan.&nbsp; Nobody knows that.&nbsp; I know that.&nbsp; I said, Why isn&#8217;t somebody saying, you know, we do it the same way?&nbsp; And we spent much more money.&nbsp; We have to equalize.&nbsp;</p>



<p>But while the United States gets nothing back &#8212; so, they get their money back.&nbsp; Its a loan.&nbsp; We just give our money.&nbsp;</p>



<p>And we had a deal based on rare earth and things, but they broke that deal.&nbsp; But we &#8212; they broke it two days ago.&nbsp; We had a deal, because I said, We&#8217;re spending $350 billion, and Europe gets their money back in the form of a loan and we don&#8217;t.&nbsp; We&#8217;re just giving the money hand over fist.&nbsp; That&#8217;s the Biden administration for you.&nbsp; But they&#8217;re no longer dealing with the same United States as they were dealing with a few months ago.&nbsp; Why didn&#8217;t crooked Joe Biden demand equalization?&nbsp;</p>



<p>And that this war is far more important to Europe than it is to us, and that there&#8217;s a very big, beautiful ocean as separation.&nbsp; This is &#8212; you know, we&#8217;re helping Europe.&nbsp; We&#8217;re trying to help Europe.&nbsp;</p>



<p>On top of this, Zelenskyy admits that half of the money that we sent them is missing.&nbsp; They don&#8217;t know where the money is.&nbsp; He said, Well, we don&#8217;t know where half of it is.&nbsp; That&#8217;s great.&nbsp; Wonderful.&nbsp; (Laughter.)</p>



<p>He refuses to have elections.&nbsp; Hes low in the real Ukrainian polls.&nbsp; I mean, how can you be high with every city is being demolished?&nbsp; It&#8217;s hard to be high.&nbsp; Somebody said, Oh, no, his polls are good.&nbsp; Give me a break.&nbsp; (Laughter.)&nbsp; Every city is being demolished.&nbsp; They look like a demolition site, every single one of them.&nbsp;</p>



<p>And the only thing he was really good at was playing Joe Biden like a fiddle.&nbsp; He played him like a fiddle.&nbsp; That&#8217;s an expression we use, Yasir, to say that he&#8217;s pretty easy.&nbsp; Pretty easy.&nbsp; (Laughter.)</p>



<p>A dictator without elections, Zelenskyy better move fast or hes not going to have a country left.&nbsp; Got to move.&nbsp; Got to move fast, because that war is going in the wrong direction.&nbsp;</p>



<p>In the meantime, we&#8217;re successfully negotiating an end to the war with Russia &#8212; something all admit that only Trump is going to be able to do and the Trump administration.&nbsp; We&#8217;re going to be able to do it.&nbsp; I think Putin even admitted that.</p>



<p>Biden never tried.&nbsp; Europe has failed to bring peace.&nbsp; And Zelenskyy probably wants to &#8212; maybe he wants to keep the gravy train going.&nbsp; I don&#8217;t know what&#8217;s the problem, but he hasn&#8217;t been able to &#8212; he&#8217;s very upset that he wasn&#8217;t invited &#8212; he could have come if he wanted to &#8212; but that he wasn&#8217;t invited to Saudi Arabia.&nbsp; But he&#8217;s been working for three years.&nbsp; There&#8217;s never been even meetings or phone calls to stop this war.&nbsp;</p>



<p>It&#8217;s a horrible thing.&nbsp; I figure Russia has lost 900,000 soldiers.&nbsp; I think that Ukraine has lost probably 700,000, and it&#8217;s a terrible thing.&nbsp; You&#8217;ll see body parts &#8212; bodies and body parts all over the field.&nbsp; All over.&nbsp; We see them through &#8212; very accurately through satellites.&nbsp;</p>



<p>I love Ukraine, but Zelenskyy has done a terrible job.&nbsp; His country is shattered, and millions and millions of people have unnecessarily died.&nbsp; And you can&#8217;t bring a war to an end if you don&#8217;t talk to both sides.&nbsp; You got to talk.&nbsp; They haven&#8217;t been talking for three years.&nbsp;</p>



<p>So, we hope to see a ceasefire soon and to reestablish stability in Europe and the Middle East.&nbsp; (Applause.)</p>



<p>But as I &#8212; thank you very much.&nbsp; And as I&#8217;ve said before, it&#8217;s my hope that my greatest legacy will be as a peacemaker and a unifier.&nbsp; That would be a great legacy.&nbsp; (Applause.)</p>



<p>So, in conclusion, the golden age of America is upon us, and I&#8217;m inviting everyone here today and every citizen across our land to take part in the most extraordinary period of peace, prosperity, growth, innovation, wealth creation, and expansion the world has ever seen.&nbsp;</p>



<p>We&#8217;re on our way.&nbsp; I mean, everyone is talking about us.&nbsp; Three weeks.&nbsp; We&#8217;re in there for a couple of days more than three weeks, and everyone is talking about it.&nbsp; You have to see the crowds of people outside.&nbsp; It&#8217;s pretty amazing what&#8217;s happening.&nbsp;</p>



<p>We&#8217;re on the verge of soaring markets, surging incomes, booming production, groundbreaking technologies, thrilling discoveries, and a quantum leap in the quality of life.&nbsp; Absolutely, a quantum leap.&nbsp;</p>



<p>One day very soon, our country will have the greatest economy in the history of the world, because we once again have a president who puts America first.&nbsp; And we put America first, and your country should put your country first, but in the end, we want America first.&nbsp; And when it&#8217;s all beautiful, which its going to be pretty soon, we want to help other countries and you want to help other countries.&nbsp;</p>



<p>But, you know, I tell your leaders &#8212; and some of the leaders are in this room right now &#8212; you got to put your country first.&nbsp; Whether it&#8217;s Saudi Arabia, whether it&#8217;s something else, youre going to put your country first, but we&#8217;re going to have plenty left over to help others also.&nbsp;</p>



<p>As long as you invest in America, build in America, and hire in America, that means that I&#8217;m fighting for you.&nbsp; I am fighting very hard for you.</p>



<p>Together, we&#8217;re going to make the United States of America bigger, better, bolder, richer, and greater than ever before.&nbsp; It&#8217;s going to be stronger than ever before.&nbsp; We&#8217;re going to be a peacemaker and a peacekeeper.&nbsp; We&#8217;re going to stop people from these stupid, never-ending wars.&nbsp; We&#8217;re not going to partake in them ourselves, but we&#8217;ll be stronger and more powerful than anybody by far.&nbsp; And if it ever came to war, there is nobody that will be able to come close to us, but we don&#8217;t think that&#8217;s going to ever happen.&nbsp;</p>



<p>So, I want to thank you all very much.&nbsp; It&#8217;s a great honor to be here.&nbsp;</p>



<p>And I think somebody said they&#8217;re going to ask questions, and I didn&#8217;t say, Gee, what are the questions, like Biden does.&nbsp; I say, Just ask.&nbsp; It doesn&#8217;t matter.&nbsp; You ask a question, and I give an answer.&nbsp;</p>



<p>So, I think, Richard, you&#8217;re going to come up and you&#8217;re going to give me some questions.&nbsp;</p>



<p>Thank you very much.&nbsp; (Applause.)</p>



<p>MR. ATTIAS:&nbsp; Thank you.&nbsp; Thank you very much, Mr. President.&nbsp; Please, a round of applause for the president of United States of America.&nbsp; Thank you.&nbsp; (Applause.)</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Thank you.</p>



<p>MR. ATTIAS:&nbsp; Mr. President, thank you for accepting to take a few questions.&nbsp; Twenty years ago, I don&#8217;t know if you will remember, we were under the same roof in Orlando, and you were delivering an amazing speech in front of 3,000 sales rep, giving them the best advice to be successful.&nbsp; So, what is the best piece of advice that you have ever received?</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Well, I think it was watching my father.&nbsp; You know, my father was a very hard worker, and he just worked hard and he was very smart.&nbsp; He had good genetics.&nbsp; His brother was the longest-serving professor in the history of MIT, Dr. John Trump.&nbsp; And my father was every bit as smart, but my father was &#8212; had to work.&nbsp;</p>



<p>He was older, and he put his brother through school.&nbsp; In fact, he once said, Boy, I put him through so much school.&nbsp; He had three different degrees, and they asked him to stay on at MIT.&nbsp; But my father was the same ilk.&nbsp;</p>



<p>And I noticed that my father was a happy man, and what he did is he worked.&nbsp; He just worked all the time.&nbsp; He worked, worked, worked, and he loved it.&nbsp;</p>



<p>And, really, I think the best piece of advice I got from that is you have to love what you do, and if you love what you do, youre going to have a happy life.&nbsp; If you don&#8217;t &#8212; I mean, I see so many people, they&#8217;re in businesses that they don&#8217;t want to be in.&nbsp; They&#8217;re in businesses that, you know, they&#8217;re bored in or they&#8217;re not good at, they don&#8217;t have a natural ability at it.&nbsp; There is such a thing as natural ability, whether it&#8217;s sports or acting or anything else.&nbsp; I mean, some people have an ability for something.&nbsp; Try and find that ability.</p>



<p>But you have to love what you do.&nbsp; If you love what you do, you&#8217;re going to be &#8212; at least you have a good chance of being successful.</p>



<p>MR. ATTIAS:&nbsp; Mr. President, it&#8217;s almost time for &#8212; (applause) &#8212; for an early dinner.&nbsp; So, if you are throwing a dinner party, and you can invite three fascinating guests, living or dead, who would you bring?&nbsp;</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Well, they&#8217;re all sitting right in the front row.&nbsp; (Laughter and applause.)&nbsp; Yasir, are you ready? Mohammed, are you ready?&nbsp; Steve Witkoff.&nbsp;</p>



<p>And we have Mr. &#8212; the most important person, at least until the World Cup is over, is here.&nbsp; Gianni, stand up.&nbsp; He gave the United States the World Cup.&nbsp; (Applause.)&nbsp; Gianni, thank you very mu- &#8212; I didn&#8217;t know you were here.&nbsp; That&#8217;s very good.&nbsp; He&#8217;s the king of soccer.&nbsp; That&#8217;s not bad.&nbsp; And you&#8217;ve done a fantastic job.</p>



<p>You know, but it&#8217;s very interesting, when I was president, I got the World Cup and I got all of the &#8212; you know, we have the 250 anniversary, so that fell in this administration.&nbsp; That&#8217;s a big deal: 250 years.&nbsp; But we have all of these things happening, and I also got the Olympics.&nbsp;</p>



<p>And I was called by the mayor of Los Angeles, Sir, would you call up the Olympic Committee because &#8212; it was at that time &#8212; President Obama will not take their phone call.&nbsp; And we&#8217;re going to get the Olympics in Los Angeles.&nbsp;</p>



<p>And, by the way, they&#8217;ve recommitted to Los Angeles at a level that &#8212; you know, I was very worried about that.&nbsp; And they&#8217;ve &#8212; the opposite.&nbsp; You know, somebody could have said, Well, we&#8217;re going to do it someplace else until &#8212; they have actually recommitted.&nbsp; They&#8217;re going to make it bigger and better than ever.&nbsp; So, I want to let you know that.&nbsp; (Applause.)</p>



<p>But I got &#8212; I had the Olympics.&nbsp; So, I got the Olympics.&nbsp; I got the World Cup, and I said &#8212; and the 250, but that one I didn&#8217;t get.&nbsp; But it was there.&nbsp; It was in this term.&nbsp;</p>



<p>And I ran an election, and we did fantastic in 2016.&nbsp; We did much better &#8212; millions and millions &#8212; tens of millions, but millions and millions of votes better.&nbsp; And bad things happened, and I didn&#8217;t get that one.&nbsp;</p>



<p>And I said, You know &#8212; when I originally signed the Olympics, I said, I won&#8217;t be able to even be president, and I got the Olympics, because if I didn&#8217;t &#8212; when I spoke with the people &#8212; the organizing committee and the people in different parts of the world &#8212; they asked me to do it because the president wouldn&#8217;t do it.&nbsp; I was president-elect, and I gave them a talk.&nbsp; I couldn&#8217;t get them off the phone.&nbsp; They were starving for love.&nbsp; And the bottom line: They gave us the Olympics.&nbsp;</p>



<p>And I said, You know, isn&#8217;t it sad I won&#8217;t be president?&nbsp; Then we had the election result, and now I&#8217;m president for the Olympics and for the World Cup.&nbsp; (Applause.)&nbsp; So, I&#8217;m very happy about that, Gianni.&nbsp; Thank you very much.&nbsp;</p>



<p>Thank you, G- &#8212; (laughs) &#8212; Ill be there.&nbsp; I promise, I&#8217;ll be there.</p>



<p>MR. ATTIAS:&nbsp; And, by the way, Mr. President, backstage, you have a gift from Gianni.&nbsp; He gave us the first ball with your name &#8212;</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Ooh &#8212;</p>



<p>MR. ATTIAS:&nbsp; &#8212; which will be played for the cup &#8212; World Cup in America.</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; That&#8217;s great.&nbsp; It&#8217;s going to be great.&nbsp; Thank you, Gianni, very much.&nbsp; (Applause.)</p>



<p>MR. ATTIAS:&nbsp; I doubt that any day you will take a sabbatical year, but if you could take a sabbatical year, Mr.&nbsp; President, what unconventional thing would you do?</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; What was the word?</p>



<p>MR. ATTIAS:&nbsp; Sabbatical.&nbsp; You don&#8217;t work for one year.</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Oh, sabbatical.&nbsp; I thought &#8212; thought you said sabbath.&nbsp; (Laughter.)&nbsp; Thats a big difference.&nbsp; It&#8217;s almost the opposite, when you think about it.&nbsp; Right?&nbsp; (Laughter.)</p>



<p>I think what Id do is &#8212; look, what I&#8217;m doing now is the most exciting job in the world.&nbsp; It&#8217;s a hard job, not an easy job.&nbsp; It&#8217;s a nasty job.&nbsp; It could be a lot easier with &#8212; you know, I &#8212; I think that the &#8212; the news media has to straighten themselves out, because people are getting it.&nbsp; You know, they &#8212; they&#8217;re losing tremendous popularity, and they&#8217;ve lost their prestige and they&#8217;ve lost their credibility.&nbsp; And I think it&#8217;s a very important thing, the news media, but I think they have to straighten themselves out, because the people are going around them.</p>



<p>Now, they have so many different things with &#8212; like Elon with X, which was a big &#8212; a big thing.&nbsp; And we have Truth, which has been fantastic.&nbsp; And we have so many other things that you don&#8217;t really need traditional.</p>



<p>But I &#8212; I will tell you that there is just nothing I could do to enjoy my life, whether it&#8217;s that or anything else that you&#8217;d ask, because this is the ultimate.&nbsp; I mean, I had to make a big decision, and it was a very risky decision, because if I would have lost, my life would have been a much different life.&nbsp; It would have been a very nasty life.&nbsp; They were going after me at levels that nobody has ever seen before &#8212; not Andrew Jackson, not Abraham Lincoln.&nbsp;</p>



<p>You know, the historians say that the president that was treated the worst by far by the media and overall was Andrew Jackson.&nbsp; In fact, his wife died of heartbreak.&nbsp; They were treated really rough.&nbsp; And Abraham Lincoln was second, but he had a civil war.&nbsp; You know, you can understand that.&nbsp;</p>



<p>But nobody was treated like me.&nbsp; Nobody.&nbsp; And I will tell you, you learn a lot about yourself.&nbsp; But there&#8217;s nothing I&#8217;d rather do.&nbsp;</p>



<p>I had to make a decision: Do I do this?&nbsp; Because if I lost, it would have been very, very bad.&nbsp; It was dangerous, actually.&nbsp; Very dangerous in so many different ways.&nbsp;</p>



<p>And I decided to do it.&nbsp; And I said, I have to win, because if I don&#8217;t &#8212; when I spoke to a friend of mine the other night, he said, You know, if you lost, it would have been very &#8212; it was actually Sean Hannity, just before we did the interview last night.&nbsp; He said, Boy, if you would have lost, it would have &#8212; you would have had a tough life.&nbsp; You would have had a very tough life.&nbsp;</p>



<p>So, it was &#8212; there was a certain amount of courage involved in this decision to run.&nbsp; And it&#8217;s a great honor to win by this much &#8212; to win all seven swing states, the popular vote.&nbsp;</p>



<p>Popular vote doesn&#8217;t get won that much by Republicans, for whatever reason.&nbsp; I think that&#8217;s changing, because, again, we&#8217;re the party of common sense and they&#8217;re the party of some real bad things.&nbsp;</p>



<p>And I think they&#8217;ll change.&nbsp; I think they have to change.&nbsp; It would be wonderful.&nbsp; I&#8217;m going to be having lunch with some of the Democrats next week, and it would be wonderful if we could work together.&nbsp; I think working together would be great.&nbsp; But they have to change.&nbsp; You can&#8217;t get elected on the programs that they want, and that&#8217;s one of &#8212; that&#8217;s really what America wants to see.</p>



<p>So, there&#8217;s nothing I&#8217;d rather do than what I&#8217;m doing right now.&nbsp; (Applause.)</p>



<p>MR. ATTIAS:&nbsp; When we started this conference &#8212; Mr. President, when we started this conference, Yasir and I, His Royal Highness Crown Prince told us, I want that to be the place where people will come to understand where to invest in terms of geographies and sector.&nbsp; So, what is the best investment you have made in your personal growth, Mr. President?</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Well, I was involved in real estate from, you know, most of my life and was &#8212; you know, guys like Witkoff will tell you I was really good at it and I was successful at it &#8212; very successful at it.&nbsp; I&#8217;ve been involved in things prior to being president, but during the four years &#8212; during the last four years, you know, I followed sort of the trends, and I&#8217;ve made a lot of money with following some of these trends.&nbsp;</p>



<p>And, you know, it&#8217;s &#8212; again, it&#8217;s something that you do.&nbsp; You &#8212; it&#8217;s &#8212; I really believe that some people have instinct.&nbsp; I think I&#8217;ve always had an instinct for making money.&nbsp; I make money.</p>



<p>And I went into show business.&nbsp; I had one of the most successful shows on television.&nbsp; I wrote books, and they were all bestsellers.&nbsp; Virtually every book a bes- &#8212; was a big bestseller, some really big bestsellers.&nbsp;</p>



<p>And so, I don&#8217;t know, its &#8212; whatever I do, I just want to make it successful.&nbsp; It&#8217;s very important to me.&nbsp;</p>



<p>There are many ways to make money.&nbsp; You can be in many different fields, and a lot of them is being in the right country.&nbsp; You know, if you&#8217;re in a certain country &#8212; our country was actually getting very bad &#8212; a very dangerous place, actually.&nbsp; Bad things were happening.&nbsp; But if you&#8217;re in a certain country, you have a chance to do well.&nbsp; And no matter how good you are, if you were born into the wrong country, you&#8217;re not going to make money.&nbsp;</p>



<p>Now, you can do other things.&nbsp; You can attain power, I guess.&nbsp; Maybe it&#8217;s the wrong kind of power, but it&#8217;s power.&nbsp; But being in the right country, where you have the right incentives and, you know, entrepreneurship, et cetera.</p>



<p>And America has always been sort of at the top &#8212; or one of the top, but always pretty much at the top.&nbsp; But it was losing that &#8212; it was losing that position and, I think, losing it rapidly.</p>



<p>This last administration &#8212; look, I don&#8217;t want to be &#8212; I wish I could say I &#8212; I wouldn&#8217;t have run if &#8212; if I thought Biden was doing a good job, if I thought they were &#8212; I wouldn&#8217;t have run, because, as I said, it was very dangerous to run in a lot of ways.&nbsp; In fact, my ear will show that when you look at it closely.&nbsp; My ear &#8212; I have that throbbing feeling every once in a while.&nbsp; But it was dangerous in a lot of different ways.&nbsp; But he was so bad that I had no choice but to do it.&nbsp;</p>



<p>If I thought he was doing a great job, I wouldn&#8217;t have run, and I would be very happy.&nbsp; I actually wanted him to do a good job.&nbsp; I was saying, Do this.&nbsp; Do that.&nbsp; I&#8217;m telling them do things.&nbsp; They should have done what I said.&nbsp; And &#8212; but I would have been &#8212; I would have been very happy not to have run and, frankly, to have seen somebody do a good job.&nbsp; But our country was going to hell, and I really sort of had to run.</p>



<p>MR. ATTIAS: &nbsp;If you were a historical ruler, would you prefer to rule during war or peace?</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Well, I &#8212; Id &#8212; I want to be, again, a peacemaker and I want to keep us out of war.&nbsp; But sometimes, to do that, you have to have a very strong country.&nbsp; You have to have a very strong military.&nbsp; And as I said, we have a much stronger military than anyone would know.&nbsp;</p>



<p>We have the best equipment, and I bought a lot of it.&nbsp; I rebuilt our military in the first four years.&nbsp; I rebuilt it.&nbsp; We gave a lot of it away to Afghanistan, to the Taliban, stupidly &#8212; but that&#8217;s a very small amount, relative.&nbsp; It was billions and billions, but it&#8217;s still a very small amount relatively to what we built.&nbsp; But I rebuilt &#8212; largely rebuilt our military.&nbsp;</p>



<p>Now I&#8217;m going to have to do it again, because so much has been given away, so much has been treated so badly.</p>



<p>And &#8212; but to keep peace, you really have to &#8212; I have a thing: strength through &#8212; and I mean it, you really have it.&nbsp; You have strength, and you need the strength, but it&#8217;s really peace through strength, because without the strength, it&#8217;s going to be very hard to have peace because you&#8217;re going to be taken over, bad things are going to happen.&nbsp; So, you really want to have peace through strength, and that&#8217;s where I&#8217;ve done it.</p>



<p>Having strength, having power, in that sense, to protect yourself and your people is a very important thing.&nbsp; Hopefully, you don&#8217;t have to use that power.&nbsp;</p>



<p>I will tell you, I was dealing with President Putin very successfully on denuclearization.&nbsp; We were talking about it very seriously, and then COVID came and lots of things came.&nbsp; And we had also talked to China about it.&nbsp;</p>



<p>Now, Russia and us have the biggest nuclear by far.&nbsp; China is not close, but they will be close.&nbsp; In three or four years or five years, they&#8217;ll be equal.&nbsp; But we were going to talk to China, and I spoke to President Xi about it very successfully.&nbsp; I think we were going to denuclearize it.&nbsp; We were &#8212; had to get the smaller nuclear powers, of which there are four &#8212; three, maybe, but four probably &#8212; to do something.&nbsp; We would have been able to do that.&nbsp; But I was having very strong talks with President Putin about denuclearization.&nbsp;</p>



<p>And, you know, if you&#8217;re president, you get presentations about what we&#8217;re building; what we&#8217;re having; the power of weapons; the power of many things besides weapons, per se.&nbsp;</p>



<p>When I saw the power of nuclear weapons &#8212; and we can never let that happen.&nbsp; If that happens, the ball game will be &#8212; the world will be destroyed.&nbsp; The power is so enormous.&nbsp; You look at Hiroshima, you look at Nagasaki &#8212; multiply that times 500 times, and the world would be destroyed.&nbsp;</p>



<p>So, you want somebody as your president or you want somebody as your leader that understands that.&nbsp; We just can&#8217;t let that happen.&nbsp;</p>



<p>We can&#8217;t let other countries get nuclear weapons &#8212; not only Iran.&nbsp; Iran is a good example, and maybe the one that people think about, but we can&#8217;t let that happen.&nbsp;</p>



<p>The power of weaponry today is so enormous that the world &#8212; the world would disintegrate.&nbsp; So, we can&#8217;t let it happen.</p>



<p>MR. ATTIAS:&nbsp; Mr. President, if you had to describe United States of America in just three words, what would they be?</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; In three words?</p>



<p>MR. ATTIAS:&nbsp; Three words.</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Love, respect, and strength.&nbsp; (Applause.)</p>



<p>That&#8217;s a tough question.&nbsp; That might be my best answer, Yasir.&nbsp; That&#8217;s &#8212; that reminds me of high school, that one.&nbsp; But that may have been the toughest question, actually.&nbsp;</p>



<p>Do you think Joe Biden could have done that?&nbsp; I don&#8217;t think so.&nbsp; (Laughter.)&nbsp; I don&#8217;t think so.</p>



<p>MR. ATTIAS:&nbsp; We&#8217;re almost at the end, Mr. President.&nbsp; But talking about United States of America, what is one cultural habit in the Uni- &#8212; in the U.S. business that the rest of the world could learn from?&nbsp; What is the best practice that (inaudible).</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Well, I think we love our families, but I think a lot of the world loves their families, you know?</p>



<p>I was speaking to the head of Mexico, because I complain constantly about people pouring in.&nbsp; Now our border is the strongest border we&#8217;ve ever had.&nbsp; We&#8217;ve gone from the worst border ever in history to the strongest border.&nbsp; But I was speaking to the president of Mexico &#8212; a very wonderful woman, actually &#8212; and I said &#8212; we were talking about drugs &#8212; You can&#8217;t let people come through your country and come into the country.&nbsp; You know, I was not that nice, but they understood what I was saying.&nbsp;</p>



<p>And she said something that really got me.&nbsp; She said &#8212; I said, Are you a &#8212; you&#8217;re not a big drug-taking nation?&nbsp; And she said, No, we are not a consumer.&nbsp; And I said, A consumer.&nbsp; What a &#8212; you know, an interesting word.&nbsp; We&#8217;re not a consumer nation.&nbsp; We&#8217;re not a consumer of drugs.&nbsp; I said, What an interesting &#8212; and why &#8212; why is that?&nbsp; He said &#8212; she said, Well, we have very strong family values.&nbsp; I said, But we do too.&nbsp; We do too.&nbsp; We have very strong &#8212; our families are devastated by what&#8217;s happening with fentanyl.</p>



<p>And China will not be doing &#8212; we&#8217;re going to make a deal with China.&nbsp; We&#8217;re not letting that happen anymore.&nbsp; And I had a deal &#8212; by the way, before I left, I had a deal with President Xi where they were going to give the maximum penalty to anybody making fentanyl and sending it into the United States, and their maximum penalty is the death penalty.&nbsp; And it would have stopped.&nbsp; But when the election turned out to be a rigged election &#8212; but that&#8217;s okay &#8212; when election turned out to be &#8212; it was an election that shouldn&#8217;t have happened.&nbsp;</p>



<p>All the &#8212; all the things that happened &#8212; I give you an example: We wouldn&#8217;t have had October 7th Israel attack.&nbsp; We wouldn&#8217;t have had Ukraine and Russia fighting.&nbsp; We wouldn&#8217;t have had inflation.&nbsp; We wouldn&#8217;t have had all of these things that, you know, happened.&nbsp;</p>



<p>But in speaking with her &#8212; she said about family values &#8212;&nbsp; I said, Well, you&#8217;re not really saying anything there, because we have great families too.&nbsp; We have great family values.&nbsp; She said, Plus, we advertise a lot.&nbsp; I said, Ooh.&nbsp; You mean you advertise about how bad drugs are?&nbsp; Yes, we do.&nbsp; We spend a lot of money on advertising.&nbsp; And I said, Unbelievable.&nbsp;</p>



<p>That was such a great conversation, because we&#8217;re going to spend hundreds of millions of dollars advertising how bad drugs are so that kids don&#8217;t use them &#8212; that they chew up your brain; they destroy your teeth, your skin, your everything.&nbsp; (Applause.)</p>



<p>And I thanked her for that.&nbsp; You know, I &#8212; I make so many calls, and I never learn anything from anybody.&nbsp; I know everything, and I never learned anything from anybody.&nbsp; (Laughter.)&nbsp; And I spoke to this woman &#8212; as soon as she said it &#8212; she didn&#8217;t have to say exactly what &#8212; I said, Exactly.&nbsp; What a great idea.&nbsp;</p>



<p>And I think we&#8217;re going to have a &#8212; and I saw pieces of it.&nbsp; We&#8217;re going to go in with $100 million and then another $100 million initially.&nbsp; But I saw some of the ads, and they are really violent.&nbsp; I said, You have to make them strong.&nbsp; Your skin practically comes off after a period of time.&nbsp; You lose your hearing.&nbsp; You &#8212; you lose your teeth.&nbsp; You lose &#8212; I mean, you &#8212; it &#8212; it is terrible, and we show this happening to people.&nbsp;</p>



<p>And I think we&#8217;re going to &#8212; you know, we &#8212; we did very well with &#8212; we had blue-ribbon committees, headed up by the first lady of the United States and a lot of other people that &#8212; you know, they have no idea the viciousness of these cartels and these people.&nbsp; And they&#8217;re smarts.&nbsp; I mean, they&#8217;re very smart, tough people &#8212; making a fortune, by the way &#8212; an absolute fortune.&nbsp;</p>



<p>But we got it down 18 percent, which was a record.&nbsp; But 18 percent is not great, when you think about it.&nbsp; I think we could get it down 50 or 55 or maybe even 60 percent with advertising.&nbsp;</p>



<p>So, she really gave me something.&nbsp; I &#8212; I was going to call her and tell her that she did, but now I don&#8217;t have to call her because she&#8217;s going to be seeing this right now.&nbsp; (Laughter.)</p>



<p>So, to the president of Mexico: Thank you very much.&nbsp; I appreciate it.</p>



<p>But we&#8217;re going to do a great advertising campaign saying how bad it is, how drugs are so bad for you.&nbsp; (Applause.)</p>



<p>MR. ATTIAS:&nbsp; My last question, Mr. President.&nbsp; You have mentioned briefly in your speech about the legacy.&nbsp; What would you like your legacy to be, if you can tell us more about it?</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; That I came into a country that was great but is in trouble, and I made America great again, and I got it out of trouble.&nbsp; And people respect America now.&nbsp; And we were a country of peace, and we brought peace to the rest of the world.&nbsp; (Applause.)</p>



<p>MR. ATTIAS:&nbsp; Thank you.&nbsp; Thank you very much, Mr. President.&nbsp; (Applause.)</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Thank you very much, everybody.&nbsp; Thank you.&nbsp; (Applause.)</p>



<p class="has-text-align-left">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; END&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 6:54 P.M. EST</p>



<p></p>
</div>
</main>

	<li class="wp-social-link wp-social-link-facebook  wp-block-social-link"><a rel="noopener nofollow" target="_blank" href="https://www.facebook.com/WhiteHouse/" class="wp-block-social-link-anchor"><svg width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" aria-hidden="true" focusable="false">

	( function() {
		var skipLinkTarget = document.querySelector( 'main' ),
			sibling,
			skipLinkTargetID,
			skipLink;

		// Early exit if a skip-link target can't be located.
		if ( ! skipLinkTarget ) {
			return;
		}

		/*
		 * Get the site wrapper.
		 * The skip-link will be injected in the beginning of it.
		 */
		sibling = document.querySelector( '.wp-site-blocks' );

		// Early exit if the root element was not found.
		if ( ! sibling ) {
			return;
		}

		// Get the skip-link target's ID, and generate one if it doesn't exist.
		skipLinkTargetID = skipLinkTarget.id;
		if ( ! skipLinkTargetID ) {
			skipLinkTargetID = 'wp--skip-link--target';
			skipLinkTarget.id = skipLinkTargetID;
		}

		// Create the skip link.
		skipLink = document.createElement( 'a' );
		skipLink.classList.add( 'skip-link', 'screen-reader-text' );
		skipLink.href = '#' + skipLinkTargetID;
		skipLink.innerHTML = 'Skip to content';

		// Inject the skip link.
		sibling.parentElement.insertBefore( skipLink, sibling );
	}() );
	
</script>

<style id='wp-block-paragraph-inline-css'>
.is-small-text{font-size:.875em}.is-regular-text{font-size:1em}.is-large-text{font-size:2.25em}.is-larger-text{font-size:3em}.has-drop-cap:not(:focus):first-letter{float:left;font-size:8.4em;font-style:normal;font-weight:100;line-height:.68;margin:.05em .1em 0 0;text-transform:uppercase}body.rtl .has-drop-cap:not(:focus):first-letter{float:none;margin-left:.1em}p.has-drop-cap.has-background{overflow:hidden}:root :where(p.has-background){padding:1.25em 2.375em}:where(p.has-text-color:not(.has-link-color)) a{color:inherit}p.has-text-align-left[style*="writing-mode:vertical-lr"],p.has-text-align-right[style*="writing-mode:vertical-rl"]{rotate:180deg}
</style>
<style id='wp-block-post-content-inline-css'>
.wp-block-post-content{display:flow-root}
</style>

.wp-block-group{box-sizing:border-box}:where(.wp-block-group.wp-block-group-is-layout-constrained){position:relative}
</style>

149.331 262.53 147.928 259.475ZM266.638 282.698V223.155H273.477V277.547C271.373 279.38 269.093 281.039 266.638 282.698ZM260.326 286.365C259.186 286.976 257.959 287.587 256.731 288.111C255.504 287.587 254.276 286.889 253.137 286.365V223.068H260.238L260.326 286.365ZM246.912 282.785C244.457 281.214 242.177 279.468 239.986 277.634V223.242H246.912V282.785ZM233.761 271.61C231.218 268.816 228.939 265.848 226.922 262.705V223.242H233.761V271.61ZM220.522 249.347C220.259 248.474 219.996 247.601 219.645 246.728C217.103 238.521 216.314 230.489 216.226 223.155H220.522V249.347ZM279.877 223.155H286.803V262.443C284.787 265.673 282.507 268.642 279.877 271.523V223.155ZM297.324 223.155C297.324 230.401 296.36 238.434 293.992 246.64C293.729 247.601 293.466 248.474 293.028 249.434V223.242H297.324V223.155ZM220.347 194.78C239.46 204.995 252.786 194.169 256.731 190.241C258.309 191.899 261.553 194.693 266.112 196.701C271.986 199.32 281.455 201.067 293.203 194.78C294.255 198.098 296.798 207.265 297.236 218.964H216.226C216.84 207.265 219.295 198.185 220.347 194.78ZM386.751 239.831L387.102 239.918L381.754 246.029L386.751 239.831ZM378.685 248.474L379.123 248.91L378.247 249.871L378.685 248.474ZM376.581 221.933L377.896 223.242L373.775 231.449L371.759 233.457L376.581 221.933ZM374.915 248.998L376.756 251.617L357.819 273.531L374.915 248.998ZM361.063 265.411L370.794 247.863L373.249 248.037L361.063 265.411ZM373.249 243.497L375.879 238.783L377.282 240.267L373.249 243.497ZM369.918 237.561L373.074 237.473L359.572 261.919L369.918 237.561ZM362.553 235.203L360.274 241.926L359.134 235.902L362.553 235.203ZM351.331 268.292L356.679 241.664L359.66 243.672L351.331 268.292ZM352.909 270.213L364.482 235.902L366.674 237.648L352.909 270.213ZM354.838 280.166L371.32 260.959L374.301 261.919L354.926 280.166C354.926 280.166 354.926 280.166 354.838 280.166ZM358.082 280.603C357.906 280.515 357.731 280.515 357.556 280.428L375.967 263.141L377.107 266.284L358.082 280.603ZM375.967 256.943L373.951 258.078L388.768 240.966L389.995 242.974L375.967 256.943Z" fill="white" />
<path d="M220.348 428.216C216.351 428.216 213.088 427.171 210.558 425.081C208.028 422.991 206.469 420.113 205.883 416.446H213.143C213.473 418.39 214.279 419.893 215.563 420.956C216.883 422.02 218.423 422.551 220.183 422.551C222.126 422.551 223.703 421.91 224.913 420.626C226.159 419.343 226.783 417.363 226.783 414.686C226.783 412.083 226.178 410.121 224.968 408.801C223.794 407.445 222.218 406.766 220.238 406.766C218.954 406.766 217.799 407.041 216.773 407.591C215.746 408.141 214.976 408.911 214.463 409.901H207.973L209.898 388.066H232.063V393.731H212.813L216.333 392.741L215.233 406.326L213.033 405.941C213.913 404.585 215.049 403.503 216.443 402.696C217.836 401.89 219.596 401.486 221.723 401.486C224.253 401.486 226.453 402.036 228.323 403.136C230.229 404.236 231.714 405.776 232.778 407.756C233.878 409.7 234.428 412.046 234.428 414.796C234.428 417.62 233.841 420.04 232.668 422.056C231.494 424.036 229.863 425.558 227.773 426.621C225.683 427.685 223.208 428.216 220.348 428.216Z" fill="white" />

	<div class="entry-content wp-block-post-content has-global-padding is-layout-constrained wp-block-post-content-is-layout-constrained">
<div class="alignfull has-wide-width wp-block-whitehouse-topper">
	<div class="wp-block-whitehouse-topper__inner-container">
		<div class="wp-block-whitehouse-topper__content">
			
							<div class="wp-block-whitehouse-topper__eyebrow">
					<a href="https://www.whitehouse.gov/remarks/">Remarks<svg class="wp-block-whitehouse-topper__eyebrow--icon" width="11" height="11" viewBox="0 0 11 11" fill="none" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">
<path d="M0.724808 1.45055C0.732563 0.940756 1.15149 0.539597 1.66097 0.554084L8.18243 0.73743C8.43709 0.74459 8.66622 0.854307 8.83047 1.02583C8.99471 1.19735 9.09441 1.43101 9.09053 1.68575C9.08278 2.19554 8.66385 2.5967 8.15436 2.58221L3.85933 2.46146L10.0157 8.89043C10.3703 9.2608 10.3618 9.84465 9.99583 10.1951C9.62987 10.5455 9.04621 10.5288 8.69154 10.1584L2.5352 3.72945L2.46984 8.02568C2.46209 8.53547 2.04316 8.93663 1.53368 8.92214C1.02419 8.90766 0.617659 8.48345 0.625575 7.97383L0.724808 1.45055Z" fill="currentColor" />
</svg>
</a>				</div>
			
							<h1 class="wp-block-whitehouse-topper__headline">
					PRESS GAGGLE BY <br>PRESIDENT TRUMP Aboard Air Force One<br>En Route Joint Base Andrews				</h1>
			
			
				<div class="wp-block-whitehouse-topper__meta">
					<div class="wp-block-whitehouse-topper__meta--byline-subcategory">
						
<div class="wp-block-whitehouse-byline-subcategory">
	The White House</div>
					</div>
					
					<div class="wp-block-whitehouse-topper__meta--date">
						<div class="wp-block-post-date"><time datetime="2025-02-19T16:34:27-05:00">February 19, 2025</time></div>					</div>
				</div>

			
					</div>
	</div>
</div>



<p class="has-text-align-left">9:00 P.M. EST</p>



<p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Hello, everybody.&nbsp; Hello.</p>



<p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Hello.</p>



<p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Hello, everybody.&nbsp;</p>



<p>So, you just saw this.&nbsp; (The president holds up a USA Today article entitled How America voted, which counties shifted toward Trump and a look at voter turnout.)&nbsp; This just came out, and I&#8217;d say that&#8217;s quite good.&nbsp; Right?&nbsp; By any standard, that&#8217;s quite good.&nbsp;</p>



<p>I shouldn&#8217;t leave USA &#8212; is anybody here from USA Today?</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Yesterday, we had someone from &#8212;</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Yesterday.&nbsp; We missed him.&nbsp;</p>



<p>Does everybody know Steven Cheung?&nbsp; He&#8217;s a sweetheart.&nbsp; You wouldn&#8217;t want to get in a fight with him, right?</p>



<p>Anyway, what&#8217;s up?</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Mr. President, the TikTok deal, any developments there?</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; No, there&#8217;s a lot of people interested in TikTok, and I think we have a chance of doing something good.&nbsp; And we&#8217;ll be speaking to China about that also, because they&#8217;re a party to it, obviously.&nbsp; But it would be great to keep TikTok alive, sell it to somebody that&#8217;s going to do a great job with it.</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Did you see the CEO today at the event, sir?</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Did I what?</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Did you see the CEO today at the event?</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; No, I didn&#8217;t.&nbsp; I didnt speak to him.&nbsp; Was he there?</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; He was supposed to be there.</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; I think so, yeah, but I did not see him.</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Sir, Elon Musk is proposing potentially giving money to Americans based on what DOGE is finding. &nbsp;Do you have any thoughts on that?</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; I love it.&nbsp; A 20 percent dividend, so to speak, for the money that we&#8217;re saving by going after the waste and fraud and abuse and all of the other things that are happening.&nbsp; I think it&#8217;s a great idea.</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; How much money do you think Americans &#8212;</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; It could be a lot.&nbsp; I mean, if it&#8217;s 20 percent, wed give back a lot of money to the taxpayer.&nbsp; And also, itd give an incentive for the taxpayer to go out and report things to us where we can save money.</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; So, you signed an immigration-related executive order today.&nbsp; Ho- &#8212; what do you think of ICE arrests right now?&nbsp; Do you think that they need to increase the number of people they&#8217;re arresting &#8212;</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Where?</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &#8212; increase the &#8212; the pace of the ICE arrests?</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; No, I think they&#8217;re doing a great job.&nbsp; You know, you have people that are hiding.&nbsp; They are professionals at hiding.&nbsp; That&#8217;s what they&#8217;ve done for a big part of their lives.&nbsp;</p>



<p>And they&#8217;re criminals.&nbsp; In many cases, very serious criminals, including murderers.&nbsp; And, obviously, they&#8217;re not easy to capture, but they&#8217;re being captured in record numbers, and they&#8217;re being brought out of our country, being brought back to where they came from.</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Mr. President, on Boeing.&nbsp; You mentioned maybe taking a different route.&nbsp; What would a different route entail?</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; On what?</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; On Boeing, with the Air Force One plane.</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; No, I&#8217;m not happy with Boeing.&nbsp; It takes them a long time to do &#8212;</p>



<p>You know, Air Force One, we gave that contract out a long time ago.&nbsp; It was a fixed-price contract, and I&#8217;m not happy with the fact that it&#8217;s taking so long.&nbsp; And we may do something else.&nbsp; We may go out and buy a plane or get a plane or something, but I&#8217;m not happy with the fact that it&#8217;s taken Boeing so long.&nbsp; There no excuse for it.&nbsp;</p>



<p>(Cross-talk.)</p>



<p>And, you know, they had a fixed-price contract.&nbsp; I made that deal, and now they &#8212; supposedly, they&#8217;re losing a lot of money and they&#8217;d like to see if they could, you know, up the price.&nbsp; But I make fixed-price deals.&nbsp; I don&#8217;t like time and material deals.&nbsp;</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Sir, the only other commercial aircraft maker that could make a plane that big is Airbus.&nbsp; Would you consider buying a &#8212;</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; No, I would not consider Airbus over Boeing, no.&nbsp; But I could buy one that was used and convert it.&nbsp; I could buy one from another country, perhaps, or get one from another country.&nbsp;</p>



<p>So, we&#8217;re looking at other alternatives, because it&#8217;s taking Boeing too long.&nbsp;</p>



<p>(Cross-talk.)</p>



<p>You know, they were supposed to be finished, like, years ago.</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Yeah.</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Years ago.</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Sir, and you &#8212;</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Don&#8217;t forget, I signed that contract during my term, and it was a very good contract.&nbsp; And I took, like, a billion six off the price, and it was supposed to be done, you know, quickly, and it&#8217;s a long time.&nbsp; Right?</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Would you push for your preferred color scheme for Air Force One?</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Oh, no, it&#8217;s going to be that color, yeah.&nbsp; No matter what, it&#8217;s going to be for that color.&nbsp;</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Sir, about Gaza.&nbsp; Do you e- &#8212; do you find the Egyptian proposal to redevelop Gaza acceptable?&nbsp; And does that change your &#8212;</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; I haven&#8217;t seen it.&nbsp; I havent seen it.&nbsp; When I see it, I&#8217;ll let you know.</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Sir, can I you about Ukraine?</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Yeah.</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; You &#8212; you said today that you had a deal on critical minerals, and Ukraine broke it.</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Yeah, we had a deal where we were going to get &#8212; look, you have to understand, Europe is being paid back the money that they put up, and they&#8217;re only putting up a fraction of what we&#8217;re putting up.&nbsp; I think they&#8217;re in for $100 billion, and were in for $350 billion.&nbsp; There&#8217;s no reason that should have happened.&nbsp; It&#8217;s Biden&#8217;s fault.&nbsp; He shouldn&#8217;t have allowed that to happen.&nbsp;</p>



<p>But on top of it all, they&#8217;re getting their $100 billion back, and we&#8217;re not.&nbsp; And I&#8217;ve been talking about this for two years.&nbsp; I said, You have to loan them the money so that if things work out, they&#8217;re going to pay you back.&nbsp; And they didn&#8217;t do that.&nbsp; So, Biden didn&#8217;t do it.&nbsp; It&#8217;s his fault.&nbsp; Nobody has ever seen anything so stupid.&nbsp;</p>



<p>So, Europe gets their money back, and they&#8217;re only in for a small fraction.&nbsp; And, obviously, everything is important, but it&#8217;s more important for them because they&#8217;re right next to Russia.&nbsp; So, it&#8217;s more important than &#8212; we have an ocean in between us.&nbsp; So, it&#8217;s obviously more important to the European countries than it is to the U.S.</p>



<p>(Cross-talk.)</p>



<p>But here&#8217;s the thing, we don&#8217;t get our money back.&nbsp; And we told them that the deal is we&#8217;ll do something for the rare earth and some oil, et cetera, et cetera, and that would be all right.&nbsp; And they agreed to it, more or less.&nbsp;</p>



<p>And then Scott Bessent actually went there and was treated rather rudely, because &#8212; essentially, they told him no, and Zelenskyy was sleeping and unavailable to meet him.&nbsp; He traveled many hours on the train, which is a dangerous trip.&nbsp; And we&#8217;re talking about the secretary of the Treasury.&nbsp; He went there to get a document signed.&nbsp; And when he got there, he came back empty.&nbsp; They wouldn&#8217;t sign the document.&nbsp;</p>



<p>But for Europe, they pay back their money.&nbsp; It&#8217;s a loan.&nbsp; Think of that.&nbsp; And we shouldve had a loan, too, but we had an administration that was incompetent.</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Can you resurrect that deal?&nbsp; Is there anything that you can do?</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Yeah, I think Im going to resurrect it, or, you know, we&#8217;ll see what happens.&nbsp; But I&#8217;m going to resurrect it, or things are not going to make him too happy.&nbsp;</p>



<p>And, look, it&#8217;s time for elections.&nbsp; They haven&#8217;t had an election in a long time.&nbsp; It&#8217;s wonderful to say, You know, we can&#8217;t have an election.&nbsp; But it&#8217;s time for elections.</p>



<p>And it&#8217;s also time to find out what happened with all the money, because he made the statement that half of it he doesn&#8217;t know where it is or something like that.&nbsp; And I&#8217;d like to find out: All the money that we&#8217;ve been sending to Ukraine, where is it?</p>



<p>And I can tell you we&#8217;re doing very well with Russia.&nbsp; We&#8217;re going to do something with Russia that he was unable to do.&nbsp; We can make a deal with Russia to stop the killing of, you know, potentially additional millions of people.&nbsp; The soldiers are being just wiped out on both sides.&nbsp; Wiped out.&nbsp; It&#8217;s horrible.&nbsp;</p>



<p>You know, the weaponry today is so powerful, so, you know, strong that its killing a lot of soldiers.&nbsp; And I don&#8217;t want to sol- &#8212; they&#8217;re Russian and theyre Ukrainian.&nbsp; I don&#8217;t want to see those soldiers killed.&nbsp; They have mothers and fathers.&nbsp; They have sisters and brothers.&nbsp; I don&#8217;t want to see them killed.</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Mr. President, on tariffs, you mentioned lumber.&nbsp; That&#8217;s something that I don&#8217;t believe we&#8217;ve heard before.&nbsp; Any specific &#8212;</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Lumber, yeah.&nbsp; Forest &#8212; forest product, yeah.&nbsp;</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; And do you have a rate in mind for that?</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; No, but were thinking about maybe 25 percent.</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; And would that also be April 2nd?&nbsp; On or before April 2nd?</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; In that vicinity, yeah.&nbsp; A little bit later.</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; And also, which car companies did you &#8212; you said that you spoke with some car companies.</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; I spoke to all car companies.&nbsp; Everybody is coming back into America.</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; So, these are foreign car companies?</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Including foreign companies, yeah.&nbsp; They&#8217;re going to be coming in, because they don&#8217;t want to pay the tariffs.&nbsp;</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; You said youll be having lunch with some Democrats next week.</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Yeah.</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Can you elaborate on who that is and what you all plan to discuss?</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Well, youll see when I do it, but some good ones.</p>



<p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Are you &#8212;</p>



<p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Some biggies.&nbsp;</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Are you con- &#8212; are you concerned about congressional funding?</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; No, Im just &#8212;</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Is that on the table?</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; I think we&#8217;re going to just talk.&nbsp;</p>



<p>I think it would be great if Republicans and Democrats could get along.&nbsp; It&#8217;s time.&nbsp; It&#8217;s time.&nbsp; It makes sense.</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Sir, would you say you trust the Russians to negotiate in good faith going forward?&nbsp; Do you trust them?</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; I do.&nbsp; I think the Russians want to see the war end.&nbsp; And I do.&nbsp; I really do.&nbsp; But I think they have the cards a little bit, because, you know, they&#8217;re &#8212; they&#8217;ve taken a lot of territory, so they have the cards.&nbsp;</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Mr. President, have you set a date for the British prime minister&#8217;s visit to Washington?</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; No.&nbsp; He&#8217;ll be coming soon, though.&nbsp; He has asked to come and see me.&nbsp; So, hell be coming.</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; What about Macron?</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; And president of France also.&nbsp; Macron will be coming.</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; But no set dates yet?</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Very soon.&nbsp; Maybe Monday.</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Mr. President, on congestion pricing.&nbsp; So &#8212; they&#8217;re going to be &#8212; its supposed to have saved about &#8212; or raised about $15 billion to help the MTA.&nbsp; Do you have an alternative way that &#8212; to fund the MTA system now that there wont be cong- &#8212;</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; No, thats up to New York.&nbsp; They have to do that.&nbsp;</p>



<p>Look, New York has treated a lot of people very badly.&nbsp; And it&#8217;s hard to &#8212; you know, it&#8217;s hard to feel sorry for what&#8217;s happened in New York.&nbsp; It&#8217;s sad to see the way they&#8217;ve treated people, and they continue to do it.&nbsp;</p>



<p>And, you know, look at what&#8217;s going on with the mayor.&nbsp; Look at what&#8217;s going on with so many other things.&nbsp; So, congestion pricing is not a good situation, and they&#8217;re treating the people of New York very badly.&nbsp;</p>



<p>That&#8217;s a &#8212; supposing you worked in a shoe shop or you worked in a restaurant as a waiter, and you have to come into Manhattan, and they&#8217;re taking, you know, many, many dollars out of your pocket.&nbsp; You can&#8217;t afford to do it.&nbsp;</p>



<p>And price &#8212; you know, you &#8212; if you take a look, traffic will go down because people aren&#8217;t going to come.&nbsp; If people don&#8217;t come, that means the whole place is &#8212; it&#8217;s going to be a disaster.&nbsp;</p>



<p>So, it could be, and it&#8217;s probably going to show that.&nbsp; Traffic will come down, but that means they&#8217;re not going to spend their money in New York.&nbsp; They&#8217;ll go someplace else.</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; (Inaudible) prepared to go to court if lawsuits ensue?</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Well, we&#8217;ll see what happens.&nbsp; You could give me the final, because I haven&#8217;t seen it as of late today because I was making a speech.&nbsp;</p>



<p>Did I make a good speech?&nbsp; Yes.&nbsp;</p>



<p>Okay.&nbsp; Go ahead.&nbsp; What else?</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Can I ask you about the Chinese?&nbsp; So, you know, eventually, you would like to meet with President Xi.</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Yeah.</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; But we heard &#8212;</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; I have very good relationship with President Xi.&nbsp; I think a great relationship with President Xi.&nbsp; But remember, he loves China, and I love the USA.&nbsp; So, you know, right there, there&#8217;s a little bit of competitiveness.&nbsp; But the relationship I have with President Xi is, I would say, a great one.&nbsp;</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; We heard that you &#8212;</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; It was obviously hurt by COVID coming in.&nbsp; It hurt them, hurt us, hurt everybody.&nbsp; Hurt the whole world.&nbsp; But outside of that, I have a very, very good relationship with President Xi.</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Are you looking to make a new trade deal?</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; I think he&#8217;s &#8212; I think he&#8217;s &#8212; I think he&#8217;s a very unique person.</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Would you make a new trade deal with China?&nbsp; I mean, you know, the &#8212;</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Yeah, its possible.</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; One trade deal never really got &#8212;</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; It&#8217;s possible.&nbsp;</p>



<p>Well, we did a great trade deal with China.&nbsp; We did it &#8212; great for the farmers, great for manufacturers.&nbsp; They had to buy 50 billion dollars worth of our product, and we were making them buy it.&nbsp; The problem is that Biden didn&#8217;t push them to adhere to it.&nbsp;</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Sir, do you think D.C. should govern itself, or do you think that governing of District of Columbia should go back to Congress?&nbsp;</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; I think that we should govern District of Columbia.&nbsp; It&#8217;s so important, the D.C. situation.&nbsp; I think that we should run it strong, run it with law and order, make it absolutely flawlessly beautiful.&nbsp;</p>



<p>And I think we should take over Washington, D.C.&nbsp; Make it safe.&nbsp; People are getting killed.&nbsp; People are being hurt.&nbsp; You have great police department there, but, somehow, they&#8217;re not utilized properly.&nbsp;</p>



<p>We should govern D.C.&nbsp; I think the federal government should take over the governance of D.C. and run it really, really properly.&nbsp;</p>



<p>And I like the mayor.&nbsp; I get along great with the mayor, but they&#8217;re not doing the job.&nbsp; Too much crime.&nbsp; Too much graffiti.&nbsp; Too many tents on the lawns of these magnificent lawns, and there&#8217;s tents.&nbsp; And, you know, it&#8217;s a &#8212; its a sad thing.&nbsp; You know, homeless people all over the place, and we got to take care of the homeless.&nbsp; But you can&#8217;t have that in Washington, D.C.</p>



<p>You know, when they come over to see me &#8212; like Macron is coming and the prime minister of UK is coming and all these people are coming over to see me &#8212; we&#8217;ll have, ultimately, President Xi, and we&#8217;ll have everybody coming, right?&nbsp; And you can&#8217;t let that be.&nbsp; You just can&#8217;t let that happen.&nbsp; You can&#8217;t have tents all over your beautiful &#8212; your once magnificent plazas and lawns and all of it.&nbsp; You just can&#8217;t do it.</p>



<p>(Cross-talk.)</p>



<p>MR. CHEUNG:&nbsp; We&#8217;ll do &#8212; well do a couple more.</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Sir, do you think you can still pay for extending your tax cuts without cutting both Medicaid and Medicare?</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Yeah, absolutely.</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; House Republicans are planning to make cuts to Med- &#8212;</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Well, I think we&#8217;re going to take in tremendous tariff money, number one.&nbsp; And number two, you take a look at DOGE, and you see what&#8217;s happening.&nbsp; We&#8217;re saving billions of dollars.</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; On DOGE.&nbsp; Do you know what they&#8217;re looking at, specifically, at the Department of Defense right now?&nbsp; And &#8212;</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Yeah, theyre looking at everything.</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; And are they going to cut more national security &#8212;</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Theyre looking &#8212; and we&#8217;re going to go into Fort Knox to make sure the gold is there.&nbsp;</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Are they going to cut more &#8212;</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Do you know that?&nbsp; We&#8217;re going to go into Fort Knox.&nbsp; Do you know about that?</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Sir &#8212; sir &#8212;</p>



<p>(Air Force One experiences turbulence.)</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; That was a bad bump.</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Are they going to eliminate more national security positions, civilians there at DOD?</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Well see what happens.</p>



<p>But one of the things &#8212; we do want to look.&nbsp; I mean, we hope everything&#8217;s fine with Fort Knox, but we&#8217;re going to go to Fort Knox &#8212; the fabled Fort Knox &#8212; to make sure the gold is there.&nbsp;</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Where would the gold have gone?</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; If the gold isn&#8217;t there, we&#8217;re going to be very upset.</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Can you bring us along?</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; You havent brought up Greenland in a &#8212; in a while.&nbsp; Are you seeing &#8212;</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; No, no, very &#8212; we need Greenland from the standpoint of national security and international security.&nbsp; We have to do something with Greenland.&nbsp; We have to protect Greenland.&nbsp; But we need it for national security, and we need it, maybe more importantly, for international security.</p>



<p>(Cross-talk.)</p>



<p>MR. CHEUNG:&nbsp; All right, we&#8217;ll just do one more.&nbsp; One more.</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Can I just follow up?&nbsp; Are you seeing it as part of any of the discussions you&#8217;re having with Europeans and Putin in some sort of peace deal?</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; No, no.&nbsp; We have to have Greenland because of the national security picture, even more so now than it would have been 20 years ago, 30 years ago, when they talked about it then too.&nbsp;</p>



<p>You know, they used to talk about it.&nbsp; Years ago, they were talking about Greenland, but much more so now with, you know, modern weaponry, planes and the speed of planes, and all of the things.&nbsp; So, we have to have Greenland.&nbsp;</p>



<p>Thank you very much.&nbsp;</p>



<p class="has-text-align-center">END &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;9:14 P.M. EST</p>
</div>
</main>

<script id="wp-block-template-skip-link-js-after">
	( function() {
		var skipLinkTarget = document.querySelector( 'main' ),
			sibling,
			skipLinkTargetID,
			skipLink;

		// Early exit if a skip-link target can't be located.
		if ( ! skipLinkTarget ) {
			return;
		}

		/*
		 * Get the site wrapper.
		 * The skip-link will be injected in the beginning of it.
		 */
		sibling = document.querySelector( '.wp-site-blocks' );

		// Early exit if the root element was not found.
		if ( ! sibling ) {
			return;
		}

		// Get the skip-link target's ID, and generate one if it doesn't exist.
		skipLinkTargetID = skipLinkTarget.id;
		if ( ! skipLinkTargetID ) {
			skipLinkTargetID = 'wp--skip-link--target';
			skipLinkTarget.id = skipLinkTargetID;
		}

		// Create the skip link.
		skipLink = document.createElement( 'a' );
		skipLink.classList.add( 'skip-link', 'screen-reader-text' );
		skipLink.href = '#' + skipLinkTargetID;
		skipLink.innerHTML = 'Skip to content';

		// Inject the skip link.
		sibling.parentElement.insertBefore( skipLink, sibling );
	}() );
	
</script>

<script type="text/javascript" src="https://www.whitehouse.gov/wp-includes/js/dist/keyboard-shortcuts.min.js?m=1739294330g" ></script><script src="https://www.whitehouse.gov/wp-includes/js/dist/commands.min.js?ver=33b90579e9a6d83ac03b" id="wp-commands-js"></script>
<script type="text/javascript" src="https://www.whitehouse.gov/_static/??/wp-includes/js/dist/notices.min.js,/wp-includes/js/dist/preferences-persistence.min.js?m=1739294330j" ></script><script src="https://www.whitehouse.gov/wp-includes/js/dist/preferences.min.js?ver=945c6cbfe821b3070047" id="wp-preferences-js"></script>
<script id="wp-preferences-js-after">
( function() {
				var serverData = false;
				var userId = "0";
				var persistenceLayer = wp.preferencesPersistence.__unstableCreatePersistenceLayer( serverData, userId );
				var preferencesStore = wp.preferences.store;
				wp.data.dispatch( preferencesStore ).setPersistenceLayer( persistenceLayer );
			} ) ();
</script>

=== SPEECH 9 ===
