							<h1 class="wp-block-whitehouse-topper__headline">
					INTERVIEW OF PRESIDENT TRUMP<br>AND ELON MUSK<br>BY SEAN HANNITY, THE SEAN HANNITY SHOW				</h1>
			
			
				<div class="wp-block-whitehouse-topper__meta">
					<div class="wp-block-whitehouse-topper__meta--byline-subcategory">
						
<div class="wp-block-whitehouse-byline-subcategory">
	The White House</div>
					</div>
					
					<div class="wp-block-whitehouse-topper__meta--date">
						<div class="wp-block-post-date"><time datetime="2025-02-18T22:29:35-05:00">February 18, 2025</time></div>					</div>
				</div>

			
					</div>
	</div>
</div>



<p class="has-text-align-center">Roosevelt Room</p>



<p>11:48 A.M. EST</p>



<p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Mr. President, great to see you again.<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Thank you very much.&nbsp; Thank you.<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; How are you?<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Thank you.&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Elon Musk.<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; MR. MUSK:&nbsp; Hi.<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Great to see you.&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; MR. MUSK:&nbsp; Thanks.&nbsp; Thanks for having me.<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; I&#8217;ve been reading a lot about you.&nbsp; I&#8217;ve got to start with this.&nbsp; So, he&#8217;s working for free with DOGE.&nbsp; He&#8217;s &#8212; he&#8217;s kind of put a lot of his life on hold, and you sued Twitter a number of years ago.&nbsp; You just made him pay you $10 million?<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; That&#8217;s right.&nbsp; That&#8217;s right.<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Thats &#8212; thats right.&nbsp; (Laughs.)<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Well, I sued &#8212; I sued from long before he had it.&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; MR. MUSK:&nbsp; Yeah.&nbsp; Yeah.&nbsp; (Inaudible.)<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; And, I mean, they really did a number on me, you know.&nbsp; And I sued, and they had to pay.&nbsp; You know, they paid $10 million settlement.<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; You&#8217;re okay with that?<br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; MR. MUSK:&nbsp; I mean, I left it up to the lawyers and, you know, the team running Twitter.&nbsp; So, I said, You guys do what you think is the right &#8212; makes sense.<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; I think its funny.<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; I think &#8212;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Because &#8212;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; &#8212; its a very low &#8212; I was looking to get much more money than that.<br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; So, you gave him a discount w- &#8212; in the lawsuit?<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; He got &#8212; oh, he got a big discount.&nbsp; I don&#8217;t think he even knows about it.<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; He&#8217;s become one of your &#8212; if you read and believe the media &#8212; hes become one of your best friends.&nbsp; He&#8217;s working for free for you.&nbsp; Hes &#8212;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; MR. MUSK:&nbsp; Well, I love the president.&nbsp; I just want to be clear about that.&nbsp;&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; You don&#8217;t care about that?&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; MR. MUSK:&nbsp; I &#8212; no, I love the pr- &#8212; I &#8212;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; You love the president?&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; MR. MUSK:&nbsp; I think &#8212; I think President Trump is a good man, and &#8212; and he&#8217;s, you know &#8212; I &#8212; I &#8212;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Thats the way he said that.&nbsp; You know, theres something nice about.&nbsp; (Laughter.)<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; MR. MUSK:&nbsp; No, it is.&nbsp; I, you know &#8212;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; It is.<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; MR. MUSK:&nbsp; Because, I mean, the president has been so &#8212; so unfairly attacked in the media.&nbsp; It&#8217;s truly outrageous.&nbsp; And I&#8217;ve sp- &#8212; at this point, spent a lot of time with the president, and not once have I seen him do something that was mean or cruel or &#8212; or wrong.&nbsp; Not once.&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; You know, I&#8217;ve known him for 30 years.<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; MR. MUSK:&nbsp; Yeah.<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; And I&#8217;ve never seen anybody take as much as he&#8217;s taken.<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; MR. MUSK:&nbsp; Yeah.<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; And we&#8217;ve discussed this.&nbsp; And Im like, How do you deal with it?<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Did have a choice?&nbsp; (Laughs.)&nbsp; I didnt have a choice.<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Well, you would say that to me.&nbsp; I&#8217;m like, What &#8212; what am I going to do?&nbsp; Worry about it?<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Thats the only thing I can say.<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; And, you know &#8212; and then culminating in two assassination attempts, which resulted in your endorsement.&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; MR. MUSK:&nbsp; Well, I was going to do it anyway, but that was &#8212;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; That was it?<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; MR. MUSK:&nbsp; &#8212; a precipitating event, yeah.<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; That speeded it up a little bit?<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; MR. MUSK:&nbsp; Yeah.&nbsp; Yeah.<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; The day of the assassination?&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Nice.&nbsp; I didn&#8217;t know that.&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; MR. MUSK:&nbsp; Yeah, it just &#8212; it sped it up, but I was going to do it anyway.<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Mr. President, with your indulgence, I&#8217;m convinced that people only know a little bit about Elon.&nbsp; I don&#8217;t think they know everything about Elon, because as I studied for and prepared for this interview, I learned a lot about you that I didn&#8217;t know.&nbsp; I think people will think about Tesla.&nbsp; Democrats are demonizing you and &#8212; and trying to make the country hate you.&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; I just want people to understand you a little bit better, and the person that you&#8217;ve gotten to know and have now put a lot of trust in.&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Sure.<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; And, you know, just &#8212; let&#8217;s go over a little bit of your bio, starting &#8212;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; MR. MUSK:&nbsp; Ah, okay.<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &#8212; with PayPal and how you became involved in Tesla and SpaceX and Neuralink &#8212;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; MR. MUSK:&nbsp; This &#8212; this could take a while.<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &#8212; and all these &#8212;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; MR. MUSK:&nbsp; I mean, you know, I &#8212; I think the way you think of me is, like, I&#8217;m a technologist and I try to make technologies that improve the world and make life better.<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; You can show them your shirt.<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; MR. MUSK:&nbsp; Yeah, and that&#8217;s why, like, my t-shirt says tech support &#8212; (laughter) &#8212; because I&#8217;m here to provide the president with &#8212; with technology support.&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; And now, that &#8212; that may seem, like, well, is that a silly thing?&nbsp; But actually, it&#8217;s a very important thing, because the president will make these executive orders, which are very sensible and good for the country, but then they don&#8217;t get implemented, you know?<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; So, if you take the &#8212; for example, all the funding for the migrant hotels, the president issued an executive order: Hey, we need to stop taking taxpayer money and &#8212; and paying for luxury hotels for illegal immigrants &#8212;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Its crazy.<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; MR. MUSK:&nbsp; &#8212; which makes no sense.&nbsp; Like, obviously, people do not want their tax dollars going to &#8212; to fund high-end hotels for &#8212; for illegals.&nbsp; And yet, they were still doing that, even as late as last week.&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; And so, you know, we went in there, and we were like, This is in violation of the presidential executive order.&nbsp; It needs to stop.&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; So &#8212; so, what we&#8217;re &#8212; what were doing here is &#8212; is &#8212; one of the biggest functions of the DOGE team is just making sure that the presidential executive orders are actually carried out.&nbsp; And this is &#8212; I just want to point out, this is a very important thing, because the president is the elected representative of the people, so hes representing the will of the people.&nbsp; And if the bureaucracy is fighting the will of the people and preventing the pres- &#8212; the president from implementing what the people want, then what we live in is a bureaucracy and not a democracy.</p>



<p><br> Q Yeah. You &#8212; you&#8217;re both aware &#8212; you have to be keenly aware that the media and &#8212; and the punditry class &#8212; not that &#8212; you know, I think you&#8217;ve proven they have no power anymore, because they threw everything they had at you, and they didn&#8217;t win. And that was, you know, the New York Times, Washington Post, three networks, every late-night comedy show, two cable channels &#8212; they &#8212; they just threw &#8212; they threw everything &#8212; lawfare, weaponization.<br><br> THE PRESIDENT: Its true.<br><br> Q And now I see they want you two to start &#8212; they want a divorce. They want you two to start hating each other. And they try &#8212; Oh, President Elon Musk, for example. You do know that they&#8217;re doing that to you?<br><br> THE PRESIDENT: Oh, I see it all the time. They tried it, then they stopped. That wasn&#8217;t &#8212; they have many different things of hatred.<br><br> Actually, Elon called me. He said, You know they&#8217;re trying to drive us apart. I said, Absolutely.<br><br> You know, they said, We have breaking news: Donald Trump has ceded control of the presidency to Elon Musk. President Musk will be attending a Cabinet meeting tonight at 8 o&#8217;clock. (Laughter.) And I say &#8212; it&#8217;s just so obvious. They&#8217;re so bad at it.<br><br> I used to think they were good at it. They&#8217;re actually bad at it, because if they were good at it, I&#8217;d never be president because I &#8212; I think nobody in history has ever gotten more bad publicity than me.<br><br> I could do the greatest things; I get 98 percent bad publicity. I could do &#8212; outside of you and a few of your very good friends. It&#8217;s, like, the craziest thing.<br><br> But you know what I have learned, Elon? The people are smart. They get it.<br><br> MR. MUSK. Yeah. They do, actually. Yeah.<br><br> THE PRESIDENT: They get it. They really see what&#8217;s happening.<br><br> MR. MUSK: Yes.<br><br> Q And at the end of this interview, I &#8212; what I would like is, I &#8212; I want people to know the relationship and know more about you.<br><br> What is the relationship, Mr. President?<br><br> THE PRESIDENT: Well, I respect him. I&#8217;ve always respected him. I never knew that he was right on certain things, and I&#8217;m usually pretty good at this stuff. He did Starlink. He did things that were so advanced and nobody knew what the hell they were.<br><br> I can tell you, in North Carolina, they had no communication. They were wiped out. Those people were &#8212; you know, they had rivers in between &#8212; land that never saw water, all of a sudden, there was a river and a vicious &#8212; like, rapids. People were dying all over. They had no communication.<br><br> They said, Do you know Elon Musk? And they didn&#8217;t really know I knew him. I said, Yeah. They said, Could you get Starlink? Its, like, the first time I ever heard of it. I said, What&#8217;s Starlink? A communication system that&#8217;s unbelievable.<br><br> Q I have it.<br><br> THE PRESIDENT: And he &#8212; yeah. And he said &#8212; I called him, and I said, Listen, they really need it. And he got, like, thousands of units of this communication, and it saved a lot of lives. He got it immediately. And you can&#8217;t get it. I mean, you have to wait a long time to get it. But he got it to him immediately.<br><br> And I said, That&#8217;s pretty amazing. And I didn&#8217;t even know he had it.<br><br> We watch the rocket ships, and we watch Tesla.<br><br> I think, you know, something that had an effect on me was when I saw the rocket ship come back and get grabbed like you grab a beautiful little baby. You grab your baby. It just &#8212;<br><br> MR. MUSK: Just hug the rocket.<br><br> THE PRESIDENT: Id never seen &#8212;<br><br> MR. MUSK: Everyone &#8212; right. Everyone needs (inaudible) &#8212;<br><br> Q You hug the rocket. You hug the rocket.<br><br> MR. MUSK: &#8212; (inaudible) rockets.<br><br> THE PRESIDENT: Yeah. No, but &#8212; and he said, You know, you can&#8217;t really have a rocket program if you&#8217;re going to dump a billion dollars into the ocean every time you fly. You have to save it. And he saved it. First time &#8212;<br><br> Q Thats ever been done.<br><br> THE PRESIDENT: &#8212; I&#8217;ve ever seen that done. Now nobody else can do it.<br><br> If you look at the U.S., Russia, or China, they can&#8217;t do it, and they won&#8217;t be able to do it for a long time. He has the technology. So, you learn &#8212; I wanted somebody really smart to work with me, in terms of the country &#8212; a very important aspect. Because, I mean, he doesn&#8217;t talk about it. He&#8217;s actually a very good businessman. And when he talks about the executive orders &#8212; and this is probably true for all presidents: You write an executive order and you think it&#8217;s done, you send it out; it doesn&#8217;t get done. It doesn&#8217;t get implemented. They don&#8217;t implement it.<br><br> They &#8212; maybe they&#8217;re from the last administration &#8212; and they are, in some cases. You try and get them out as fast as you can. But I could &#8212; as soon as he said that, I said, You know, that&#8217;s interesting. You write a beautiful executive &#8212; and you sign it and you assume it&#8217;s going to be done, but it&#8217;s not. What he does is he takes it, and with his hundred geniuses &#8212; he&#8217;s got some very brilliant young people working for him that dress much worse than him, actually &#8212;<br><br> MR. MUSK: Yeah, they do.<br><br> THE PRESIDENT: &#8212; they dress in just t-shirts. (Laughter.) You wouldn&#8217;t know they have 180 IQ.<br><br> Q Wait. Wait. So, what &#8212; hes &#8212; hes your tech support?<br><br> MR. MUSK: I &#8212;<br><br> THE PRESIDENT: No, no. He is &#8212;<br><br> MR. MUSK: I actually virtually am tech support.<br><br> THE PRESIDENT: Hes much more than that.<br><br> MR. MUSK: I actually am tech support, though. But thats &#8212;<br><br> THE PRESIDENT: But he gets it done. He&#8217;s a leader. He really is a &#8212; he gets it done. You get a lot of tech people, and you have people, they&#8217;re good with tech, but they &#8212; he gets it done.<br><br> You know, I said, in real estate, you had guys that would draw beautiful renderings of a building, and they&#8217;d draw the rendering, it would be great, and youd say, Great. When are you starting? But they were never able to get it built. They couldn&#8217;t get the finances. They couldn&#8217;t get the approvals. It would never get done. And then you have other guys that are able to get it done. You know, they could just get it done.<br><br> I was in real estate. Same thing in this. He gets it done.<br><br> So, when he said that &#8212; he said, You know, when you sign these executive orders, a lot of them don&#8217;t get done, and maybe the most important ones, and he would take that executive order that I&#8217;d signed, and he would have those people go to whatever agency it was &#8212; When are you doing it? Get it done. Get it done. And some guy that maybe didn&#8217;t want to do it, all of a sudden, he&#8217;s signing &#8212; he just doesn&#8217;t want to bothered.<br><br> Q Does &#8212; do a lot of those executive orders have to be codified into law to &#8212; do you need the Republican Congress to follow up?<br><br> THE PRESIDENT: Yeah, and they will. A lot of them will be. Yeah.<br><br> Q They will?<br><br> THE PRESIDENT: Look, in the meantime, we have four years. The beauty is, we have four years. That&#8217;s why I like doing it right at the beginning. Because an executive order is great. I mean, the one problem &#8212; its both good and bad, because when they did all these executive orders, Ive canceled most of them. They were terrible. I mean, we were going to go radical left, communist, okay? It was crazy. Their &#8212;<br><br> MR. MUSK: Really crazy.<br><br> THE PRESIDENT: &#8212; executive orders were so bad, if they ever got them codified, you&#8217;d never be able to break them. So, the damage that Biden has done to this country &#8212; and it&#8217;s not even Biden; it&#8217;s the people that circled him in the Oval Office, okay? &#8212; but the damage they did to this country, in terms of, let&#8217;s say, open borders &#8212; you know, there&#8217;s so many things, but open borders, where millions of people poured into our country, and hundreds of thousands of those people are criminals. They&#8217;re murderers. They&#8217;re drug dealers. They&#8217;re gang members. They&#8217;re people from prisons from all over the world.<br><br> And we have a great guy, Tom Homan, and he is doing so incredibly. You saw the numbers. They&#8217;re down like 96 percent.<br><br> Q Ninety-five percent.<br><br> THE PRESIDENT: He is a phenomenal guy. And Kristi Noem is doing an unbelievable job. And he wanted her. He said, She&#8217;s so tough. And I said, I don&#8217;t think of her as that way. You know, she&#8217;s very nice. He said, No, she&#8217;s so tough. And she is. I see her with the horses. She&#8217;s riding the horse. Let&#8217;s &#8212; (laughter) &#8212; she&#8217;s great.<br><br> But the team we have is &#8212; is really unbelievable.<br><br> But those executive orders, I sign them, and now they get passed on to him and his group and other people, and they&#8217;re all getting done. We&#8217;re getting them done.</p>



<p><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Let me go back a little bit to your background, because &#8212;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; MR. MUSK:&nbsp; Sure.<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &#8212; it&#8217;s beyond impressive.&nbsp; You were the chief engineer, for example &#8212; you were an early believer in Tesla.&nbsp; You became the CEO and &#8212; and then the chief engineer, which was phenomenal.&nbsp; SpaceX, same thing, which is unbelievable.&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; I mean, you were the first company &#8212; private company to send astronauts successfully into &#8212; into space, first private company to send astronauts into orbit.&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; MR. MUSK:&nbsp; Yeah.<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; That&#8217;s &#8212; that&#8217;s pretty deep.&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; He&#8217;s going to go into orbit soon.<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Okay.<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; MR. MUSK:&nbsp; (Laughs.)&nbsp; Yeah.<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; No, he&#8217;s going to go to Mars.&nbsp; He&#8217;s going to fly on his &#8212;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Starlink.<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; MR. MUSK:&nbsp; At some point, yeah.<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; As in (inaudible) &#8212;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; MR. MUSK:&nbsp; But they say &#8212; they always ask me, like, Do you want to die on Mars?&nbsp; And I say, Well, yes, but not on impact.&nbsp; (Laughter.)<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Star- &#8212; Starlink is in 100 countries.&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; This is going to be hard.&nbsp; I feel like Im interviewing two brothers here.<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; MR. MUSK:&nbsp; You go ahead.&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Starshield, which could be used for national defense.&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; MR. MUSK:&nbsp; Yeah, it is already being used for national defense.&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Then you have a &#8212; what is it called?&nbsp; Optimus, a part of Tesla.<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; MR. MUSK:&nbsp; Theyre a robot, yeah.<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; A robotic arm.&nbsp; Then you have an AI arm.&nbsp; And then you have something that really fascinated me, and it&#8217;s called Neuralink.&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; MR. MUSK:&nbsp; Yes.<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; You might help the blind to see and people with spinal cord injuries that they &#8212; that they can recover, where in the past &#8212; how close is that to becoming a success?<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; MR. MUSK:&nbsp; At Neuralink we&#8217;re &#8212; weve ha- &#8212; we&#8217;ve implanted Neuralink in three patients so far, who are quadriplegics, and it allows them to directly control their phone and computer just using their mind, just by thinking.&nbsp; It&#8217;s like &#8212; so, we call this product Telepathy, so you control your computer and phone just by thinking, and it&#8217;s possible to actually control the computer and phone faster than someone who has working hands.<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Then the next step would be to add a second Neuralink implant past the point where these &#8212; the neurons are damaged, so that somebody can walk again and so the pe- &#8212; they can have full-body functionality restored.&nbsp; And &#8212;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; And you like Bobby, right?<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; MR. MUSK:&nbsp; I like Bobby, actually.&nbsp; Yeah.&nbsp; I &#8212; I supported Bobby Kennedy.&nbsp; I think he &#8212; you know, he&#8217;s unfairly maligned as someone who is anti-science.&nbsp; But I think he &#8212; he isn&#8217;t.&nbsp; He just wants to question the science, which is the essence of the science &#8212; the scientific method, fundamentally, is about always questioning the science.&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Well, they didn&#8217;t tell us the truth about COVID.<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; MR. MUSK:&nbsp; Correct.<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; That&#8217;s for sure.&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; MR. MUSK:&nbsp; Yes.&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; And we learned a lot with the Twitter files.&nbsp; And that just, then, raises a question.&nbsp; You&#8217;re the richest man in the world.&nbsp; You may not like that part.&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Yeah.<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; You&#8217;re pretty competitive.<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; MR. MUSK:&nbsp; I mean, its neither here nor there.<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Ive known you a long time.<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; MR. <p><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Yeah.&nbsp; And my goal was to get great people.&nbsp; And when you look at what this man has done, I mean, it was something &#8212; I knew him a little bit through the White House. <p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; So, they sign a contract in a government agency, and it has three months.&nbsp; And the guy leaves that signed the contract, and nobody else is there, and they pay the contract for 10 years.</p>

<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; What di- &#8212; I&#8217;ve never &#8212; I&#8217;ve never met you before today.</p>



<p>MR. MUSK:&nbsp; Yeah.</p>

<p>You guys are really friends.&nbsp; I could s- &#8212; you guys &#8212; I could see you kicking up your shoes.</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Well, he doesnt do this kind of thing.&nbsp; And the way I figured that you&#8217;d get to know him is if I did it with him.&nbsp; I said, Come on, let&#8217;s do it together.&nbsp; He doesn&#8217;t do this.&nbsp;</p>



<p>I think he&#8217;s smarter not doing it, overall.&nbsp; Because, you know, I mean, he&#8217;s done very well without doing it.&nbsp; But he doesn&#8217;t feel it&#8217;s really worthwhile.&nbsp; He wants the product to speak for itself, or whatever he does speak for itself.&nbsp; But he views it as &#8212; you know, does it matter?&nbsp;</p>



<p>And I&#8217;m doing this with you today because I wanted to have people understand him.&nbsp; And I think it&#8217;s very important &#8212; I disagree with him.&nbsp; I think it&#8217;s very important that they do understand him.&nbsp;</p>



<p>He doesn&#8217;t need this.&nbsp; He doesn&#8217;t need it.&nbsp; Now, I happen to think it&#8217;s made him very popular.&nbsp; I think it &#8212; he&#8217;s more popular now because there are so many people &#8212; you know, you&#8217;re talking about the radical left &#8212; they have the lowest ratings.&nbsp; MSNBC is dying.&nbsp; CNN is dying.&nbsp; They&#8217;re all dying.&nbsp; The New York Times is doing lousy.&nbsp; The Washington Post is doing horribly.&nbsp; They&#8217;re all doing badly because people don&#8217;t buy it anymore.&nbsp;</p>



<p>But I think it was important that he do this one interview.&nbsp; You&#8217;ve been a very fair guy.&nbsp; I think you were the right guy to do it.&nbsp; If we could get some radical left guy &#8212; and hed do just as well, frankly, because it&#8217;s all about common sense.</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; They would attack him &#8212;</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; But this &#8212; Sean &#8212;</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &#8212; as being unconstitutional, not &#8212; a fascist.&nbsp;</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; &#8212; to me this was a &#8212; it was important for people to understand, he&#8217;s doing a big job.&nbsp; He&#8217;s doing a very thankless job.&nbsp; Hes doing a thankless job, but he&#8217;s helping us to save our country.&nbsp;</p>



<p>Our country was in serious trouble, and I had to get the best guy, somebody with credibility, because if he were just a regular, good &#8212; very good, solid businessman, he wouldn&#8217;t have the credibility.&nbsp; He&#8217;s got the best credibility for this.&nbsp;</p>



<p>And people also know he&#8217;s an honest guy.&nbsp; He&#8217;s an honest guy.&nbsp; He&#8217;s just a very, very smart guy who&#8217;s done amazing things.&nbsp; And this will be the biggest thing he&#8217;s ever done, because, you know, his companies are all great.&nbsp; But if this country goes bad &#8212; I guess where he is a little selfish is this.&nbsp; He knows one thing and probably doesn&#8217;t think &#8212; but if his &#8212; if this country goes bad, his stuff is not going to be worth very much, I can tell you.</p>



<p>MR. MUSK:&nbsp; Well, Id say, if the &#8212; if the ship of America sinks, were all go- &#8212; going down with it.&nbsp; You know, this idea that people can escape to New Zealand or some other place is false.&nbsp; If the central pillar of Western civilization that is America falls, the whole roof comes crashing down and there is no escape.&nbsp;</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; It&#8217;s amazing, since you&#8217;ve been elected, to watch Canada, Mexico, Venezuela, Colombia &#8212; I &#8212; I was shocked at the statements that Vladimir Putin made about you.&nbsp; I &#8212; I was shocked at the hostage release.&nbsp; I was shocked that Venezuela had done it &#8212; had done it.&nbsp; Zelenskyy wants a deal.&nbsp; Putin wants a deal.&nbsp;</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; All good statements.</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; King Abdullah was interested.</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; You mean by that all good statements.&nbsp; Look, they respect the president of this country.&nbsp; They respect &#8212; they did not respect the last president.&nbsp; They laughed at him, and they laughed at our country, and he&#8217;s done great damage to our country.&nbsp;</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Have foreign leaders told you what they thought of Biden?</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Yeah, they have, but I&#8217;d rather not say.&nbsp; They &#8212; they have.&nbsp; It&#8217;s not &#8212; it &#8212; look &#8212;</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; It&#8217;s the obvious.&nbsp;</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; He was not George Washington, let&#8217;s put it that way.&nbsp;</p>



<p>MR. MUSK:&nbsp; (Inaudible.)</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Not the greatest.&nbsp;</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Sorry, if that&#8217;s (inaudible).</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Hes done a tremendous disservice.&nbsp;</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Will you be here &#8212;</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; And, by the way, the Democrats have done a great disservice, and they ought to get their act together and use a little judgment, and they ought to work with us on straightening out this mess that &#8212;&nbsp;</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Who?&nbsp; John Fetterman?</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; &#8212; a lot of people have &#8212;</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Maybe?&nbsp; Who &#8212; what Democrat is not radicalized?&nbsp;</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Actually, you mention John.</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; John Fetterman.&nbsp;</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; He&#8217;s become the best voice in the Democrat party.&nbsp; You know, I had lunch with him, and I thought he was terrific, but he&#8217;s a much different man than he was before he had this difficulty.&nbsp; He used to be radical left, and I think he became much smarter, actually.&nbsp; He&#8217;s really &#8212; he&#8217;s really a voice of reason.&nbsp;</p>



<p>But the Democrats have to get together.&nbsp; They have to get their act together, because the stuff they &#8212; they talk about makes no sense.&nbsp; It makes &#8212; none whatsoever.&nbsp; And they must know it.&nbsp; They must know.</p>



<p>MR. MUSK:&nbsp; Yeah.&nbsp; I mean, like, the country has spoken very clearly and rejected the core tenets of the Demo- &#8212; Democratic Party.&nbsp; The country voted t- &#8212; fo- &#8212; I mean, the country made the &#8212; America has made its vote clear.&nbsp; The president won the popular vote decisively.&nbsp; The Republicans won the House.&nbsp; Repub- &#8212; Republicans won the Senate.&nbsp; What more do you need?</p>



<p>The Democratic Party needs to take a hard look in the mirror and &#8212; and change their ways.&nbsp;</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; I think they went from shock, denial, into the depression stage of grief, and now they&#8217;re in the rage stage, where I anticipate they&#8217;ll stay for four years, and if they get the chance, they&#8217;ll want to impeach him 10 times.&nbsp; Do you anticipate you&#8217;ll be here in four years?&nbsp; My last question.</p>



<p>MR. MUSK:&nbsp; I&#8217;ll &#8212; Ill be as helpful as long as I can be helpful.</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; That&#8217;s a good question.&nbsp; I mean, I was thinking about that just now.&nbsp; I said, I wonder how long he&#8217;s going to be doing it.&nbsp; You can&#8217;t get somebody like this.&nbsp; He cares, and he&#8217;s brilliant, and he&#8217;s got energy.&nbsp;</p>



<p>You need energy, also, in addition to those other things.</p>



<p>You know, I have a lot of guys that are very smart, but they have no energy.&nbsp; They want to sleep all day long.&nbsp; You need a lot of energy.&nbsp; He&#8217;s got a lot of energy.&nbsp; He&#8217;s doing a great job.&nbsp;</p>



<p>If there&#8217;s any conflict, he &#8212; he will stop it.&nbsp; But if he didn&#8217;t, I&#8217;d stop it.&nbsp; I&#8217;d see if there&#8217;s a conflict.&nbsp; I mean, we&#8217;re talking about big stuff.</p>



<p>But he&#8217;s under a pretty big microscope.&nbsp;</p>



<p>MR. MUSK:&nbsp; Yeah, seriously.</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; I mean, everybody is watching him.&nbsp; If there&#8217;s a conflict, you&#8217;re going to be reading about it within about two minutes after the conflict.</p>



<p>MR. MUSK:&nbsp; Exactly.&nbsp; There &#8212; there&#8217;s &#8212; the possibility of me getting away with something is 0 percent &#8212; 0.0.&nbsp; I &#8212; I&#8217;m scrutinized to a ridiculous degree.&nbsp;</p>



<p>And &#8212; and the other thing is that we &#8212; you know, what &#8212; what&#8217;s &#8212; you know what&#8217;s better than saying trust &#8212; trust me is just full transparency.&nbsp; So, what we&#8217;re doing with &#8212; with the DOGE &#8212; DOGE dot &#8212; just go to DOGE.gov.&nbsp; You can see every single action that&#8217;s being taken.&nbsp;</p>



<p>And now &#8211;and I want to be clear, we are going to make some mistakes.&nbsp; We&#8217;re not going to be perfect.&nbsp; Nobody bats a thousand.&nbsp; But we&#8217;re going to fix the mistakes very quickly.&nbsp; That&#8217;s what matters: not that you don&#8217;t make mistakes, but that you fix the mistakes very fast.&nbsp;</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; And you&#8217;re going to ask the other side, when they talk about, This is a constitutional crisis, you got to a- &#8212; what are they paying for?&nbsp; Where are those tax &#8212; because when you read off the list of things, it&#8217;s a big con job.&nbsp; See, when they talk Constitution &#8212;</p>



<p>MR. MUSK:&nbsp; Totally.</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; &#8212; its a total con job.</p>



<p>MR. MUSK:&nbsp; Yes.</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; They never talk &#8212; and I watch some of the shows &#8212;</p>



<p>MR. MUSK:&nbsp; Its specifics &#8212; they avoid specifics.</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Yeah, when you start talking about how did &#8212; how come they spent money on transgender here and transgender there &#8212;</p>



<p>MR. MUSK:&nbsp; Yeah, totally.</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; &#8212; and all the stuff in some country that nobody ever heard of, they don&#8217;t want to talk about it.&nbsp; They just talk about, This is a constitutional crisis.&nbsp;</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; It shocks the conscious.</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; The money is being squandered purposely &#8212; tremendous theft, tremendous kickbacks, everything &#8212; and we&#8217;re straightening it out.&nbsp; And thank goodness.&nbsp; I look up, and I say, Thank you, because I think if it went on for four more years, it would not be salvageable.&nbsp; You wouldn&#8217;t be able &#8212;</p>



<p>MR. MUSK:&nbsp; Absolutely.</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; You wouldnt be able to save it.&nbsp;</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; You believe, too, that when you were in Butler, came within a millimeter being assassinated &#8212;</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Yeah.</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; The day you endorsed him, that was that day.</p>



<p>MR. MUSK:&nbsp; Yes.</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; But you had been planning on it?</p>



<p>MR. MUSK:&nbsp; Yeah.</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Pretty &#8212; I think everybody will never forget that iconic blood on your face.&nbsp; Fight, fight, fight.&nbsp; I actually was afra- &#8212; watching it and thought you might drop again.&nbsp; You know, I didn&#8217;t know if it had hit you.&nbsp; You can sometimes get up and then the blood starts to accumulate.&nbsp; It was scary &#8212; pretty scary.&nbsp;</p>



<p>MR. MUSK:&nbsp; Well, I mean, th- &#8212; this is how you know someone&#8217;s true character, because everyone can say they&#8217;re brave, but the president was actually shot.&nbsp; Okay?&nbsp; Courage under fire.&nbsp; Fight, fight, fight, blood streaming down the face.&nbsp; That&#8217;s true courage.&nbsp; You can&#8217;t fake that.&nbsp;</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Yeah.&nbsp; Thank you both.&nbsp;<br><br>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Mr. President, thank you, sir.&nbsp;</p>



<p>THE PRESIDENT:&nbsp; Thank you very much.&nbsp;</p>



<p>Q&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Appreciate it.&nbsp; Elon, thank you for your time.&nbsp; Really nice to meet you.&nbsp;</p>



<p class="has-text-align-left">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; END&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 1:01 P.M. EST</p>
</div>
</main>

<script id="wp-block-template-skip-link-js-after">
	( function() {
		var skipLinkTarget = document.querySelector( 'main' ),
			sibling,
			skipLinkTargetID,
			skipLink;

		// Early exit if a skip-link target can't be located.
		if ( ! skipLinkTarget ) {
			return;
		}

		/*
		 * Get the site wrapper.
		 * The skip-link will be injected in the beginning of it.
		 */
		sibling = document.querySelector( '.wp-site-blocks' );

		// Early exit if the root element was not found.
		if ( ! sibling ) {
			return;
		}

		// Get the skip-link target's ID, and generate one if it doesn't exist.
		skipLinkTargetID = skipLinkTarget.id;
		if ( ! skipLinkTargetID ) {
			skipLinkTargetID = 'wp--skip-link--target';
			skipLinkTarget.id = skipLinkTargetID;
		}

		// Create the skip link.
		skipLink = document.createElement( 'a' );
		skipLink.classList.add( 'skip-link', 'screen-reader-text' );
		skipLink.href = '#' + skipLinkTargetID;
		skipLink.innerHTML = 'Skip to content';

		// Inject the skip link.
		sibling.parentElement.insertBefore( skipLink, sibling );
	}() );
	
</script>

	var userId = 0;
	var storageKey = "WP_DATA_USER_" + userId;
	wp.data

} )();
</script>

<path d="M220.348 428.216C216.351 428.216 213.088 427.171 210.558 425.081C208.028 422.991 206.469 420.113 205.883 416.446H213.143C213.473 418.39 214.279 419.893 215.563 420.956C216.883 422.02 218.423 422.551 220.183 422.551C222.126 422.551 223.703 421.91 224.913 420.626C226.159 419.343 226.783 417.363 226.783 414.686C226.783 412.083 226.178 410.121 224.968 408.801C223.794 407.445 222.218 406.766 220.238 406.766C218.954 406.766 217.799 407.041 216.773 407.591C215.746 408.141 214.976 408.911 214.463 409.901H207.973L209.898 388.066H232.063V393.731H212.813L216.333 392.741L215.233 406.326L213.033 405.941C213.913 404.585 215.049 403.503 216.443 402.696C217.836 401.89 219.596 401.486 221.723 401.486C224.253 401.486 226.453 402.036 228.323 403.136C230.229 404.236 231.714 405.776 232.778 407.756C233.878 409.7 234.428 412.046 234.428 414.796C234.428 417.62 233.841 420.04 232.668 422.056C231.494 424.036 229.863 425.558 227.773 426.621C225.683 427.685 223.208 428.216 220.348 428.216Z" fill="white" />
<path d="M188.02 427.666V417.216L188.35 416.116V393.511L191.1 394.721L174.82 416.556L171.685 413.971H199.625V419.636H168.605V414.191L188.24 388.066H195.335V427.666H188.02Z" fill="white" />
<line x1="261.93" y1="369.881" x2="261.93" y2="446.402" stroke="white" stroke-opacity="0.4" stroke-width="2.39129" />
<path d="M329.486 427.942C330.036 421.672 331.558 415.585 334.051 409.682C336.544 403.778 339.899 398.132 344.116 392.742L344.226 394.007H322.336V388.342H350.716V393.457C348.076 397.27 345.802 401.047 343.896 404.787C342.026 408.49 340.523 412.248 339.386 416.062C338.286 419.875 337.589 423.835 337.296 427.942H329.486Z" fill="white" />
<path d="M306.45 427.942V417.492L306.78 416.392V393.787L309.53 394.997L293.25 416.832L290.115 414.247H318.055V419.912H287.035V414.467L306.67 388.342H313.765V427.942H306.45Z" fill="white" />
